source_info.title: Chronic kidney disease
source_info.text:
【0】Treatment \- Chronic kidney disease
===================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Diagnosis
4.  Treatment
5.  Living with
6.  Prevention</u>

【2】**There's no cure for chronic kidney disease (CKD), but treatment can help relieve the symptoms and stop it getting worse.**

【3】Your treatment will depend on the stage of your CKD.

【4】The main treatments are:

【5】*   lifestyle changes – to help you stay as healthy as possible
*   medicine – to control associated problems, such as high blood pressure and high cholesterol
*   dialysis – treatment to replicate some of the kidney's functions, which may be necessary in advanced (stage 5) CKD
*   kidney transplant – this may also be necessary in advanced (stage 5) CKD

【6】Lifestyle changes
-----------------

【7】The following lifestyle measures are usually recommended for people with kidney disease:

【8】*   stop smoking if you smoke
*   eat a healthy, balanced diet
*   restrict your salt intake to less than 6g a day – that's around 1 teaspoon
*   do regular exercise – aim to do at least 150 minutes a week
*   manage your alcohol intake so you drink no more than the recommended limit of 14 units of alcohol a week
*   lose weight if you're overweight or obese
*   avoid over-the-counter non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), such as ibuprofen, except when advised to by a medical professional – these medicines can harm your kidneys if you have kidney disease
删除7：<u>Find out more about living with CKD and what you can do to stay healthy.</u>

【9】Medicine
--------

【10】There's no medicine specifically for CKD, but medicine can help control many of the problems that cause the condition and the complications that can happen as a result of it.

【11】You may need to take medicine to treat or prevent the different problems caused by CKD.

【12】### High blood pressure

【13】Good control of blood pressure is vital to protect the kidneys.

【14】People with kidney disease should usually aim to get their blood pressure down to below 140/90mmHg, but you should aim to get it down to below 130/80mmHg if you also have diabetes.

【15】There are many types of blood pressure medicines, but medicines called angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors are often used. Examples include ramipril, enalapril and lisinopril.

【16】Side effects of ACE inhibitors can include:

【17】*   a persistent dry cough
*   dizziness
*   tiredness or weakness
*   headaches

【18】If the side effects of ACE inhibitors are particularly troublesome, you can be given a medicine called an angiotensin-II receptor blocker (ARB) instead.
删除7：<u>Find out more about how high blood pressure is treated. </u>

【19】### Diabetes or high ACR

【20】If you also have type 2 diabetes or a high albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR) you may be offered a type of medicine called an SGLT2 inhibitor, such as dapagliflozin, as well as medicines for high blood pressure.

【21】Dapagliflozin helps to lower your blood sugar and can reduce damage to your kidneys.

【22】You may also be given an additional medicine called finerenone to take with dapagliflozin. Finerenone works by blocking the action of certain hormones that can damage your kidneys.

【23】### High cholesterol

【24】People with CKD have a higher risk of cardiovascular disease, including heart attack and stroke.

【25】This is because some of the causes of kidney disease are the same as those for cardiovascular disease, including high blood pressure and high cholesterol.

【26】You may be prescribed medicines called statins to reduce your risk of developing cardiovascular disease. Examples include atorvastatin and simvastatin.

【27】Side effects of statins can include:

【28】*   headaches
*   feeling sick
*   constipation or diarrhoea
*   muscle and joint pain
删除7：<u>Find out more about how high cholesterol is treated.</u>

【29】### High potassium levels

【30】People with CKD can develop high potassium levels in their blood, called hyperkalaemia, because their kidneys do not work properly.

【31】Hyperkalaemia can cause muscle weakness, stiffness and tiredness. If it becomes severe, it can cause an irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia) which can lead to a heart attack.

【32】If you have CKD, it's important to avoid taking potassium supplements and some medicines used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure because they can make your potassium levels too high. Talk to a GP about the medicines you take if you're worried.

【33】A medicine called sodium zirconium cyclosilicate can be used to treat hyperkalaemia in adults, but only if it's used:

【34】*   in emergency care for acute life-threatening hyperkalaemia alongside standard care
*   in people with hyperkalaemia that does not get better, CKD stage 3b to 5, or heart failure

【35】People with hyperkalaemia that does not get better (called persistent CKD) who also have CKD stage 3b to 5, or heart failure, should only take sodium zirconium cyclosilicate if they:

【36】*   have a serum potassium level of at least 6.0 mmol/litre and
*   are not also taking a certain amount of renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (RAAS) inhibitor because of hyperkalaemia and
*   are not on dialysis

【37】You should stop taking sodium zirconium cyclosilicate if RAAS inhibitors are no longer suitable for you.

【38】### Water retention

【39】You may get swelling in your ankles, feet and hands if you have kidney disease.

【40】This is because your kidneys are not as effective at removing fluid from your blood, causing it to build up in body tissues (oedema).

【41】You may be advised to reduce your daily salt and fluid intake, including fluids in food such as soups and yoghurts, to help reduce the swelling.

【42】In some cases you may also be given diuretics (tablets to help you pee more), such as furosemide.

【43】Side effects of diuretics can include dehydration and reduced levels of sodium and potassium in the blood.

【44】### Anaemia

【45】Many people with advanced-stage CKD develop anaemia, which is a lack of red blood cells.

【46】Symptoms of anaemia include:

【47】*   tiredness
*   lack of energy
*   shortness of breath
*   a pounding, fluttering or irregular heartbeat (palpitations)

【48】If you have anaemia, you may be given injections of a medicine called erythropoietin. This is a hormone that helps your body produce more red blood cells.

【49】If you have an iron deficiency as well, iron supplements may also be recommended.
删除7：<u>Find out more about how iron deficiency anaemia is treated.</u>

【50】If you have anaemia but do not have iron deficiency, you may be given a medicine called Roxadustat. This medicine helps your body to produce more red blood cells and comes as tablets.
删除6：<u>#### Want to know more? 

【51】*   National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE): treating anaemia in people with chronic kidney disease

【52】</u>
### Bone problems

【53】If your kidneys are severely damaged, you can get a build-up of phosphate in your body because your kidneys cannot get rid of it.

【54】Along with calcium, phosphate is important for maintaining healthy bones. But if your phosphate level rises too much, it can upset the balance of calcium in your body and lead to thinning of the bones.

【55】You may be advised to limit the amount food you eat which are high in phosphate, such as red meat, dairy products, eggs and fish.

【56】If this does not lower your phosphate level enough, you may be given medicines called phosphate binders. Commonly used medicines include calcium acetate and calcium carbonate.

【57】Some people with CKD also have low levels of vitamin D, which is necessary for healthy bones.

【58】If you're low in vitamin D, you may be given a supplement called colecalciferol or ergocalciferol to boost your vitamin D level. 

【59】### Glomerulonephritis

【60】Kidney disease can be caused by inflammation of the filters inside the kidneys, known as glomerulonephritis.

【61】In some cases this happens as a result of the immune system mistakenly attacking the kidneys.

【62】If a kidney biopsy finds this is the cause of your kidney problems, you may be prescribed medicine to reduce the activity of your immune system, such as a steroid or a medicine called cyclophosphamide.
删除6：<u>#### Want to know more?

【63】*   Kidney Care UK: medicines for chronic kidney disease

【64】**Improving muscle strength**
</u>
-----------------------------

【65】If you are having a bad flare-up and are unable to exercise, you may be offered electrical stimulation to make your muscles stronger.

【66】This is where electrodes are placed on your skin and small electrical impulses are sent to weak muscles, usually in your arms or legs.

【67】Dialysis
--------

【68】For a small proportion of people with CKD, the kidneys will eventually stop working.

【69】This usually happens gradually, so there should be time to plan the next stage of your treatment.

【70】One of the options when CKD reaches this stage is dialysis. This is a method of removing waste products and excess fluid from the blood.

【71】There are 2 main types of dialysis:

【72】*   haemodialysis – this involves diverting blood into an external machine, where it's filtered before being returned to the body
*   peritoneal dialysis – this involves pumping dialysis fluid into a space inside your tummy to draw out waste products from the blood as they pass through vessels lining the inside of your tummy

【73】Haemodialysis is usually done about 3 times a week, either at hospital or at home. Peritoneal dialysis is normally done at home several times a day, or overnight.

【74】If you don't have a kidney transplant, treatment with dialysis will usually need to be lifelong.

【75】Talk to your doctor about the pros and cons of each type of dialysis and which type you would prefer if your kidney function becomes severely reduced.
删除6：<u>### Want to know more?

【76】*  删除7：<u>Find out more about dialysis</u>
*   Kidney Patient Guide: treating kidney failure with dialysis
*   Kidney Care UK: dialysis

【77】</u>
Kidney transplant
-----------------

【78】An alternative to dialysis for people with severely reduced kidney function is a kidney transplant.

【79】This is often the most effective treatment for advanced kidney disease, but it involves major surgery and taking medicines (immunosuppressants) for the rest of your life to stop your body attacking the donor organ.

【80】You can live with one kidney, which means donor kidneys can come from living or recently deceased donors. 

【81】But there's still a shortage of donors, and you could wait months or years for a transplant.

【82】You may need to have dialysis while you wait for a transplant.

【83】Survival rates for kidney transplants are very good. About 90% of transplants still function after 5 years and many work usefully after 10 years or more.
删除6：<u>### Want to know more?

【84】*  删除7：<u>Find out more about kidney transplants</u>
*   Kidney Patient Guide: transplants
*   Kidney Care UK: kidney transplant

【85】</u>
Supportive treatment
--------------------

【86】You'll be offered supportive treatment if you decide not to have dialysis or a transplant for kidney failure, or they're not suitable for you. This is also called palliative or conservative care.

【87】The aim is to treat and control the symptoms of kidney failure. It includes medical, psychological and practical care for both the person with kidney failure and their family, including discussion about how you feel and planning for the end of life.

【88】Many people choose supportive treatment because they:

【89】*   are unlikely to benefit from or have a good quality of life with treatment
*   do not want to go through the inconvenience of treatment with dialysis
*   are advised against dialysis because they have other serious illnesses, and the negative aspects of treatment outweigh any likely benefits
*   have been on dialysis, but have decided to stop this treatment
*   are being treated with dialysis, but have another serious illness, such as severe heart disease or stroke, that will shorten their life

【90】Supportive care through the kidney unit can still help you to live for some time with a good quality of life.

【91】Doctors and nurses will make sure you receive:

【92】*   medicines to protect your remaining kidney function for as long as possible
*   medicines to treat other symptoms of kidney failure, such as feeling out of breath, anaemia, loss of appetite or itchy skin
*   help to plan your home and money affairs
*   bereavement support for your family
删除6：<u>### Want to know more?

【93】*   Cruse Bereavement Care
*   Kidney Patient Guide: the emotional effects of kidney failure
*   Kidney Research UK: information on choosing not to start dialysis
*   Kidney Care UK: deciding not to have dialysis (conservative treatment)
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 22 March 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 22 March 2026</u>
</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Diagnosis</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Living with</u>

source_info.title: Burns and scalds
source_info.text:
【0】Prevention \- Burns and scalds
==============================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Treatment
3.  Recovery
4.  Complications
5.  Prevention</u>

【2】**Many severe burns and scalds affect babies and young children. The following advice can help reduce the likelihood of your child having a serious accident.**

【3】In the kitchen
--------------

【4】*   it's best to keep your toddler out of the kitchen, well away from kettles, saucepans and hot oven doors – you could put a safety gate across the doorway to stop them getting in
*   use a kettle with a short or curly cord to stop it hanging over the edge of the work surface, where it could be grabbed
*   when cooking, use the rings at the back of the cooker and turn saucepan handles towards the back so your child can't grab them

【5】In the bathroom
---------------

【6】*   never leave a child alone in the bath, even for a moment
*   fit a thermostatic mixing valve to your bath's hot tap to control the temperature
*   put cold water into the bath first, then add the hot water – use your elbow to test the temperature of the water before you put your baby or toddler in the bath

【7】Throughout the home
-------------------

【8】*   put your iron, hair straighteners or curling tongs out of reach while they cool down after you have finished using them
*   fit fireguards to all fires and heaters
*   keep matches, lighters and lit candles out of young children's sight and reach

【9】Hot drinks
----------

【10】*   keep hot drinks well away from young children – a hot drink can still scald 15 minutes after it was made
*   put hot drinks down before you hold your baby
*   after warming a bottle of milk, shake the bottle well and test the temperature of the milk by placing a few drops on the inside of your wrist before feeding – it should feel lukewarm, not hot
*   do not let your child drink a hot drink through a straw

【11】Preventing sunburn
------------------

【12】*   encourage your child to play in the shade (under trees, for example) especially between 11am and 3pm, when the sun is at its strongest
*   keep babies under the age of 6 months out of direct sunlight, especially around midday
*   cover your child up in loose, baggy cotton clothes, such as an oversized T-shirt with sleeves
*   get your child to wear a floppy hat with a wide brim that shades their face and neck
*   cover exposed parts of your child's skin with sunscreen, even on cloudy or overcast days – most sunscreens designed for children have a sun protection factor (SPF) of between 30 and 50 and are effective against UVA and UVB
*   reapply sunscreen often throughout the day – even water-resistant sunscreens should be reapplied after you come out of the water
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 23 June 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 23 June 2025</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Complications</u>

source_info.title: Lidocaine for mouth and throat
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of lidocaine for mouth and throat \- Brand names: Bonjela, Anbesol, Iglu, Calgel, Covonia
======================================================================================================

【1】Common side effects
-------------------

【2】Lidocaine mouth and throat treatments are generally very safe. People rarely have any side effects.

【3】However, as with all medicines, it's possible to be unexpectedly allergic to lidocaine.

【4】Serious allergic reaction
-------------------------

【5】It's extremely rare to have an allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) to lidocaine.

【6】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【7】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【8】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【9】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【10】Other side effects
------------------

【11】These are not all the side effects of lidocaine. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicine packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【12】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Lidocaine for mouth and throat
--------------------------------------

【13】*   About lidocaine for mouth and throat
*   Who can and cannot use it
*   How and when to use it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Using it with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 30 August 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 30 August 2025</u>

source_info.title: Mebendazole
source_info.text:
【0】About mebendazole \- Brand names: Ovex, Vermox
==============================================

【1】Mebendazole is a type of medicine for treating worms.

【2】It's used mainly for infections of the gut such as threadworms (sometimes known as pinworms) and other less common worm infections (whipworm, roundworm and hookworm).

【3】It works by stopping worms from using sugar (glucose) to live. This kills the worms.

【4】You can buy mebendazole from a pharmacy for adults and children aged 2 years and over. It's also available on prescription for children aged 6 months and over.

【5】It comes as chewable tablets or a liquid that you swallow.

【6】Key facts
---------

【7】*   You'll usually take mebendazole as a single dose to treat threadworms, but you might need to take it for around 3 days for some other types of worm infection.
*   It starts to work straight away but it may take several days to kill all the worms.
*   Mebendazole kills worms but not their eggs. You may need to take a second dose after 2 weeks. It's also important to have good personal hygiene to help stop the worms coming back.
*   The most common side effect is stomach pain.

【8】A doctor or pharmacist may also advise that everyone in your house is treated with mebendazole.
删除11：<u>More in Mebendazole
-------------------

【9】*   About mebendazole
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking mebendazole with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 4 August 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 4 August 2025</u>

source_info.title: Lung cancer
source_info.text:
【0】Causes \- Lung cancer
=====================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Living with
7.  Prevention</u>

【2】**Most cases of lung cancer are caused by smoking, although people who have never smoked can also develop the condition.**

【3】Smoking
-------

【4】Smoking cigarettes is the single biggest risk factor for lung cancer. It's responsible for more than 7 out of 10 cases.

【5】Tobacco smoke contains more than 60 different toxic substances, which are known to be carcinogenic (cancer-producing).

【6】If you smoke more than 25 cigarettes a day, you are 25 times more likely to get lung cancer than someone who does not smoke.

【7】Frequent exposure to other people’s tobacco smoke (passive smoking) can also increase your risk of developing lung cancer.

【8】While smoking cigarettes is the biggest risk factor, using other types of tobacco products can also increase your risk of developing lung cancer and other types of cancer, such as oesophageal cancer and mouth cancer.

【9】These products include:

【10】*   cigars
*   pipe tobacco
*   snuff (a powdered form of tobacco)
*   chewing tobacco

【11】Smoking cannabis may also increase the risk of developing lung cancer. Most people who smoke cannabis mix it with tobacco. While they tend to smoke less tobacco than people who smoke regular cigarettes, they usually inhale more deeply and hold the smoke in their lungs for longer.

【12】Radon
-----

【13】Radon is a natural radioactive gas that comes from tiny amounts of uranium present in all rocks and soils. It can sometimes be found in buildings.

【14】If radon is breathed in, it can damage your lungs, particularly if you smoke. Radon gas causes a small number of lung cancer deaths in England.

【15】Occupational exposure and pollution
-----------------------------------

【16】Exposure to certain chemicals and substances which are used in several occupations and industries may increase your risk of developing lung cancer. These chemicals and substances include:

【17】*   arsenic
*   asbestos
*   beryllium
*   cadmium
*   coal and coke fumes
*   silica
*   nickel
删除7：<u>Find out more about asbestosis and silicosis.</u>

【18】Research has also found that frequently being exposed to diesel fumes over many years increases your risk of developing lung cancer.
删除6：<u>**Want to know more?**

【19】*   Cancer Research UK: smoking, tobacco and cancer
*   Macmillan: causes and risk factors of lung cancer
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 01 November 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 01 November 2025</u>
</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Symptoms</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Diagnosis</u>

source_info.title: Pubic lice
source_info.text:
【0】Pubic lice
==========

【1】**Pubic lice are tiny insects that can live on body hair, especially the pubic hair around the penis or vagina. They're spread through close body contact, most commonly through sexual contact.**

【2】Pubic lice are sometimes also called crabs.

【3】Check if you have pubic lice
----------------------------

【4】Pubic lice are very small (2mm long) and grey-brown in colour.

【5】They can be hard to spot, but sometimes you may be able to see them in your hair.

【6】They most often live on pubic hair around the penis or vagina, but can also be found in hair on the chest, armpits, face and eyelashes. They do not affect hair on the head.

【7】Other symptoms of pubic lice include:

【8】*   itching, which is usually worse at night
*   small red or blue spots on your skin (lice bites)
*   white/yellow dots attached to your hair (lice eggs)
*   dark red or brown spots in your underwear (lice poo)
*   crusted or sticky eyelashes, if they're affected

【9】Non-urgent advice: Go to a sexual health clinic or see a GP if:
---------------------------------------------------------------

【10】*   you think you might have pubic lice

【11】Pubic lice will not go away without treatment.

【12】If you're sure you have pubic lice, you may be able to get treatment from a pharmacist.

【13】Find a sexual health clinic

【14】What happens at your appointment
--------------------------------

【15】If you go to a sexual health clinic or GP surgery because you think you have pubic lice, a doctor or nurse will check your hair for lice.

【16】They may check your pubic hair around your penis or vagina and any other areas that could be affected, such as your armpits, chest or eyelashes.

【17】To help spot any lice, they might use a comb and a magnifying lens.

【18】If they think you might have caught the lice during sex, they may ask about your sexual partners. They may also suggest getting tested for any sexually transmitted infections (STIs).

【19】Treatment for pubic lice
------------------------

【20】The main treatments for pubic lice are medicated creams or shampoos that kill the lice.

【21】You usually need to use the treatment on your whole body and leave it on for a few hours before washing it off. You'll need to repeat this again a week later to make sure all the lice have been killed.

【22】You may be asked to come back a week after you finish treatment, to check if the treatment has worked.

【23】Any current or recent sexual partners should also be treated, even if they do not have symptoms.

【24】How to stop pubic lice spreading
--------------------------------

【25】While you're being treated for pubic lice, there are some things you can do to help stop the lice spreading to others and stop the lice coming back.

【26】### Do

【27】*   wash your clothes and bedding on a hot wash (50C or higher), get them dry cleaned, or put them in a plastic bag for at least a week – this will help kill any lice

【28】*   vacuum your mattress to remove any lice

【29】### Don’t

【30】*   do not share clothes, bedding or hygiene products (such as razors)

【31】*   do not have close body contact (including sexual contact) with anyone else during treatment

【32】How you get pubic lice
----------------------

【33】Pubic lice are mainly spread by close body contact, most commonly sexual contact.

【34】The lice cannot jump or fly, but can climb from one person to another.

【35】You can also catch the lice from clothes, bedding or towels used by someone with pubic lice, but this is rare.

【36】How to avoid getting pubic lice
-------------------------------

【37】It can be hard to prevent pubic lice.

【38】The only way to avoid getting them is to avoid having sexual contact (or sharing bedding or clothing) with anyone you know who has pubic lice, until they've been treated.

【39】Condoms and other forms of contraception will not protect you from pubic lice. But it's still a good idea to use condoms during sex because they reduce the risk of sexually transmitted infections (STIs).
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 24 May 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 24 May 2025</u>

source_info.title: Dexamethasone eye drops
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of dexamethasone eye drops \- Brand names: Dexafree, Dropodex, Eythalm, Maxidex
============================================================================================

【1】Like all medicines, dexamethasone eye drops can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

【2】Common side effects
-------------------

【3】These are some of the common side effects of dexamethasone eye drops. There are things you can do to help cope with them:

【4】Irritation, burning, stinging or itching in your eye

【5】If you get these symptoms after using your eye drops, they should go after a few minutes as your eye gets used to the medicine. If they continue, stop using the eye drops and tell your doctor.

【6】Blurred or cloudy vision

【7】You may get some blurred or cloudy vision straight after using the eye drops. If your sight does not go back to normal after a few minutes, or you think your sight is slowly getting worse, stop using the eye drops and tell your doctor.

【8】Unpleasant taste in the mouth

【9】If you get the taste of the eye drops in your mouth a few minutes after your dose, it may help to rinse your mouth with water or have a drink of water.

【10】Speak to a doctor or pharmacist if the advice on how to cope does not help and a side effect is still bothering you or does not go away.

【11】### Serious side effects

【12】Call your doctor or call 111 now if you have side effects such as:

【13】*   problems with your sight – blurred or cloudy vision that does not improve or gets worse. These can be signs of increased pressure in your eyes (glaucoma) or a cataract
*   pain in your eye – this could be a sign of an ulcer on the surface of your eye

【14】### Serious allergic reaction

【15】In rare cases, it's possible to have a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) to dexamethasone eye drops.

【16】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【17】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【18】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【19】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【20】Other side effects
------------------

【21】These are not all the side effects of dexamethasone eye drops. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicine packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【22】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Dexamethasone eye drops
-------------------------------

【23】*   About dexamethasone eye drops
*   Who can and cannot use them
*   How and when to use them
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Using dexamethasone eye drops with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 21 July 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 21 July 2025</u>

source_info.title: Hyperthyroidism, see Overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism)
source_info.text:
【0】Hyperthyroidism, see Overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism)
Complications \- Overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism)
=====================================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Complications</u>

【2】**Several complications can develop if you have an overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism), particularly if the condition is not treated.**

【3】Eye problems
------------

【4】Eye problems, known as thyroid eye disease or Graves' ophthalmopathy, affect around 1 in 4 people with an overactive thyroid caused by Graves' disease.

【5】Problems can include:

【6】*   eyes feeling dry and gritty
*   sensitivity to light
*   watering eyes
*   blurred or double vision
*   red eyes
*   red, swollen or pulled back eyelids
*   bulging eyes

【7】Many people have mild eye symptoms, which get better as their overactive thyroid is treated. But some people may continue to have problems with their eyes.

【8】If Graves’ ophthalmology is particularly severe it can cause vision loss.

【9】If you have eye problems, you may be referred to an eye specialist (ophthalmologist) for treatment, such as eye drops, steroid medicine or possibly surgery.

【10】Find out how bulging eyes caused by thyroid eye disease is treated

【11】Underactive thyroid
-------------------

【12】Radioactive iodine treatment for an overactive thyroid often causes hormone levels to become too low. This is known as an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism).

【13】Symptoms of an underactive thyroid can include:

【14】*   sensitivity to cold
*   tiredness
*   weight gain
*   constipation
*   depression

【15】An underactive thyroid is sometimes only temporary, but often it's permanent and long-term treatment with thyroid hormone medicine is needed.
删除7：<u>Find out more about how an underactive thyroid is treated</u>

【16】Pregnancy problems
------------------

【17】It's very important that you use contraception if:

【18】*   you’re taking carbimazole
*   you’ve had radioactive iodine treatment in the last 6 months

【19】Both treatments can harm your unborn baby.

【20】Tell your doctor immediately if you’re planning a pregnancy or become pregnant while taking carbimazole, or after having radioactive iodine treatment within the past 6 months.

【21】If you have an overactive thyroid during pregnancy and your condition is not well controlled, it can increase the risk of:

【22】*   pre-eclampsia
*   miscarriage
*   premature labour and birth (before the 37th week of pregnancy)
*   your baby having a low birthweight

【23】Your doctor will want to check whether your condition is under control, and if you’re taking carbimazole they may recommend switching to a treatment that will not affect your baby, such as the medicine propylthiouracil.

【24】Thyroid storm
-------------

【25】Rarely, an undiagnosed or poorly controlled overactive thyroid can lead to a serious, life-threatening condition called a thyroid storm.

【26】This is a sudden flare-up of symptoms that can be triggered by:

【27】*   an infection
*   pregnancy
*   not taking your medicine correctly
*   damage to the thyroid gland, such as a punch to the throat

【28】Symptoms of a thyroid storm include:

【29】*   a rapid heartbeat
*   a high temperature
*   high blood pressure (hypertension)
*   yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)
*   severe agitation and confusion
*   loss of consciousness

【30】**A thyroid storm is a medical emergency. If you think you or someone in your care is experiencing it, call 999 to ask for an ambulance immediately.**

【31】Other problems
--------------

【32】An overactive thyroid can also increase your chances of developing:

【33】*   atrial fibrillation – a heart condition that causes an irregular and often abnormally fast heart rate
*   weakened bones (osteoporosis) – a condition that makes your bones fragile and more likely to break
*   heart failure – where the heart is unable to pump blood around your body properly
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 11 April 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 11 April 2026</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Treatment</u>

source_info.title: Rheumatoid arthritis
source_info.text:
【0】Treatment \- Rheumatoid arthritis
=================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Living with
7.  Complications</u>

【2】**Treatments for rheumatoid arthritis can help reduce inflammation in the joints, relieve pain, prevent or slow down joint damage, reduce disability and enable you to be as active as possible.**

【3】Although there's no cure for rheumatoid arthritis, early treatment and support (including medicine, lifestyle changes, supportive treatments and surgery) can reduce the risk of joint damage and limit the impact of the condition.

【4】Your treatment will usually involve care from your GP and several different specialists.

【5】There are medicines available to help stop rheumatoid arthritis from getting worse and reduce your risk of further problems.

【6】These are often divided into main 2 types: disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs) and biological treatments.

【7】Disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs)
-----------------------------------------------

【8】If you've been diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis, you'll usually be offered a combination of DMARD tablets as part of your initial treatment.

【9】These medicines ease the symptoms of the condition and slow down its progression.

【10】DMARDs work by blocking the effects of the chemicals released when your immune system attacks your joints, which could otherwise cause further damage to nearby bones, tendons, ligaments and cartilage.

【11】The DMARDs that may be used include:

【12】*   methotrexate
*   leflunomide
*   hydroxychloroquine
*   sulfasalazine

【13】Methotrexate is usually the first medicine given for rheumatoid arthritis, often with another DMARD and a short course of steroids (corticosteroids) to relieve any pain.

【14】These may be combined with biological treatments.

【15】Common side effects of methotrexate include:

【16】*   feeling sick
*   loss of appetite
*   a sore mouth
*   diarrhoea
*   headaches
*   hair loss

【17】The medicine can also affect your blood cells and liver, so you'll have regular blood tests to monitor this.

【18】Less commonly, methotrexate can affect the lungs, so you may have a chest X-ray and possibly a breathing test when you start taking it. This is to provide a comparison if you develop shortness of breath or a persistent dry cough while taking it. But most people tolerate methotrexate well.

【19】It can take a few months to notice a DMARD working. It's important to keep taking the medicine, even if you do not notice it working at the beginning.

【20】It's important to take methotrexate as instructed by your doctor, and see your doctor if you have any side effects.

【21】You may have to try 2 or 3 types of DMARD before you find the one that's most suitable for you.

【22】Once you and your doctor find the most suitable DMARD, you'll usually have to take the medicine long term.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【23】*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society: DMARDs

【24】</u>
Biological treatments
---------------------

【25】Biological treatments, such as adalimumab, etanercept and infliximab, are a newer form of treatment for rheumatoid arthritis.

【26】They're usually taken in combination with methotrexate or another DMARD, and are usually only used if DMARDs have not been effective on their own.

【27】Biological medicines are given by injection. They work by stopping particular chemicals in your blood from activating your immune system to attack your joints.

【28】Side effects from biological treatments are usually mild but include:

【29】*   skin reactions at the site of the injections
*   infections
*   feeling sick
*   a high temperature
*   headaches

【30】Some people may also be at risk of getting more serious problems, including the reactivation of infections such as tuberculosis (TB) if they have had them in the past.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【31】*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS): biologic treatments

【32】</u>
JAK inhibitors
--------------

【33】JAK inhibitors are a new type of medicine available on the NHS for adults with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.

【34】They are offered to people who cannot take DMARDs or biologicals, or tried them but found they were not effective.

【35】This medicine is usually used in combination with methotrexate.

【36】JAK inhibitors can also be taken on their own by adults who cannot take methotrexate.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【37】*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS): JAK inhibitors

【38】</u>
Medicine to relieve pain
------------------------

【39】In addition to the medicines used to control the progression of rheumatoid arthritis, you may also need to take medicine specifically to relieve pain.

【40】### Painkillers

【41】In some cases, you may be advised to use painkillers, such as paracetamol or a combination of paracetamol and codeine (co-codamol), to relieve the pain associated with rheumatoid arthritis.

【42】These medicines do not treat the inflammation in your joints, but they may be helpful in relieving pain in some people.

【43】### Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)

【44】In addition to, or instead of, painkillers such as paracetamol, your doctor may prescribe a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).

【45】This may be a traditional NSAID, such as ibuprofen, naproxen or diclofenac. Or your doctor may prescribe a type called a COX-2 inhibitor, such as celecoxib or etoricoxib.

【46】These medicines can help relieve pain while also reducing inflammation in the joints, although they will not stop rheumatoid arthritis getting worse over time.

【47】Your doctor will discuss with you what type of NSAID you should take, and the benefits and risks associated with it.

【48】Although uncommon, taking NSAIDs can increase the risk of serious stomach problems, such as internal bleeding.

【49】This is because the medicines can break down the lining that protects the stomach against damage from stomach acids.

【50】If you're prescribed NSAID tablets, you'll often be given another medicine to take with it, such as a proton pump inhibitor (PPI).

【51】Taking a PPI reduces the amount of acid in your stomach, which reduces the risk of damage to your stomach lining.

【52】### Steroids

【53】Steroids are powerful medicines that can help reduce pain, stiffness and inflammation.

【54】They can be given as:

【55】*   a tablet (for example, prednisolone)
*   an injection directly into a painful joint
*   an injection into a muscle (to help lots of joints)

【56】They're usually used to provide short-term pain relief – for example, while you're waiting for DMARD medicines to take effect or during a flare-up.

【57】Steroids are usually only taken for a short time because long-term use can have serious side effects, such as:

【58】*   weight gain
*   osteoporosis (weakening of the bones)
*   easy bruising
*   muscle weakness
*   thinning of the skin
删除6：<u>### Further information

【59】*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS): managing the pain of rheumatoid arthritis

【60】</u>
Supportive treatments
---------------------

【61】Your doctor may also refer you to other services that might be able to help you with your rheumatoid arthritis symptoms.

【62】### Physiotherapy

【63】A physiotherapist may help you improve your fitness and muscle strength, and make your joints more flexible.

【64】If your hands or wrists are affected, you can try a tailored hand exercise programme. This involves face-to-face sessions with a trained therapist and doing the exercises yourself at home.

【65】A physiotherapist may also be able to help with pain relief using heat or ice packs, or transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS).

【66】A TENS machine applies a small pulse of electricity to the affected joint, which numbs the nerve endings and can help ease the pain of rheumatoid arthritis.

【67】### Occupational therapy

【68】If rheumatoid arthritis causes you problems with everyday tasks, occupational therapy may help.

【69】An occupational therapist can provide training and advice that will help you to protect your joints, both while you're at home and at work.

【70】Using a support for your joints, such as a splint, may also be recommended, or devices that can help you open jars or turn on taps.

【71】### Podiatry

【72】If you have problems with your feet, a podiatrist may be able to help.

【73】You may also be offered some type of support for your joints or shoe insoles that can ease pain.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【74】*   Versus Arthritis: managing your symptoms
*   Versus Arthritis: treatments for arthritis
*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS): rheumatoid arthritis healthcare

【75】</u>
Surgery
-------

【76】Sometimes, despite taking medicines, your joints may still become damaged. If this happens, you may need surgery to help restore your ability to use your joint.

【77】Surgery may also be recommended to reduce pain or fix deformities.

【78】### Finger, hand and wrist surgery

【79】There are different types of surgery to correct joint problems in the hand.

【80】Examples include:

【81】*   carpal tunnel release (cutting a ligament in the wrist to relieve pressure on a nerve).删除7：<u>Find out more about carpal tunnel syndrome</u>
*   release of tendons in the fingers to treat abnormal bending
*   removal of inflamed tissue that lines the finger joints

【82】### Arthroscopy

【83】This is a procedure to remove inflamed joint tissue.

【84】During an arthroscopy, a thin tube with a light and camera attached to it (arthroscope) is inserted into the joint through a small cut in the skin so the surgeon can see the affected joint.

【85】Special instruments are inserted through other small cuts in the skin to remove the damaged tissue.

【86】You usually do not have to stay in hospital overnight for this kind of surgery, but the joint will need to be rested at home for several days.

【87】### Joint replacement

【88】Some people with rheumatoid arthritis need surgery to replace part or all of a joint, such as the hip, knee or shoulder joint.

【89】This is known as a joint replacement or arthroplasty.

【90】Replacement of these joints is a major operation that involves several days in hospital followed by months of rehabilitation.

【91】The latest prosthetic joints have a lifespan of 10 to 20 years, and some function may not be restored after a damaged joint is replaced by a prosthetic one.
删除7：<u>Find out more about knee replacement and hip replacement.</u>
删除6：<u>### Further information

【92】*   Versus Arthritis: arthritis surgery
*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society: surgery

【93】</u>
Complementary therapies
-----------------------

【94】Many people with rheumatoid arthritis try complementary therapies, such as:

【95】*   acupuncture
*   chiropractic
*   massage
*   osteopathy

【96】In most cases, there's little or no evidence these are effective in the long term, although some people may experience short-term benefit from them.

【97】### Nutritional supplements and dietary changes

【98】There's no strong evidence to suggest that specific dietary changes can improve rheumatoid arthritis, although some people with rheumatoid arthritis feel their symptoms get worse after they have eaten certain foods.

【99】If you think this may be the case for you, it may be useful to try avoiding problematic foods for a few weeks to see if your symptoms improve.

【100】But it's important to ensure your overall diet is still healthy and balanced. A Mediterranean-style diet, which is based on vegetables, fruits, legumes, nuts, beans, cereals, grains, fish and unsaturated fats such as olive oil, is recommended.

【101】There's also little evidence supporting the use of supplements in rheumatoid arthritis, although some can be useful in preventing side effects of medicines you may be taking.

【102】For example, calcium and vitamin D supplements may help prevent osteoporosis if you're taking steroids, and folic acid supplements may help prevent some of the side effects of methotrexate.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【103】*   Versus Arthritis: complementary and alternative treatments
*   National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society: diet
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 08 March 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 08 March 2026</u>
</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Diagnosis</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Living with</u>

source_info.title: Planning your pregnancy
source_info.text:
【0】Planning your pregnancy
=======================

【1】You can improve your chances of getting pregnant and having a healthy pregnancy by following the steps on this page.

【2】Take a folic acid supplement
----------------------------

【3】It's recommended that you should take a daily supplement of folic acid when you're pregnant, or there's a chance you might get pregnant.

【4】You should take a 400 microgram supplement of folic acid every day before you get pregnant, and every day afterwards, up until you're 12 weeks pregnant.

【5】A microgram is 1,000 times smaller than a milligram (mg). The word microgram is sometimes written with the Greek symbol μ followed by the letter g (μg).

【6】Folic acid reduces the risk of your baby having a neural tube defect, such as spina bifida.

【7】A neural tube defect is when the foetus's spinal cord (part of the body's nervous system) does not form normally.

【8】You might be advised to take a higher dose supplement of 5 milligram (5mg) every day.

【9】You may need to take a 5mg supplement of folic acid if:

【10】*   you or the baby's other biological parent have a neural tube defect
*   you previously had a pregnancy affected by a neural tube defect
*   you or the baby's other biological parent have a family history of neural tube defects
*   you have diabetes

【11】Your doctor may also recommend a a 5mg supplement if you take certain medicines, such as anti-epilepsy medicine or anti-retroviral medicine for HIV.

【12】Talk to a GP if you think you need a 5mg dose of folic acid, as they can prescribe a higher dose.

【13】You can get folic acid tablets at pharmacies, or talk to a GP about getting a prescription.

【14】Do not worry if you get pregnant unexpectedly and were not taking a folic acid supplement at the time. Start taking them as soon as you find out, until you're past the first 12 weeks of pregnancy.

【15】Stop smoking
------------

【16】Smoking during pregnancy has been linked to a variety of health problems, including:

【17】*   premature birth
*   low birth weight
*   sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS), also known as cot death
*   miscarriage

【18】Quitting can be hard, no matter how much you want to, but support is available.

【19】NHS Quit Smoking offers free help, support and advice on stopping smoking, including when you're pregnant, and can give you details of local support services.

【20】Smoke from other people's cigarettes can damage your baby, so ask your partner, friends and family not to smoke near you.

【21】Cut out alcohol
---------------

【22】Do not drink alcohol if you're pregnant or trying to get pregnant. Alcohol can be passed to your unborn baby.

【23】Drinking in pregnancy can lead to long-term harm to your baby, and the more you drink, the greater the risk.

【24】Find out about alcohol and pregnancy.

【25】Keep to a healthy weight
------------------------

【26】If you're overweight, you may have problems getting pregnant and fertility treatment is less likely to work.

【27】Being overweight (having a BMI over 25) or obese (having a BMI over 30) also raises the risk of some pregnancy problems, such as high blood pressure, deep vein thrombosis, miscarriage and gestational diabetes.

【28】Before you get pregnant you can calculate your BMI. But this may not be accurate once you're pregnant, so consult your midwife or doctor.

【29】Having a healthy diet and doing moderate exercise are advised in pregnancy, and it's important not to gain too much weight.

【30】You can keep to a healthy weight by having a balanced diet and doing regular exercise.
删除7：<u>Read more about exercise in pregnancy</u>

【31】Know which medicines you can take
---------------------------------

【32】Not all medicines are safe to take when you're pregnant or planning a pregnancy, whether they're on prescription or medicines you can buy in a pharmacy or shop.

【33】Information:

【34】If you take prescribed medicine and you're planning to get pregnant, talk to a doctor.

【35】Do not stop taking your medicine without talking to a doctor.

【36】Find out about medicines in pregnancy.

【37】Vaccinations and infections
---------------------------

【38】Some infections, such as rubella (German measles), can harm your baby if you catch them during pregnancy.

【39】Most people in the UK are immune to rubella, thanks to the uptake of the measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccination.

【40】If you have not had 2 doses of the MMR vaccine, or you're not sure if you have, ask your GP surgery to check your vaccination history.

【41】If you have not had both doses or there's no record available, you can have the vaccinations at your GP surgery.

【42】You should avoid getting pregnant for 1 month after having the MMR vaccination, which means you'll need a reliable method of contraception.

【43】Talk to a doctor if you have a long-term condition
--------------------------------------------------

【44】If you have a long-term condition, such as epilepsy or diabetes, it could affect the decisions you make about your pregnancy – for example, where you might want to give birth.

【45】Before you get pregnant, have a discussion with your specialist or a GP about getting pregnant.

【46】You can also talk to your GP if you have a mental health condition and are planning to get pregnant. They may be able to refer you to a specialist mental health team who offer support before, during and after pregnancy.

【47】If you're taking medicine for a condition, do not stop taking it without talking to a doctor.

【48】Testing for sickle cell and thalassaemia
----------------------------------------

【49】Sickle cell disease (SCD) and thalassaemia are inherited blood disorders that mainly affect people whose ancestors come from Africa, the Caribbean, the Mediterranean, India, Pakistan, south and Southeast Asia, and the Middle East.

【50】If you are pregnant and live in England you will be offered screening tests for these disorders, but you do not have to wait until you're pregnant before you have a test.

【51】If you or your partner are concerned you may be a carrier for 1 of these disorders, perhaps because someone in your family has a blood disorder or is a carrier, it's a good idea to get tested before starting a family.

【52】You can ask for a free blood test from either a GP or a local sickle cell and thalassaemia centre.
删除7：<u>Find out more about screening for sickle cell and thalassaemia in pregnancy</u>
删除11：<u>More in Trying for a baby
-------------------------

【53】*   Trying to get pregnant
*   Getting pregnant if you have a mental health condition
*   Planning your pregnancy
*   Doing a pregnancy test
*   Signs and symptoms of pregnancy
*   How long does it usually take to get pregnant?
*   Planning another pregnancy
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 26 April 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 26 April 2026</u>

source_info.title: Cystoscopy
source_info.text:
【0】Recovery \- Cystoscopy
======================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  What happens
3.  Recovery
4.  Risks</u>

【2】**You should be able to get back to normal quite quickly after a cystoscopy.**

【3】How long it takes to recover depends if you had a flexible cystoscopy (using local anaesthetic gel) or a rigid cystoscopy (under general anaesthetic or spinal anaesthetic).

【4】Going home
----------

【5】### After a flexible cystoscopy

【6】You'll be able to go home shortly after a flexible cystoscopy, once you've emptied your bladder.

【7】There's usually no need to wait in the hospital until the anaesthetic has completely worn off.

【8】### After a rigid cystoscopy

【9】If you have a rigid cystoscopy, you'll probably need to stay in hospital for a few hours until the anaesthetic starts to wear off.

【10】You can go home once you're feeling better and you've emptied your bladder. Most people leave hospital the same day, but sometimes an overnight stay might be needed.

【11】You'll need to arrange for someone to take you home as you will not be able to drive for at least 24 hours.

【12】Getting back to normal
----------------------

【13】### After a flexible cystoscopy

【14】You can return to your normal activities – including work, exercise and having sex – as soon as you feel able to after a flexible cystoscopy.

【15】This will often be later the same day or possibly the day after.

【16】### After a rigid cystoscopy

【17】After a rigid cystoscopy:

【18】*   rest at home for a day or two – you may need to take a couple of days off work
*   make sure someone stays with you for the first 24 hours
*   do not drive or drink alcohol for at least 24 hours

【19】You can usually return to your normal activities – including work, exercise and having sex – when you feel able to.

【20】After effects of a cystoscopy
-----------------------------

【21】After a cystoscopy, it's normal to have:

【22】*   a burning or stinging sensation when peeing
*   some blood in your pee, which may turn it slightly pink
*   a need to pee more often than usual

【23】These side effects should pass after a day or two.

【24】Drinking plenty of water during the first few days can help. You can also take painkillers such as paracetamol to reduce any discomfort.

【25】When to get medical advice
--------------------------

【26】Contact a GP for advice if:

【27】*   the pain or bleeding lasts more than a few days
*   peeing is very painful
*   your pee becomes so bloody that you cannot see through it
*   you see red lumps (blood clots) in your pee
*   you cannot empty your bladder
*   your pee smells bad
*   you get a high temperature
*   you feel sick or vomit
*   you have pain in your lower back or side

【28】Go to your nearest accident and emergency (A&E) department if you feel really unwell.

【29】These problems could be caused by complications of a cystoscopy, such as an infection.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 20 April 2020  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 20 April 2023</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : What happens</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Risks</u>

source_info.title: Edoxaban
source_info.text:
【0】Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility while taking edoxaban
============================================================

【1】Edoxaban and pregnancy
----------------------

【2】Edoxaban should not be taken during pregnancy.

【3】If you take edoxaban and are planning to get pregnant or you become pregnant while taking it, speak to your doctor or specialist. You will need to be changed to a different medicine.

【4】Edoxaban and breastfeeding
--------------------------

【5】Edoxaban is not usually recommended while breastfeeding as there is not enough information to show that it's safe.

【6】Speak to your doctor about other medicines you can use while breastfeeding.

【7】Edoxaban and fertility
----------------------

【8】There's no evidence to suggest that taking edoxaban reduces fertility in either men or women.

【9】Speak to a pharmacist or your doctor if you're trying to get pregnant.

【10】Non-urgent advice: Tell your doctor if you're:
----------------------------------------------

【11】*   trying to get pregnant
*   pregnant
*   breastfeeding
删除11：<u>More in Edoxaban
----------------

*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects

source_info.title: Cholesterol (high), see High cholesterol
source_info.text:
【0】Cholesterol (high), see High cholesterol
How to lower your cholesterol \- High cholesterol
=================================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  What is high cholesterol?
2.  Getting tested
3.  Cholesterol levels
4.  How to lower your cholesterol
5.  Medicines for high cholesterol</u>

【2】Ways to lower your cholesterol
------------------------------

【3】### Eat less fatty food

【4】To reduce your cholesterol, try to cut down on fatty food, especially food that contains a type of fat called saturated fat.

【5】You can still have foods that contain a healthier type of fat called unsaturated fat.

【6】Check labels on food to see what type of fat it has in it.

【7】#### Try to eat more:

【8】*   oily fish, like mackerel and salmon
*   brown rice, wholegrain bread and wholewheat pasta
*   nuts and seeds
*   fruits and vegetables

【9】#### Try to eat less:

【10】*   meat pies, sausages and fatty meat
*   butter, lard and ghee
*   cream and hard cheese, like cheddar
*   cakes and biscuits
*   food that contains coconut oil or palm oil

【11】### Exercise more

【12】Aim to do at least 150 minutes (2.5 hours) of exercise a week.

【13】Some good things to try when starting out include:

【14】*   walking – try to walk fast enough so your heart starts beating faster
*   swimming
*   cycling

【15】Try a few different exercises to find something you like doing. You're more likely to keep doing it if you enjoy it.

【16】### Stop smoking

【17】Smoking can raise your cholesterol and make you more likely to have serious problems like heart attacks, strokes and cancer.

【18】If you want to stop smoking, you can get help and support from:

【19】*   your GP
*   the NHS Stop Smoking Service – your GP can refer you or you can ring the helpline on 0300 123 1044 (England only)

【20】They can give you useful tips and advice about ways to stop cravings.

【21】### Cut down on alcohol

【22】Try to:

【23】*   avoid drinking more than 14 units of alcohol a week
*   have several drink-free days each week
*   avoid drinking lots of alcohol in a short time (binge drinking)

【24】Ask your GP for help and advice if you're struggling to cut down.
删除6：<u>Information:

【25】**Find out more**
-----------------

【26】*   how to eat less saturated fat
*   exercise guidelines
*   how to quit smoking
*   where to get alcohol support

</u>
