source_info.title: Atenolol
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of atenolol
========================

【1】Like all medicines, atenolol can cause side effects in some people, but many people have no side effects or only minor ones.

【2】Side effects often improve as your body gets used to the medicine.

【3】Common side effects
-------------------

【4】These common side effects of atenolol happen in more than 1 in 100 people. They're usually mild and only last for a short time. There are things you can do to help cope with them:

【5】Feeling sleepy, tired or dizzy

【6】As your body gets used to atenolol, these side effects should wear off. If atenolol makes you feel dizzy, sit or lie down until you feel better. Do not drive, cycle or use tools or machinery until you feel better. Avoid alcohol as it will make you feel worse.

【7】Cold fingers or toes

【8】Put your hands or feet under warm running water, massage them and wiggle your fingers and toes. Do not smoke or have drinks with caffeine in, as this can make your blood vessels narrower and further restrict blood flow to your hands and feet. Try wearing mittens (they're warmer than gloves) and warm socks. Do not wear tight watches or bracelets.

【9】Feeling sick or being sick (nausea or vomiting)

【10】Stick to simple meals and do not eat rich or spicy food. It might help to take your atenolol after a meal or snack.

【11】Drink plenty of fluids, such as water or squash, to avoid dehydration. Take small, frequent sips if you're being sick. Signs of dehydration include peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee.

【12】Do not take any other medicines to treat vomiting without speaking to a pharmacist or doctor.

【13】If you take contraceptive pills and you're being sick, your contraception may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【14】Diarrhoea

【15】Drink lots of fluids, such as water or squash, to avoid dehydration. Signs of dehydration include peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee.

【16】Do not take any other medicines to treat diarrhoea without speaking to a pharmacist or doctor.

【17】If you take contraceptive pills and you have severe diarrhoea for more than 24 hours, your contraception may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【18】Stomach pain

【19】Try to rest and relax. It can help to eat and drink slowly and have smaller and more frequent meals. Putting a heat pad or covered hot water bottle on your stomach may also help.

【20】If you are in a lot of pain, speak to your pharmacist or doctor.

【21】If this advice does not help and you are bothered by any of these side effects, keep taking the medicine but tell your doctor or pharmacist.

【22】Serious side effects
--------------------

【23】It happens rarely, but some people have serious side effects when taking atenolol.

【24】Tell your doctor or call 111 now if:

【25】*   you have shortness of breath with a cough that gets worse when you exercise (like walking up stairs), swollen ankles or legs, or an irregular heartbeat – these can be signs of heart problems
*   you have shortness of breath, wheezing and tightening of your chest – these can be signs of lung problems
*   the whites of your eyes turn yellow, or your skin turns yellow, although this may be less obvious on brown or black skin, or you have pale poo or dark pee – these can be signs of liver problems
*   you get unexplained bruising, or you bruise more easily than usual – these can be signs of low numbers of platelets in your blood (thrombocytopenia)

【26】### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【27】*   you get chest pain that does not stop after a few minutes, or is new or worse if you already have angina

【28】Chest pain is a possible sign of a heart attack and needs to be checked out as soon as possible.

【29】### Serious allergic reaction

【30】In rare cases, atenolol may cause a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).

【31】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【32】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【33】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【34】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【35】Other side effects
------------------

【36】These are not all the side effects of atenolol. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicine packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【37】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Atenolol
----------------

【38】*   About atenolol
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking atenolol with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 5 April 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 5 April 2025</u>

source_info.title: Hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom
source_info.text:
【0】Common questions about hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom \- Brand names: Anusol, Anugesic, Germaloids, Perinal, Proctosedyl, Uniroid, Xyloproct
=======================================================================================================================================================

【1】How does hydrocortisone work?

【2】The hydrocortisone in treatments for piles and itchy bottom is a steroid (corticosteroid).

【3】Like other steroids, it works by calming your immune system. This reduces swelling (inflammation) and helps to relieve the pain and itching of piles.

【4】When will I feel better?

【5】The pain and itching should get better within a few days of starting treatment.

【6】Are there any long-term side effects?

【7】If you use hydrocortisone for a long time, it can make the skin around your anus thinner.

【8】It's best not to use it for more than 7 days, and not to repeat the treatments too often.

【9】Can I have vaccinations?

【10】With some hydrocortisone treatments, you need to be careful about having vaccinations. However, this is not the case with hydrocortisone treatments for piles and itchy bottom. You can have vaccinations if you need them.

【11】Are there other medicines that help piles or itchy bottom?

【12】There are other treatments available to buy that do not contain hydrocortisone. These include creams and suppositories containing zinc oxide or other soothing ingredients.

【13】Your doctor may be able to prescribe stronger medicines for piles or itchy bottom.

【14】Will it affect my contraception?

【15】Hydrocortisone treatments for piles and itchy bottom do not affect any type of contraception, including the combined pill and emergency contraception.

【16】Can I drive or ride a bike?

【17】Using hydrocortisone treatments for piles and itchy bottom will not affect you being able to drive or cycle.

【18】Can I drink alcohol while using hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom?

【19】Yes, you can drink alcohol while using all hydrocortisone treatments for piles and itchy bottom.

【20】Is there any food or drink I need to avoid?

【21】No, using hydrocortisone treatments for piles and itchy bottom does not affect what you can eat and drink.

【22】It's a good idea, though, to eat lots of foods that contain fibre so you do not get constipation. Examples of foods with lots of fibre are porridge oats and wholegrain breakfast cereals, wholemeal breads, wholewheat pasta, pulses, potatoes with their skins on and vegetables.

【23】To avoid constipation, try to drink several glasses of water or other non-alcoholic drinks each day. If you can, it may also help to increase your level of exercise.

【24】Can lifestyle changes help with piles or itchy bottom?

【25】Piles and itchy bottom often settle down without treatment, but there are some things you can do to help.

【26】Piles can be brought on by too much straining on the toilet. Straining is often because of constipation. You're less likely to get constipated if you:

【27】*   increase the amount of fibre you eat, like wholemeal bread, fruit and vegetables
*   drink lots of water every day
*   exercise regularly
*   go to the toilet as soon as you feel you need to – do not hold it in

【28】Skin moisturisers can also help relieve the pain and itching of piles. Ask your pharmacist what they recommend.
删除11：<u>More in Hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom
-------------------------------------------------

【29】*   About hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom

*   How and when to use it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility

source_info.title: Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease
source_info.text:
【0】Overview \- Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease
=========================================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment</u>

【2】**Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease (ARPKD) is a rare inherited childhood condition where the development of the kidneys and liver is abnormal. Over time, these organs may fail.**

【3】The condition often causes serious problems soon after birth, although less severe cases may not become obvious until a child is older.

【4】ARPKD can cause a wide range of problems, including:

【5】*   underdeveloped lungs, which can cause severe breathing difficulties soon after birth
*   high blood pressure (hypertension)
*   excessive peeing and thirst
*   problems with blood flow through the liver, which can lead to serious internal bleeding
*   a progressive loss of kidney function, known as chronic kidney disease (CKD)

【6】When these problems develop and how severe they are can vary considerably, even between family members with the condition.
删除7：<u>Read more about the symptoms of ARPKD and diagnosing ARPKD.</u>

【7】Even though ARPKD is rare, it's one of the most common kidney problems to affect young children.

【8】It's estimated around 1 in 20,000 babies is born with the condition. Both boys and girls are affected equally.

【9】The kidneys
-----------

【10】The kidneys are 2 bean-shaped organs located on either side of the body, just beneath the rib cage.

【11】The main role of the kidneys is to filter out waste products from the blood before passing them out of the body as urine.

【12】The kidneys also help maintain blood pressure at a healthy level.

【13】What causes ARPKD?
------------------

【14】ARPKD is caused by a genetic fault that disrupts normal development of the kidneys and liver.

【15】In particular, the growth and development of the small tubes that make up the kidneys is affected, causing bulges and cysts (fluid-filled sacs) to develop within them.

【16】Over time, the cysts cause the kidneys to become enlarged and scarred (fibrosis), resulting in the deterioration of overall kidney function.

【17】Similar problems also affect the small tubes (bile ducts) that allow a digestive fluid called bile to flow out of the liver.

【18】The bile ducts may develop abnormally and cysts may grow inside them. The liver can also become scarred over time.

【19】ARPKD is caused by a genetic alteration in the gene PKHD1, which in most cases is passed on to a child by their parents.

【20】If both parents carry a faulty version of this gene, there's a 1 in 4 chance of each child they have developing ARPKD.

【21】The way ARPKD is inherited is different from a more common type of kidney disease called autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD), which usually does not cause significantly reduced kidney function until adulthood.

【22】Sometimes ADPKD can happen when only one parent has passed on a faulty gene, but this is rare.
删除7：<u>Find out more about the causes of ARPKD</u>

【23】Treating ARPKD
--------------

【24】There's currently no cure for ARPKD, but various treatments can help manage the wide range of problems it can cause.

【25】Treatment for ARPKD may include:

【26】*   breathing assistance with a machine that moves air in and out of the lungs (a ventilator) for children with severe breathing difficulties
*   medication to treat high blood pressure
*   procedures to stop any internal bleeding that may occur
*   medications to control problems associated with the loss of kidney function, such as iron supplements for anaemia

【27】If kidney failure does occur, there are 2 main treatment options:

【28】*   dialysis, where a machine is used to replicate many functions of the kidney
*   a kidney transplant, where a healthy kidney is removed from a living or recently deceased donor and implanted into someone with kidney failure
删除7：<u>Find out more about how ARPKD is treated</u>

【29】Outlook
-------

【30】The outlook for children with ARPKD can vary considerably depending on the severity of the condition.

【31】If routine scans pick up kidney problems during pregnancy, the baby will usually have a poorer outlook than a child who's diagnosed at a later stage.

【32】But in general, ARPKD is a severe condition and around 1 in 3 babies will die from severe breathing difficulties during the first 4 weeks after birth.

【33】About 9 out of 10 babies with ARPKD who survive the first month of life will live until they're at least 5 years old.

【34】It's difficult to predict exactly how long a child with ARPKD will live because there's very little data showing long-term survival rates.

【35】But with advances in treatments and a better understanding of the condition, increasing numbers of children with ARPKD are living well into adulthood.

【36】Information about you
---------------------

【37】If you have ARPKD, your clinical team will pass information about you on to the National Congenital Anomaly and Rare Disease Registration Service (NCARDRS).

【38】This helps scientists look for better ways to prevent and treat this condition. You can opt out of the register at any time.
删除7：<u>Find out more about the National Congenital Anomaly and Rare Disease Register on GOV.UK</u>
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 10 January 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 10 January 2026</u>

source_info.title: Mirabegron
source_info.text:
【0】Who can and cannot take mirabegron \- Brand name: Betmiga
=========================================================

【1】Who can take mirabegron
-----------------------

【2】Most adults aged 18 years old and over can take mirabegron.

【3】Who may not be able to take mirabegron
--------------------------------------

【4】Mirabegron is not suitable for some people. To make sure it's safe for you, tell your doctor or pharmacist before starting to take it if you:

【5】*   have ever had an allergic reaction to mirabegron or any other medicine
*   have liver or kidney problems
*   have high blood pressure
*   are not able to pee or empty your bladder completely (urinary retention)
*   have a blockage in your bladder
*   have a heart problem called long QT syndrome
*   are pregnant, trying to get pregnant or breastfeeding
删除11：<u>More in Mirabegron

source_info.title: Cancer
source_info.text:
【0】Overview \- Cancer
==================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Signs and symptoms</u>

【2】**Cancer is a condition where cells in a specific part of the body grow and reproduce uncontrollably. The cancerous cells can invade and destroy surrounding healthy tissue, including organs.**

【3】Cancer sometimes begins in one part of the body before spreading to other areas. This process is known as metastasis.

【4】1 in 2 people will develop some form of cancer during their lifetime. In the UK, the 4 most common types of cancer are:

【5】*   breast cancer
*   lung cancer
*   prostate cancer
*   bowel cancer

【6】There are more than 200 different types of cancer, and each is diagnosed and treated in a particular way. You can find links on this page to information about other types of cancer.

【7】Spotting signs of cancer
------------------------

【8】Changes to your body's normal processes or unusual, unexplained symptoms can sometimes be an early sign of cancer.

【9】Symptoms that need to be checked by a doctor include:

【10】*   a lump that suddenly appears on your body
*   unexplained bleeding
*   changes to your bowel habits

【11】But in many cases your symptoms will not be related to cancer and will be caused by other, non-cancerous health conditions.
删除7：<u>Read more about the signs and symptoms of cancer.</u>

【12】Reducing your risk of cancer
----------------------------

【13】Making some simple changes to your lifestyle can significantly reduce your risk of developing cancer.

【14】For example:

【15】*   healthy eating
*   taking regular exercise
*   not smoking
删除7：<u>Find out more about how a healthy lifestyle reduces your chances of developing cancer on the Macmillan Cancer Support website</u>

【16】Cancer treatment
----------------

【17】Surgery is the first treatment to try for most types of cancer, as solid tumours can usually be surgically removed.

【18】2 other commonly used treatment methods are:

【19】*   chemotherapy – powerful cancer-killing medicines
*   radiotherapy – the controlled use of high-energy X-rays

【20】Waiting times
-------------

【21】Accurately diagnosing cancer can take weeks or months. As cancer often develops slowly over several years, waiting for a few weeks will not usually impact on the effectiveness of treatment.

【22】The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) has produced referral guidelines for suspected cancer.

【23】You should not have to wait more than 2 weeks to see a specialist if your GP suspects you have cancer and urgently refers you.

【24】In cases where cancer has been confirmed, you should not have to wait more than 31 days from the decision to treat to the start of treatment.

【25】NHS England has more detailed statistics on cancer waiting times

【26】Cancer services
---------------

【27】*   Find local cancer support services
*   Find cancer support services for women

【28】Other cancer pages
------------------

【29】The Health A-Z covers many different types of cancer:

【30】*   Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia
*   Acute myeloid leukaemia
*   Anal cancer
*   Bile duct cancer
*   Bladder cancer
*   Bone cancer
*   Bowel cancer
*   Brain tumour (cancerous)
*   Brain tumour (non-cancerous)
*   Breast cancer (female)
*   Breast cancer (male)
*   Carcinoid tumours
*   Cervical cancer
*   Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia
*   Chronic myeloid leukaemia
*   Endometrial cancer
*   Ewing sarcoma
*   Eye cancer
*   Gallbladder cancer 
*   Hairy cell leukaemia
*   Head and neck cancer
*   Hodgkin lymphoma
*   Kaposi's sarcoma
*   Kidney cancer
*   Laryngeal cancer
*   Liver cancer
*   Lung cancer
*   Mesothelioma
*   Mouth cancer
*   Multiple myeloma
*   Nasopharyngeal cancer
*   Neuroendocrine tumours
*   Non-Hodgkin lymphoma
*   Nasal and sinus cancer
*   Oesophageal cancer
*   Ovarian cancer
*   Pancreatic cancer
*   Penile cancer
*   Prostate cancer
*   Rectal cancer
*   Retinoblastoma
*   Skin cancer (melanoma)
*   Skin cancer (non-melanoma)
*   Soft tissue sarcoma
*   Stomach cancer
*   Testicular cancer
*   Thyroid cancer
*   Vaginal cancer
*   Vulval cancer
*   Womb cancer

【31】Information:

【32】### Social care and support guide

【33】The guide to care and support explains your options and where you can get support if you:

【34】*   need help with day-to-day living because of illness or disability
*   care for someone regularly because they're ill, elderly or disabled – including family members

source_info.title: Clonazepam
source_info.text:
【0】Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility while taking clonazepam
==============================================================

【1】Clonazepam and pregnancy
------------------------

【2】Clonazepam can be taken during pregnancy, particularly if you need it to control your epilepsy.

【3】Speak to your doctor if you take clonazepam and are pregnant or are planning to get pregnant. They'll help you weigh up the risks and benefits of taking clonazepam and make sure that treatment is right for you.

【4】Taking clonazepam in late pregnancy might affect your baby, making them more drowsy and sleepy. The baby will be monitored for these effects after they're born.

【5】Clonazepam and breastfeeding
----------------------------

【6】If your doctor, health visitor or midwife says your baby is healthy, you can usually take clonazepam if you are breastfeeding.

【7】There is not much information about taking clonazepam while breastfeeding, but it is thought that it passes into breast milk in very small amounts. It does not usually cause side effects in breastfed babies.

【8】If you take clonazepam for a long time, in high doses, or with other medicines, your baby may be more likely to get side effects, although this is still rare. This can make your baby drowsy or tired and can make it difficult for them to feed.

【9】Talk to your health visitor, midwife, doctor or pharmacist as soon as possible if you have any concerns, or if your baby:

【10】*   is not feeding as well as usual
*   seems unusually sleepy
*   has unusual breathing

【11】It's important not to share a bed with your baby while you're taking clonazepam.

【12】Clonazepam and fertility
------------------------

【13】There's no evidence that clonazepam will affect fertility in either men or women.

【14】If you're trying to get pregnant, or you're having problems getting pregnant while on clonazepam, speak to a doctor.

【15】Non-urgent advice: Tell your doctor if you're:
----------------------------------------------

【16】*   trying to get pregnant
*   pregnant
*   breastfeeding
删除11：<u>More in Clonazepam
------------------

source_info.title: Alzheimer's disease
source_info.text:
【0】Symptoms \- Alzheimer's disease
===============================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Prevention</u>

【2】**The symptoms of Alzheimer's disease progress slowly over several years. Sometimes these symptoms are confused with other conditions and may initially be put down to old age.**

【3】The rate at which the symptoms progress is different for each individual.

【4】In some cases, other conditions can be responsible for symptoms getting worse.

【5】These conditions include:

【6】*   infections
*   stroke
*   delirium

【7】As well as these conditions, other things, such as certain medicines, can also worsen the symptoms of dementia.

【8】Anyone with Alzheimer's disease whose symptoms are rapidly getting worse should be seen by a doctor so these can be managed.

【9】There may be reasons behind the worsening of symptoms that can be treated.

【10】Stages of Alzheimer's disease
-----------------------------

【11】Generally, the symptoms of Alzheimer's disease are divided into 3 main stages.

【12】### Early symptoms

【13】In the early stages, the main symptom of Alzheimer's disease is memory lapses.

【14】For example, someone with early Alzheimer's disease may:

【15】*   forget about recent conversations or events
*   misplace items
*   forget the names of places and objects
*   have trouble thinking of the right word
*   ask questions repetitively
*   show poor judgement or find it harder to make decisions
*   become less flexible and more hesitant to try new things

【16】There are often signs of mood changes, such as increasing anxiety or agitation, or periods of confusion.

【17】### Middle-stage symptoms

【18】As Alzheimer's disease develops, memory problems will get worse.

【19】Someone with the condition may find it increasingly difficult to remember the names of people they know and may struggle to recognise their family and friends.

【20】Other symptoms may also develop, such as:

【21】*   increasing confusion and disorientation – for example, getting lost, or wandering and not knowing what time of day it is
*   obsessive, repetitive or impulsive behaviour
*   delusions (believing things that are untrue) or feeling paranoid and suspicious about carers or family members
*   problems with speech or language (aphasia)
*   disturbed sleep
*   changes in mood, such as frequent mood swings, depression and feeling increasingly anxious, frustrated or agitated
*   difficulty performing spatial tasks, such as judging distances
*   seeing or hearing things that other people do not (hallucinations)

【22】Some people also have some symptoms of vascular dementia.

【23】By this stage, someone with Alzheimer's disease usually needs support to help them with everyday living.

【24】For example, they may need help eating, washing, getting dressed and using the toilet.

【25】### Later symptoms

【26】In the later stages of Alzheimer's disease, the symptoms become increasingly severe and can be distressing for the person with the condition, as well as their carers, friends and family.

【27】Hallucinations and delusions may come and go over the course of the illness, but can get worse as the condition progresses.

【28】Sometimes people with Alzheimer's disease can be violent, demanding and suspicious of those around them.

【29】A number of other symptoms may also develop as Alzheimer's disease progresses, such as:

【30】*   difficulty eating and swallowing (dysphagia)
*   difficulty changing position or moving around without assistance
*   weight loss – sometimes severe
*   unintentional passing of urine (urinary incontinence) or stools (bowel incontinence)
*   gradual loss of speech
*   significant problems with short- and long-term memory

【31】In the severe stages of Alzheimer's disease, people may need full-time care and assistance with eating, moving and personal care.
删除7：<u>Read more about how Alzheimer's disease is treated.</u>

【32】When to see a GP
----------------

【33】If you're worried about your memory or think you may have dementia, it's a good idea to see a GP.

【34】If you're worried about someone else's memory problems, encourage them to make an appointment and perhaps suggest that you go along with them.

【35】Memory problems are not just caused by dementia – they can also be caused by depression, stress, medicines or other health problems.

【36】A GP can carry out some simple checks to try to find out what the cause may be, and they can refer you to a specialist for more tests if necessary.
删除7：<u>Read more about diagnosing Alzheimer's disease.</u>

source_info.title: Sertraline
source_info.text:
【0】How and when to take sertraline
===============================

【1】Dosage and strength
-------------------

【2】Sertraline is available as 25mg, 50mg or 100mg tablets.

【3】The usual dose of sertraline is 50mg a day in adults. But your doctor may start you on a lower dose, then increase it gradually to a maximum dose of 200mg a day.

【4】If you have liver problems, your doctor might give you a lower dose.

【5】The usual dose of sertraline for children aged 6 to 12 is 25mg a day, but this may be increased to 50mg a day after a week.

【6】The usual dose of sertraline for children aged 13 to 17 is 50mg a day.

【7】Children aged 6 to 17 might have their dose increased up to 200mg a day, if needed.

【8】**How to take it**
------------------

【9】Take sertraline once a day. You can take it with or without food.

【10】You can choose to take sertraline at any time, as long as you stick to the same time every day.

【11】If you have trouble sleeping, it's best to take it in the morning.

【12】**How long to take it for**
---------------------------

【13】Once you're feeling better it's likely that you'll continue to take sertraline for several more months. Stopping before that time can make depression come back.

【14】Most doctors recommend that you take antidepressants for 6 months to a year after you no longer feel depressed.

【15】**If you forget to take it**
----------------------------

【16】If you occasionally forget to take a dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose the next day at the usual time.

【17】Never take 2 doses at the same time to make up for a forgotten one.

【18】If you forget doses often, it may help to set an alarm to remind you. You could also ask your pharmacist for advice on other ways to help you remember to take your medicine.

【19】**If you take too much**
------------------------

【20】The amount of sertraline that can lead to an overdose varies from person to person.

【21】Taking too much can cause symptoms such as:

【22】*   being sick (vomiting)
*   shaking
*   feeling sleepy
*   feeling dizzy
*   fast heart rate
*   fits or seizures

【23】### Urgent advice: Contact 111 for advice now if:

【24】*   you take more than your prescribed dose of sertraline

【25】Go to 111.nhs.uk or call 111

【26】If you need to go to A&E, do not drive yourself. Get someone else to drive you or call for an ambulance.

【27】Take the sertraline packet, or the leaflet inside it, plus any remaining medicine with you.

【28】**Stopping sertraline**
-----------------------

【29】If you have been feeling better for 6 months or more, your doctor may suggest coming off sertraline.

【30】Your doctor will probably recommend reducing your dose gradually over several weeks, or longer if you have been taking sertraline for a long time.

【31】This is to help prevent any withdrawal symptoms you might get as a reaction to coming off the medicine.

【32】These can include:

【33】*   feeling dizzy
*   feeling sick
*   numbness or tingling in the hands or feet
*   trouble sleeping
*   feeling agitated or anxious
*   headaches
*   shaking
删除11：<u>More in Sertraline
------------------

【34】*   About sertraline
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking sertraline with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 2 February 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 2 February 2025</u>

source_info.title: Benzoyl peroxide
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of benzoyl peroxide \- Brand name: Acnecide
========================================================

【1】Like all medicines, benzoyl peroxide can cause side effects, although not everyone gets them.

【2】Common side effects
-------------------

【3】These common side effects of benzoyl peroxide happen in more than 1 in 10 people. There are things you can do to help cope with them:

【4】Dry skin

【5】Apply a moisturiser and lip balm regularly. The best type of moisturiser is an oil-free face moisturiser for sensitive skin. Try to take shorter showers, using warm water rather than hot.

【6】Peeling or red skin

【7】Redness may be less obvious on brown or black skin. Try using the gel or wash less often, or stop using it for a few days until the irritation goes away, then start again. Do not use other products on your skin until it gets better.

【8】Speak to a doctor if your symptoms do not get better or are severe.

【9】Burning or stinging (skin irritation)

【10】Try using the gel or wash less often (once a day instead of twice, or every other day). It might help to stop using the gel for a few days until the irritation goes away, then start again.

【11】If the irritation does not go away after this time, stop using it and speak to a doctor.

【12】Speak to a doctor or pharmacist if the advice on how to cope does not help and a side effect is still bothering you or does not go away.

【13】Serious side effects
--------------------

【14】Serious side effects are rare and happen in less than 1 in 1,000 people.

【15】Stop using benzoyl peroxide if:

【16】*   the skin that you're treating becomes swollen
*   you get blisters on your skin

【17】If your symptoms do not get better within a couple of days or if they get worse at any time, call a doctor or call 111 straight away.

【18】### Serious allergic reaction

【19】In rare cases, it's possible to have a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) to benzoyl peroxide.

【20】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【21】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【22】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【23】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【24】Other side effects
------------------

【25】These are not all the side effects of benzoyl peroxide. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicine packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【26】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Benzoyl peroxide
------------------------

source_info.title: Restless legs syndrome
source_info.text:
【0】Symptoms \- Restless legs syndrome
==================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment</u>

【2】**Restless legs syndrome typically causes an overwhelming urge to move your legs and an uncomfortable sensation in your legs.**

【3】The sensation may also affect your arms, chest and face.

【4】It's been described as:

【5】*   tingling, burning, itching or throbbing
*   a "creepy-crawly" feeling
*   feeling like fizzy water is inside the blood vessels in the legs
*   a painful cramping sensation in the legs, particularly in the calves

【6】These unpleasant sensations can range from mild to unbearable, and are usually worse in the evening and during the night. They can often be relieved by moving or rubbing your legs.

【7】Some people experience symptoms occasionally, while others have them every day.

【8】You may find it difficult to sit for long periods of time (for example, on a long train journey).

【9】Periodic limb movements (PLM)
-----------------------------

【10】More than 80% of people with restless legs syndrome also have periodic limb movements (PLM).

【11】If you have PLM, your leg will jerk or twitch uncontrollably, usually at night while you're asleep.

【12】The movements are brief and repetitive, and usually occur every 20 to 40 seconds.

【13】PLM can be severe enough to wake up both you and your partner. The involuntary leg movements can also occur when you're awake and resting.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 23 March 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 23 March 2025</u>

source_info.title: Clonazepam
source_info.text:
【0】Common questions about clonazepam
=================================

【1】How does clonazepam work?

【2】Clonazepam belongs to a group of medicines called benzodiazepines.

【3】It works by increasing levels of a calming chemical, gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), in your brain.

【4】Depending on your health condition, this can relieve anxiety, stop seizures or fits or relax tense muscles. It can also help relieve muscle spasms or symptoms of restless legs syndrome.

【5】When will I feel better?

【6】How quickly clonazepam works will depend on what condition you're taking it for.

【7】For seizures, fits and involuntary muscle spasms, it might take a few days to a week for clonazepam to work fully. This is because your dose will be increased gradually until you're taking the right amount.

【8】For panic disorder and restless legs syndrome, clonazepam should take around 1 hour to start working.

【9】How will it make me feel?

【10】Clonazepam will help you feel calmer and it can reduce your feelings of anxiety.

【11】It can also make you feel sleepy and relaxed and might make you feel confused when you first start taking it.

【12】This will usually get better as you get used to taking the medicine.

【13】It's important not to drive, ride a bike or use tools or machinery if you feel sleepy or confused.

【14】Is clonazepam addictive?

【15】Clonazepam is not likely to be addictive if you take it for a short time (2 to 4 weeks).

【16】If you've been taking it for longer than 2 to 4 weeks, your doctor will reduce your dose gradually if they want you to stop taking it.

【17】You're more likely to get addicted if you've ever had problems with alcohol or drugs.

【18】Speak to your doctor if you've had problems with alcohol or recreational drugs. They may want to try you on a different medicine.

【19】What will happen if I stop taking clonazepam?

【20】If your doctor recommends you stop taking clonazepam and you've been taking it for more than 2 to 4 weeks, they will reduce your dose gradually.

【21】This allows your body to get used to being without the medicine and reduces the chance of side effects when you stop taking it.

【22】If you stop taking it suddenly, you may get some side effects, such as:

【23】*   confusion
*   seizures or fits
*   depression
*   feeling nervous or irritable
*   sweating
*   diarrhoea

【24】You're less likely to get these side effects if you reduce your dose gradually.

【25】### Important

【26】Do not stop taking clonazepam without talking to a doctor.

【27】Are there other treatments for panic disorder?

【28】For panic disorder, depending on your symptoms, you may need a medicine to treat your physical symptoms, as well as your psychological ones.

【29】If you and your doctor think it might be helpful, you may be prescribed a type of antidepressant called a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) such as sertraline, paroxetine or escitalopram.

【30】There are also different types of talking therapies for panic disorder, including cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) and counselling.

【31】Are there other medicines for muscle spasms?

【32】For involuntary muscle spasms, there are other medicines available that can help. You can discuss the different options with your doctor. They can help you decide which medicine is best for you.

【33】Are there other medicines for epilepsy?

【34】For epilepsy, treatment options include a range of different anti-epileptic drugs (AEDs), a special diet (ketogenic diet) and surgery. These may not be suitable for everyone.

【35】You can discuss the different options with your specialist. They can help you decide which may be best for you.

【36】Are there other medicines for restless legs syndrome?

【37】For restless legs syndrome, there are other medicines that can help regulate the levels of dopamine or iron in your body.

【38】If restless legs syndrome is caused by iron deficiency anaemia, iron supplements may be all that's needed to treat the symptoms.

【39】Speak to your doctor about which medicine is best for you.

【40】Will it affect my contraception?

【41】Clonazepam will not affect any type of contraception, including the combined pill and emergency contraception.

【42】Can I drive or ride a bike?

【43】Do not drive a car or ride a bike if clonazepam makes you feel sleepy, dizzy or light-headed, clumsy or unable to concentrate or make decisions.

【44】This may be more likely when you first start taking clonazepam, but could happen at any time, for example, when starting another medicine.

【45】It's an offence to drive a car if your ability to drive safely is affected. It's your responsibility to decide if it's safe to drive. If you're in any doubt, do not drive.

【46】Even if your ability to drive is not affected, the police have the right to request a saliva sample to check how much clonazepam is in your body.

【47】Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you're unsure whether it's safe for you to drive while taking clonazepam删除7：<u> GOV.UK has more information on the law on drugs and driving.</u>

【48】Can I drink alcohol while taking clonazepam?

【49】Do not drink alcohol while taking clonazepam. Alcohol can increase the side effects of clonazepam.

【50】It can make you go into a very deep sleep. This can be dangerous. There's a risk you may not be able to breathe properly and you may have difficulty waking up, or even go into a coma.

【51】Is there any food or drink I need to avoid?

【52】It's best to avoid drinks such as coffee, tea, cola and energy drinks, and not to eat too much chocolate, because these contain caffeine. Caffeine is a stimulant and may reduce the calming effects of clonazepam.

【53】Do not drink alcohol while taking clonazepam. Alcohol can increase the effects of clonazepam and make you go into a very deep sleep. There's a risk you will not be able to breathe properly and you may have difficulty waking up. This can be dangerous.

【54】Will recreational drugs affect it?

【55】Using cannabis, heroin or methadone with clonazepam will increase the drowsy effects of clonazepam.

【56】It can make you go into a very deep sleep. There's a risk you will not be able to breathe properly, and you may have difficulty waking up. This can be dangerous.

【57】Using cocaine or other stimulants such as MDMA (ecstasy) and amphetamines with clonazepam can also make you drowsy.

【58】Talk to a doctor if you think you might use recreational drugs while taking clonazepam.

【59】You can find out more about the side effects of recreational drugs on the Frank website.

【60】Can lifestyle changes help with panic disorder?

【61】If you have panic disorder, there are some things you can try to help, including:

【62】*   reading a self-help book for anxiety based on the principles of cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) (ask your doctor to recommend one)
*   trying complementary therapies such as massage and aromatherapy, or activities such as yoga or pilates, to help you relax
*   learning breathing techniques to help ease symptoms
*   exercising regularly to reduce stress and tension

【63】It may help to find out more about how to deal with panic attacks.

【64】Can lifestyle changes help with restless legs syndrome?

【65】If you have restless legs syndrome, there are some lifestyle changes that can help, including:

【66】*   quitting smoking
*   exercising regularly (but avoid exercising close to bedtime)
*   good sleep habits, such as going to bed and getting up at the same time every day, not napping during the day, and taking time to relax before going to bed
*   avoiding medicines that trigger the symptoms or make them worse (if you think a medicine is causing your symptoms, keep taking it and make an appointment to see a doctor)
删除11：<u>More in Clonazepam
------------------

【67】*   About clonazepam
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility

source_info.title: Sjögren's syndrome
source_info.text:
【0】Diagnosis \- Sjögren's syndrome
===============================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Diagnosis
4.  Treatment
5.  Complications</u>

【2】**See a GP if you have** **symptoms of Sjögren's syndrome**.

【3】They'll ask about your symptoms and look at your eyes and mouth to check for any obvious problems.

【4】Because there are many conditions with similar symptoms to Sjögren's syndrome, it can be very difficult for a GP to diagnose.

【5】They can refer you to a specialist for further checks, if needed.

【6】Blood tests
-----------

【7】Blood tests can be done to look for antibodies in your blood. Antibodies are substances produced by your immune system (the body's defence against infection) to attack germs.

【8】In Sjögren's syndrome, the immune system produces antibodies that attack healthy areas of the body. These can be found during a blood test.

【9】But not everyone with Sjögren's syndrome has these antibodies, so you may have the condition even if a blood test does not find them.

【10】Checking the layer of tears on your eyes
----------------------------------------

【11】An eye doctor (ophthalmologist) may do a test to look at the layer of tears that forms across the front of your eyes.

【12】Harmless coloured drops are put in your eyes to make the layer of tears easier to see for a short time. A special microscope with a light is then used to look at your eyes.

【13】If the layer of tears is very patchy, it could be a sign of Sjögren's syndrome.

【14】Testing a piece of lip tissue
-----------------------------

【15】In people with Sjögren's syndrome, clumps of white blood cells, which are produced by the immune system, can form inside the cells where spit (saliva) is produced.

【16】To check for this, a very small piece of tissue from the inside of your lip may be removed and looked at under a microscope. This is known as a lip biopsy.

【17】Local anaesthetic is injected into your lip to numb it before the procedure.

【18】Other tests
-----------

【19】Occasionally, other tests may be done. These may include:

【20】*   a spit test – you spit as much saliva as you can into a cup over a 5-minute period and the amount is then measured or weighed
*   measuring how many tears you produce – small strips of paper are placed in your lower eyelid for 5 minutes to see how much of the paper is soaked with tears

【21】Producing less saliva or fewer tears than normal can be a sign of Sjögren's syndrome.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 21 April 2020  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 21 April 2023</u>

source_info.title: Phenytoin
source_info.text:
【0】Taking phenytoin with other medicines and herbal supplements
============================================================

【1】Cautions with other medicines
-----------------------------

【2】There are lots of medicines that can affect phenytoin and increase the chances of you having side effects.

【3】If you need to take these medicines, your doctor may change your dose of phenytoin.

【4】Tell your doctor if you're taking:

【5】*   other medicines used to treat epilepsy, such as carbamazepine, clonazepam, lamotrigine, phenobarbital, sodium valproate, topiramate, oxcarbazepine, ethosuximide or vigabatrin
*   medicines used to treat HIV
*   hormonal contraceptives or hormone replacement therapy (HRT)
*   medicines used for heart conditions and to help prevent blood clots like digoxin, amiodarone, furosemide, warfarin, diltiazem, nifedipine, apixaban or ticagrelor
*   medicines used to treat fungal infections like fluconazole, itraconazole or miconazole
*   medicines used for tuberculosis (TB) and other infections like isoniazid, rifampicin, sulfamethoxazole-trimethoprim, doxycycline or ciprofloxacin
*   medicines used for stomach problems like omeprazole, sucralfate, ranitidine or some antacids
*   theophylline, a medicine to help with breathing problems
*   medicines used for sleeping problems (insomnia) and mental health problems like chlordiazepoxide, clozapine, clobazam, diazepam, disufiram, fluoxetine, quetiapine, trazodone or amitriptyline
*   medicines used for transplants such as ciclosporin or tacrolimus
*   medicines used for cancer
*   bupropion, a medicine to help you stop smoking

【6】This is not a full list of medicines that can affect phenytoin. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicines packet.

【7】Mixing phenytoin with herbal remedies and supplements
-----------------------------------------------------

【8】There may be a problem taking some herbal remedies and supplements alongside phenytoin.

【9】Do not take St John's wort with phenytoin, as it decreases the amount of phenytoin in your blood. If you already take it, talk to your doctor before stopping St John's wort as they may need to increase your phenytoin dose.

【10】There's not enough information to say that other herbal remedies and supplements are safe to take with phenytoin. They're not tested in the same way as pharmacy and prescription medicines.

【11】Important: Medicine safety
--------------------------

【12】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal remedies, vitamins or supplements.
删除11：<u>More in Phenytoin
-----------------

【13】*   About phenytoin
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking phenytoin with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 9 March 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 9 March 2025</u>

source_info.title: Aspirin – low-dose, see Low-dose aspirin
source_info.text:
【0】Aspirin – low-dose, see Low-dose aspirin
How and when to take low-dose aspirin
=====================================

【1】Always follow the instructions from your doctor, or the instructions inside the medicine packet on how to take it.

【2】Take low-dose aspirin once a day. Do not take it on an empty stomach. It's best to take it with or just after food. This will make it less likely to upset your stomach.

【3】Dosage
------

【4】Your doctor will discuss what dose is right for you. It's important to take low-dose aspirin exactly as recommended by your doctor.

【5】The usual dose to prevent a heart attack or stroke is 75mg once a day (a regular strength tablet for pain relief is 300mg).

【6】The usual dose for pregnant women is either 75mg or 150mg, taken once a day.

【7】The daily dose may be higher, up to 300mg once a day, especially if you have just had a stroke, heart attack or heart bypass surgery.

【8】Different types of low-dose aspirin tablets
-------------------------------------------

【9】Low-dose aspirin comes as several different types of tablet:

【10】*   tablets you swallow whole with water (standard)
*   tablets that you dissolve in a drink of water (soluble)
*   tablets that you swallow whole with water (enteric coated or gastro-resistant). These tablets have a special coating that means they may be more gentle on your stomach. Do not chew or crush them because it will stop the coating from working. If you also take indigestion remedies, take them at least 2 hours before or after you take your aspirin. The antacid in the indigestion remedy affects the way the coating on these tablets works

【11】How long to take it for
-----------------------

【12】If you're taking low-dose aspirin for angina or to prevent a heart attack or stroke, you'll usually need to take it for the rest of your life.

【13】If you forget to take it
------------------------

【14】If you forget to take a dose of aspirin, take it as soon as you remember. If you do not remember until the following day, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the usual time.

【15】Do not take 2 doses to make up for a forgotten dose.

【16】If you often forget doses, it may help to set an alarm to remind you. You could also ask your pharmacist for advice on other ways to remember to take your medicine.

【17】If you take too much
--------------------

【18】Taking 1 or 2 extra tablets is unlikely to be harmful.

【19】The amount of aspirin that can lead to overdose varies from person to person.

【20】### Urgent advice: Contact 111 for advice now if:

【21】You take more than the daily limit of 12 tablets in 24 hours and get side effects such as:

【22】*   feeling sick (nausea)
*   ringing in the ears (tinnitus)
*   hearing problems
*   confusion
*   feeling dizzy

【23】Go to 111.nhs.uk or call 111

【24】If you need to go to A&E, do not drive yourself. Get someone else to drive you or call for an ambulance.

【25】Take the aspirin packet or leaflet inside it, plus any remaining medicine, with you.
删除11：<u>More in Low-dose aspirin
------------------------

【26】*   About low-dose aspirin
*   Who can and cannot take low-dose aspirin
*   How and when to take low-dose aspirin
*   Side effects of low-dose aspirin
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility while taking low-dose aspirin
*   Taking low-dose aspirin with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions about low-dose aspirin
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 16 December 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 16 December 2024</u>

source_info.title: Scoliosis
source_info.text:
【0】Treatment in children \- Scoliosis
==================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Treatment in children
3.  Treatment in adults</u>

【2】**If your child has scoliosis, the recommended treatment will depend on their age, how severe the curve is, and whether it's getting worse.**

【3】Many children will not need treatment, and only a small number end up having surgery.

【4】There is a separate page about treatments for scoliosis in adults.

【5】Monitoring
----------

【6】Treatment is not always necessary for very young children because their spine may straighten as they grow.

【7】But if the curve does not correct itself, there's a small risk it could reduce the space for the organs to grow, so careful monitoring by a specialist is important.

【8】Your specialist may recommend regular examinations and X-rays to monitor the curve and decide if treatment is needed.

【9】Regular monitoring may also be recommended for older children with mild scoliosis, as treatment might not be needed if it's not getting worse over time.

【10】Wearing a cast
--------------

【11】In babies and toddlers, treatment to try to help straighten the spine as it grows may be recommended.

【12】This may involve wearing a plaster cast fitted around their back.

【13】The cast is worn constantly and cannot be removed, but it's changed every few months as your child grows.

【14】Parents often find it easier for their child to wear a cast while they're still very young, rather than getting them to wear a removable back brace every day.

【15】A removable back brace may be recommended once your child grows older.

【16】Back braces
-----------

【17】If the curve of your child's spine is getting worse, your specialist may recommend they wear a back brace while they're growing.

【18】This will not correct the curve, but might help stop it getting worse. There are still some uncertainties about how well braces work so they're not recommended by all scoliosis specialists.

【19】The brace:

【20】*   will be custom-made to fit your child's body
*   will normally be made of rigid plastic, although flexible braces are sometimes available
*   is designed to be difficult to see under loose-fitting clothing
*   usually needs to be worn for 23 hours a day
*   should not interfere with most everyday activities – it normally only needs to be removed for baths, showers, swimming and contact sports

【21】Your child will usually have to wear the brace for as long as they're growing删除7：<u>

【22】Scoliosis Association UK has more information about bracing.</u>

【23】Surgery
-------

【24】Surgery may be recommended if your child's scoliosis continues to get worse despite trying other treatments, or if they have severe scoliosis and they've stopped growing.

【25】The type of surgery offered will depend on your child's age.

【26】### Surgery in children

【27】Younger children – generally those under 10 – can have an operation to insert special rods alongside the spine. This can help stop the curve getting worse as the spine grows.

【28】After the operation, your child will need to return to their specialist every few months to have the rods lengthened to keep up with their growth.

【29】Depending on the type of rods used, this will be done either:

【30】*   during a minor procedure where the rods are extended through a small cut (incision) in the back
*   using a remote control that activates magnets inside the rods – no incisions are needed to lengthen these rods

【31】Even if they have surgery, your child may need to wear a brace to protect their back.

【32】When they stop growing, the rods can be removed and a final operation to straighten their spine may be carried out.

【33】### Surgery in teenagers and young adults

【34】Teenagers and young adults who've stopped growing can have an operation called a spinal fusion to correct the curve.

【35】This is a major operation where the spine is straightened using metal rods, screws, hooks or wires, along with bits of bone taken from elsewhere in your body, often the hip.

【36】These are usually left in place permanently.

【37】Most people:

【38】*   spend about a week in hospital after the operation
*   can return to school after a few weeks
*   can play sports after a few months – although they may need to avoid contact sports for longer

【39】Sometimes they'll need to wear a back brace after surgery to protect the back while it heals.

【40】### Risks of surgery

【41】Like any operation, spinal surgery carries a risk of complications. It will only be recommended if your child's surgeon feels the benefits outweigh the risks.

【42】Some of the main risks include:

【43】*   bleeding – if this is severe, your child may need a blood transfusion
*   wound infection – this can usually be treated with antibiotics
*   the rods or metalwork moving or the grafts failing to attach properly – additional surgery may be required to correct this
*   in rare cases, damage to the nerves in the spine – this can lead to permanent numbness in the legs, and can sometimes cause paralysis of the legs and loss of bowel and bladder control

【44】Make sure you discuss the potential complications with your surgeon.
删除4：<u>### More information

【45】*   Scoliosis Association UK: surgery in young people (adolescent idiopathic scoliosis surgery)
*   Scoliosis Association UK: preparing your child for surgery
*   Scoliosis Association UK: advice for before and after surgery

【46】</u>
Exercise and other therapies
----------------------------

【47】Regular exercise is important for children with scoliosis. It can help improve muscle strength and may help reduce any back pain.

【48】Children with scoliosis can usually do most types of exercise. They only need to avoid certain activities if advised to do so by a specialist.

【49】It's not yet clear whether specific back exercises or physiotherapy can help improve scoliosis, and they're not recommended by all specialists.

【50】There's currently little reliable evidence to suggest that other therapies, such as osteopathy and chiropractic, can help correct a curved spine or stop it getting worse.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 12 April 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 12 April 2026</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Scoliosis</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Treatment in adults</u>

source_info.title: Lercanidipine
source_info.text:
【0】Taking lercanidipine with other medicines and herbal supplements
================================================================

【1】Cautions with other medicines
-----------------------------

【2】If you take other medicines that lower blood pressure at the same time as lercanidipine, the combination can sometimes lower your blood pressure too much.

【3】This may make you feel dizzy or faint. If this keeps happening to you, tell your doctor as your doses may need to be changed.

【4】Some medicines can affect the way lercanidipine works. Lercanidipine can also affect the way some other medicines work.

【5】Tell your doctor or pharmacist before taking lercanidipine if you're taking:

【6】*   aminophylline or theophylline (medicines to ease breathing)
*   itraconazole, ketoconazole or voriconazole, antifungal medicines
*   erythromycin or clarithromycin, antibiotics
*   heart medicines such as digoxin, amiodarone, sotalol or metoprolol
*   antiviral medicines to treat HIV
*   rifampicin, a medicine to treat tuberculosis
*   carbamazepine, phenytoin, phenobarbital (phenobarbitone) or primidone, medicines for epilepsy
*   ciclosporin, a medicine to reduce immune reactions

【7】Mixing lercanidipine with herbal remedies or supplements
--------------------------------------------------------

【8】There's very little information about taking herbal remedies and supplements with lercanidipine. They're not tested in the same way as pharmacy and prescription medicines.

【9】Important: Medicine safety
--------------------------

【10】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal remedies, vitamins or supplements.

source_info.title: Trastuzumab (Herceptin)
source_info.text:
【0】Who can and cannot have trastuzumab \- Brand names: Herceptin, Herzuma, Kanjinti, Ontruzant, Trazimera, Zercepac
================================================================================================================

【1】Who can have trastuzumab
------------------------

【2】Most adults aged 18 years old and over can have trastuzumab.

【3】Trastuzumab will only be given to you if your cancer is HER2 positive.

【4】Who may not be able to have trastuzumab
---------------------------------------

【5】Trastuzumab is not suitable for some people. To make sure it's safe for you, tell your doctor if you:

【6】*   have ever had an allergic reaction to trastuzumab or any other medicine
*   have severe breathing problems because of your cancer or you have oxygen therapy
*   have a heart condition, such as heart failure, severe angina or a problem with your heart valves
*   have poorly controlled high blood pressure (hypertension)
*   are trying to get pregnant, pregnant, or breastfeeding
删除11：<u>More in Trastuzumab (Herceptin)
-------------------------------

【7】*   About trastuzumab
*   Who can and cannot have it
*   How and when to have it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking it with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 19 April 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 19 April 2026</u>

source_info.title: Coronary heart disease
source_info.text:
【0】Recovery \- Coronary heart disease
==================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Recovery
7.  Prevention</u>

【2】**It's possible to lead a normal life after having heart surgery or problems like a heart attack.**

【3】Cardiac rehabilitation programme
--------------------------------

【4】Cardiac rehabilitation, or cardiac rehab, is a programme to help you recover and get back to living your life after a recent heart attack or heart failure. It's an important part of your recovery.

【5】### How to access cardiac rehabilitation

【6】A member of the cardiac rehab team may visit you in hospital with information about your condition or the procedure you're having. After you leave hospital, they may visit you at home or call you to check on your progress.

【7】You do not need a referral from your cardiologist. You can also:

【8】*   contact your local cardiac team – you can call the British Heart Foundation's Heart Helpline on 0808 802 1234 for help finding your nearest cardiac rehab programme
*   contact your GP surgery to find out how to register for cardiac rehab

【9】Cardiac rehab programmes are available locally, often in weekly sessions that last 6 to 12 weeks. You may be able to choose between group classes, online classes or a home programme.

【10】### How cardiac rehabilitation can help

【11】Research has found that people who attend cardiac rehab have a lower risk of having another heart attack and being admitted to hospital. It also had a positive impact on their wellbeing and quality of life.

【12】Your local cardiac rehab service can give you more details about what they offer, but most programmes will cover:

【13】*   physical activities that are suitable for you
*   educational talks about managing your condition, taking medicines and other practical advice
*   relaxation techniques and how to manage stress
*   psychological support for anxiety and low mood

【14】Your cardiac rehab team will tailor the programme to suit your age, fitness level and any other medical issues.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【15】*   British Heart Foundation: cardiac rehabilitation

【16】</u>
Self care
---------

【17】Self care is an integral part of daily life, and is all about you taking responsibility for your own health and wellbeing with the support of those involved in your care.

【18】Self care includes actions you take for yourself every day so you stay fit and maintain good physical and mental health. It also helps you to prevent illness or accidents and care more effectively for minor ailments and long-term conditions.

【19】People living with long-term conditions can benefit enormously from being supported so they can achieve self care. They can live longer, have less pain, anxiety, depression and fatigue, have a better quality of life, and be more active and independent.

【20】Support groups
--------------

【21】If you have a heart condition, or if you're caring for someone with a heart condition, you might find it useful to meet other people in your area who are in a similar situation.

【22】There are a number of heart support groups around the UK that organise regular exercise sessions, such as walking groups, as well as other social activities. A GP or specialist can provide you with details about your nearest group.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【23】*   British Heart Foundation: how we can help you
*   British Heart Foundation: call the Heart Helpline on 0300 330 3311

【24】</u>
Relationships and sex
---------------------

【25】Coming to terms with a long-term condition such as heart disease can put a strain on you, your family and your friends. It can be difficult to talk to people about your condition, even if they're close to you.

【26】Be open about how you feel and let your family and friends know what they can do to help. But do not feel shy about telling them you need some time to yourself.

【27】### Your sex life

【28】If you have coronary heart disease (CHD) or you've recently had heart surgery, you may be concerned about having sex. You'll usually be able to resume sexual activity as soon as you feel well enough.

【29】Communicate with your partner and stay open-minded. Explore what you both like sexually. Simply touching, being touched and being close to someone helps a person feel loved and special.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【30】*   British Heart Foundation: sex and heart conditions

【31】</u>
Returning to work
-----------------

【32】After recovering from heart surgery, you should be able to return to work, but you may need to change the type of work you do. For example, you may not be able to do a job that involves heavy physical exertion.

【33】Your specialist will be able to advise you about when you can return to work and what type of activities you should avoid.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【34】*   British Heart Foundation: returning to work

【35】</u>
Financial support
-----------------

【36】If you're unable to work after having heart surgery, you may be entitled to financial support, such as:

【37】*   GOV.UK: Attendance Allowance
*   GOV.UK: Disability Living Allowance
*   GOV.UK: Statutory Sick Pay

【38】If you're caring for someone who has heart disease, you may also be entitled to financial support.

【39】To find out if you're entitled to financial support, you can contact your local Social Security department. To request a claim form, contact the Disability Service Centre.
删除6：<u>### Further information

【40】*   British Heart Foundation: finance and benefits
*   Care and support: benefits for carers and benefits for the person you care for
*   GOV.UK: benefits and financial support
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 10 March 2020  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 10 March 2023</u>
</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Treatment</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Prevention</u>

source_info.title: Fibromyalgia
source_info.text:
【0】Overview \- Fibromyalgia
========================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Self-help</u>

【2】**Fibromyalgia, also called fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS), is a long-term condition that causes pain all over the body.**

【3】Symptoms of fibromyalgia
------------------------

【4】As well as widespread pain, other symptoms of fibromyalgia include:

【5】*   increased sensitivity to pain
*   muscle stiffness
*   difficulty getting to sleep or staying asleep, which can make you feel very tired (fatigue)
*   problems with mental processes (known as "fibro-fog"), such as difficulty concentrating or remembering things
*   headaches
*   irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), a digestive condition that causes stomach pain and bloating
*   feelings of frustration, worry or low mood

【6】The symptoms of fibromyalgia are changeable – for example, they can sometimes suddenly improve or get worse.

【7】See a GP if you think you have fibromyalgia. Treatment can ease some of the symptoms, although they're unlikely to disappear completely.

【8】How fibromyalgia is treated
---------------------------

【9】Although there's currently no cure for fibromyalgia, there are treatments to help relieve some of the symptoms and make the condition easier to live with.

【10】Treatment tends to be a combination of:

【11】*   lifestyle changes, such as exercise programmes and relaxation techniques
*   talking therapies, such as cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) and acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT)
*   medicine, such as antidepressants

【12】In particular, exercise has a number of important benefits for people with fibromyalgia, including helping to reduce pain.

【13】What causes fibromyalgia?
-------------------------

【14】The exact cause of fibromyalgia is unknown, but it's thought to be related to abnormal levels of certain chemicals in the brain and changes in the way the central nervous system (the brain, spinal cord and nerves) processes pain messages carried around the body.

【15】It's also suggested that some people are more likely to develop fibromyalgia because of genes inherited from their parents.

【16】In many cases, the condition appears to be triggered by things that are physical or emotional like an injury, an infection or stress.

【17】Who's affected
--------------

【18】Anyone can develop fibromyalgia, but it's more common in women than men.

【19】The condition typically develops between the ages of 25 and 55, but people of any age can get it, including children and older people.

【20】It's not clear exactly how many people are affected by fibromyalgia, although research has suggested it could be a relatively common condition.

【21】Some estimates suggest nearly 1 in 20 people may be affected by fibromyalgia to some degree.

【22】One of the main reasons it's not clear how many people are affected is because fibromyalgia can be a difficult condition to diagnose.

【23】There's no specific test for the condition, and the symptoms can be similar to a number of other conditions.

【24】Support groups
--------------

【25】If you have fibromyalgia, support groups can provide an important network for talking to others living with the condition.

【26】Fibromyalgia Action UK is a charity that offers information and support to people with fibromyalgia.

【27】If you have any questions about fibromyalgia, call the charity's helpline on 0300 999 3333.

【28】Fibromyalgia Action UK also has a number of regional co-ordinators who can put you in touch with a support group near you.

【29】Another organisation you may find useful is UK Fibromyalgia.

source_info.title: Timolol tablets
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of timolol tablets
===============================

【1】Like all medicines, timolol tablets can cause side effects in some people, but many people have no side effects or only minor ones.

【2】Side effects often improve as your body gets used to the medicine.

【3】Side effects
------------

【4】There are things you can do to help cope with these possible side effects of timolol tablets:

【5】Feeling sleepy, tired or dizzy

【6】As your body gets used to timolol, these side effects should wear off. If timolol makes you feel dizzy or weak, sit or lie down until you feel better. Do not drive, ride a bike, or use tools or machinery if you're feeling tired or dizzy. Do not drink alcohol as this can make you feel worse.

【7】Cold fingers or toes

【8】Put your hands or feet under warm running water, massage them, and wiggle your fingers and toes. Do not smoke or have drinks with caffeine in. Both of these can make your blood vessels narrower and restrict your blood flow. Smoking also makes your skin colder. Try wearing mittens (they're warmer than gloves) and warm socks. Do not wear tight watches or bracelets because it could affect your blood flow.

【9】Feeling or being sick (nausea or vomiting)

【10】Stick to simple meals and do not eat rich or spicy food. It might help to take your timolol after a meal or snack.

【11】If you're being sick, try drinking small, frequent sips of water. Speak to a pharmacist if you have signs of dehydration, such as peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee. Do not take any other medicines to treat vomiting without speaking to a pharmacist or doctor.

【12】If you take contraceptive pills and you're being sick, your contraception may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet for advice.

【13】Diarrhoea

【14】Drink lots of fluids, such as water or squash, to avoid dehydration. Signs of dehydration include peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee.

【15】Do not take any other medicines to treat diarrhoea without speaking to a pharmacist or doctor.

【16】If you take contraceptive pills and you have severe diarrhoea for more than 24 hours, your contraception may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【17】Stomach pain

【18】Try to rest and relax. It can help to eat and drink slowly and have smaller and more frequent meals. Putting a heat pad or covered hot water bottle on your stomach may also help.

【19】If you are in a lot of pain, speak to your pharmacist or doctor.

【20】Speak to a doctor or pharmacist if the advice on how to cope does not help and a side effect is still bothering you or does not go away.

【21】### Serious side effects

【22】It happens rarely, but some people have serious side effects when taking timolol tablets.

【23】Tell your doctor or call 111 straight away if you have:

【24】*   shortness of breath with a cough that gets worse when you exercise (like walking up stairs), swollen ankles or legs or an irregular heartbeat – these can be signs of heart problems
*   shortness of breath, wheezing and tightening of the chest – these can be signs of lung problems

【25】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【26】*   you get chest pain that does not stop after a few minutes, or is new or worse if you already have angina - chest pain is a possible sign of a heart attack and needs to be checked as soon as possible

【27】### Serious allergic reaction

【28】In rare cases, it's possible to have a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) to timolol tablets.

【29】##### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【30】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【31】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【32】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【33】### Other side effects

【34】These are not all the side effects of timolol tablets. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicine packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【35】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Timolol tablets
-----------------------

【36】*   About timolol tablets
*   Who can and cannot take them
*   How and when to take them
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking timolol tablets with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
