source_info.title: Carbocisteine
source_info.text:
【0】Taking carbocisteine with other medicines and herbal supplements \- Brand name: Mucodyne
========================================================================================

【1】Cautions with other medicines
-----------------------------

【2】Carbocisteine does not mix well with some medicines.

【3】Tell your doctor or a pharmacist it you're taking any medicines that can cause bleeding or ulcers in your stomach. These include:

【4】*   NSAIDs (non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) such as ibuprofen, naproxen, diclofenac or high-dose aspirin
*   steroids (also called corticosteroids)
*   antiplatelet medicines that help to prevent blood clots, such as clopidogrel, low-dose aspirin or ticagrelor

【5】Mixing carbocisteine with herbal remedies and supplements
---------------------------------------------------------

【6】There's not enough information to say that complementary medicines and herbal remedies are safe to take with carbocisteine. They're not tested in the same way as pharmacy and prescription medicines. They're generally not tested for the effect they have on other medicines.

【7】Important: Medicine safety
--------------------------

【8】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal remedies, vitamins or supplements.
删除11：<u>More in Carbocisteine
---------------------

【9】*   About carbocisteine
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking it with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 3 March 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 3 March 2026</u>

source_info.title: Subdural haematoma
source_info.text:
【0】Diagnosis \- Subdural haematoma
===============================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Recovery</u>

【2】**Subdural haematomas are diagnosed based on a person's medical history, symptoms and the results of a brain scan.**

【3】Checking your medical history
-----------------------------

【4】The doctor assessing you in hospital might suspect you have a subdural haematoma if you recently injured your head and have some of the main symptoms of a subdural haematoma, such as confusion or a worsening headache.

【5】It will also be helpful to know if you take anticoagulant ("blood-thinning") medicine to prevent blood clots, as this can increase your chances of developing a subdural haematoma.

【6】If necessary, a blood test can be carried out to assess your blood's ability to clot.

【7】Sometimes your doctor will want to find out if you have previously been diagnosed with another condition that can have similar symptoms to a subdural haematoma, such as dementia or a brain tumour.

【8】Tests may be done to rule these conditions out.

【9】Assessing your symptoms
-----------------------

【10】You'll be examined to see if you have any physical signs of an injury to your head, such as cuts and bruises.

【11】Tests to check how your pupils react to light will be used to check for signs of a brain injury.

【12】The Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) will also normally be used to check your level of consciousness and help determine the severity of any brain injury.

【13】The GCS scores you on:

【14】*   your verbal responses – whether you can speak appropriately or make any sounds at all
*   your motor response – whether you can move voluntarily or in response to stimulation
*   whether you can open your eyes

【15】If your GCS score suggests there may be a problem with your brain, a brain scan will be carried out.
删除7：<u>Read more about the Glasgow Coma Scale on the Headway website</u>

【16】Brain scans
-----------

【17】Most people with a suspected subdural haematoma will have a CT scan to confirm the diagnosis.

【18】A CT scan uses X-rays and a computer to create detailed images of the inside of your body.

【19】It can show whether any blood has collected between your skull and your brain.

【20】In a few cases, an MRI scan may be used to check for a subdural haematoma instead.

【21】This is a type of scan that uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves to produce detailed images of the inside of the body.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 19 August 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 19 August 2024</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Causes</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Treatment</u>

source_info.title: Tiotropium inhalers
source_info.text:
【0】How and when to use tiotropium inhalers \- Brand names: Braltus, Spiriva, Spiriva Respimat
==========================================================================================

【1】Always follow the instructions from your doctor, or your asthma or respiratory nurse.

【2】Dosage
------

【3】The usual dose of tiotropium is 1 or 2 puffs, taken once a day. Use it at the same time each day.

【4】It's important to use your tiotropium inhaler regularly to manage your condition. Keep using it, even if you do not have any symptoms.

【5】You'll usually stay on the same dose. If the brand of tiotropium inhaler you use changes, the number of puffs you need to take may change. You'll still only use the inhaler once a day.

【6】How to use it
-------------

【7】There are different types of tiotropium inhaler.

【8】Before using your inhaler, read the information leaflet that came with it. This leaflet contains instructions and diagrams to show you how to use the inhaler, how to keep it clean, and how long to use it before getting a replacement.

【9】It's very important to use your inhaler properly. This is so you get the right amount of tiotropium into your lungs and the most benefit from your medicine.

【10】After using your inhaler, always put the lid back on to keep it clean.

【11】Unlike steroid inhalers, after using your tiotropium inhaler you do not need to rinse your mouth with water.

【12】### Inhalers with capsules

【13】Some tiotropium inhalers use capsules that contain the medicine in a powder. Brands include:

【14】*   Braltus capsules, used with the Zonda device
*   Spiriva capsules, used with the HandiHaler device

【15】Put a new capsule into the device each time you use it.

【16】The inhaler has a button that makes a hole in the capsule. You then breathe in the powder from the capsule through the mouthpiece on the inhaler.

【17】Inhale from the device twice to make sure that you've inhaled all of the medicine and the capsule is empty.

【18】#### Important: Risk of choking

【19】Always store your capsules in the screw-top bottle or blister pack that comes with the capsules. Do not store them inside the inhaler. Always check that the mouthpiece is clear before using your inhaler.

【20】### Inhalers with cartridges

【21】Tiotropium inhalers that use cartridges include:

【22】*   Spiolto Respimat
*   Spiriva Respimat
*   Yanimo Respimat

【23】The cartridge contains several doses, so you do not need to replace it each time you use your inhaler.

【24】Check your inhaler technique
----------------------------

【25】To get the most from your inhaler, it's important to have your technique checked regularly.

【26】If you're not sure how to use your inhaler, or your technique has not been checked for a year, ask your doctor, nurse or a pharmacist to watch you use it.

【27】How long to use it for
----------------------

【28】You'll usually use your tiotropium inhaler for a long time, sometimes many years. It helps prevent your asthma or COPD getting worse.

【29】It's important to keep using your inhaler even if you feel better.

【30】If you forget to use it
-----------------------

【31】If you forget a dose, use your inhaler as soon as you remember, unless you do not remember until the next day. In this case, skip the missed dose and have your next dose at the usual time.

【32】Do not take 2 doses to make up for a forgotten dose.

【33】If you forget doses often, it may help to set an alarm to remind you. You could also ask your pharmacist for advice on other ways to help you remember to take your medicine.

【34】If you use too much
-------------------

【35】Using too much tiotropium can cause a dry mouth, a faster heartbeat or blurred vision.

【36】### Urgent advice: Contact 111 for advice now if:

【37】*   you use more than your prescribed dose of tiotropium and have a faster heartbeat or blurred vision.

【38】Call 111 or get help from 111 online.

【39】If you need to go to A&E, do not drive yourself. Get someone else to drive you or call for an ambulance.

【40】Take the tiotropium inhaler and the packet or leaflet with you.
删除11：<u>More in Tiotropium inhalers
---------------------------

【41】*   About tiotropium inhalers
*   Who can and cannot use them
*   How and when to use them
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Using them with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 31 October 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 31 October 2026</u>

source_info.title: Being sick, see Diarrhoea and vomiting
source_info.text:
【0】Being sick, see Diarrhoea and vomiting
Diarrhoea and vomiting
======================

【1】**Diarrhoea and vomiting are common in adults, children and babies. They're often caused by a stomach bug and should stop in a few days.**

【2】The advice is the same if you have diarrhoea and vomiting together or separately.

【3】How to treat diarrhoea and vomiting yourself
--------------------------------------------

【4】Diarrhoea and vomiting can usually be treated at home. The most important thing is to have lots of fluids to avoid dehydration.

【5】### Do

【6】*   stay at home and get plenty of rest

【7】*   drink lots of fluids, such as water or squash – take small sips if you feel sick

【8】*   carry on breast or bottle feeding your baby – if they're being sick, try giving small feeds more often than usual

【9】*   give babies on formula or solid foods small sips of water between feeds

【10】*   eat when you feel able to – it may help to avoid foods that are fatty or spicy

【11】*   take paracetamol if you're in discomfort – check the leaflet before giving it to your child

【12】### Don’t

【13】*   do not have fruit juice or fizzy drinks – they can make diarrhoea worse

【14】*   do not make baby formula weaker – use it at its usual strength

【15】*   do not give children under 12 medicine to stop diarrhoea

【16】*   do not give aspirin to children under 16

【17】How long diarrhoea and vomiting last
------------------------------------

【18】In adults and children:

【19】*   diarrhoea usually stops within 5 to 7 days
*   vomiting usually stops in 1 or 2 days

【20】Diarrhoea and vomiting can spread easily
----------------------------------------

【21】Stay off school or work until you've not been sick or had diarrhoea for at least 2 days.

【22】If you have a high temperature or do not feel well enough to do your normal activities, try to stay at home and avoid contact with other people until you feel better.

【23】To help avoid spreading an infection:

【24】*   wash your hands with soap and water frequently
*   wash any clothing or bedding that has poo or vomit on it separately on a hot wash
*   clean toilet seats, flush handles, taps, surfaces and door handles every day
*   do not prepare food for other people, if possible
*   do not share towels, flannels, cutlery or utensils
*   do not use a swimming pool until at least 48 hours after your symptoms stop

【25】A pharmacist can help with diarrhoea and vomiting
-------------------------------------------------

【26】Speak to a pharmacist if:

【27】*   you or your child (over 5 years) have signs of dehydration, such as dark, smelly pee or peeing less than usual
*   you're an older person, have a weakened immune system, or have other health conditions that increase your risk of dehydration
*   you need to stop diarrhoea for a few hours

【28】They may recommend:

【29】*   oral rehydration powder that you mix with water to make a drink
*   medicine to stop diarrhoea for a few hours, like loperamide (not suitable for children under 12)

【30】Find a pharmacy

【31】Urgent advice: Call 111 now if:
-------------------------------

【32】*   you're worried about a baby under 12 months
*   your child stops breast or bottle feeding while they're ill
*   a child under 5 years has signs of dehydration, such as fewer wet nappies
*   you or your child (over 5 years) still have signs of dehydration after using oral rehydration sachets
*   you or your child keep being sick and cannot keep fluid down
*   you or your child have bloody diarrhoea or bleeding from the bottom
*   you or your child have diarrhoea for more than 7 days or vomiting for more than 2 days

【33】111 will tell you what to do. They can arrange a phone call from a nurse or doctor if you need one.

【34】Immediate action required: Call 999 or go to A&E if you or your child:
----------------------------------------------------------------------

【35】*   vomit blood or have vomit that looks like ground coffee
*   have green vomit (adults)
*   have yellow-green or green vomit (children)
*   may have swallowed something poisonous
*   have a stiff neck and pain when looking at bright lights
*   have a sudden, severe headache
*   have a sudden, severe tummy ache
*   have blue, grey, pale or blotchy skin, lips or tongue - on brown or black skin this may be easier to see on the palms of the hands or soles of the feet
*   are having severe difficulty breathing, or taking lots of quick, short breaths
*   are confused or not responding as usual

【36】What we mean by severe pain

【37】Severe pain:

【38】*   always there and so bad it's hard to think or talk
*   you cannot sleep
*   it's very hard to move, get out of bed, go to the bathroom, wash or dress

【39】Moderate pain:

【40】*   always there
*   makes it hard to concentrate or sleep
*   you can manage to get up, wash or dress

【41】Mild pain:

【42】*   comes and goes
*   is annoying but does not stop you doing daily activities

【43】Find your nearest A&E

【44】Causes of diarrhoea and vomiting
--------------------------------

【45】The most common causes of diarrhoea and vomiting are:

【46】*   a stomach bug
*   food poisoning

【47】Other causes of diarrhoea or vomiting

【48】**Diarrhoea can also be caused by:**

【49】*   medicines – check the leaflet to see if it's a side effect
*   a food intolerance or food allergy
*   irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
*   anxiety
*   appendicitis
*   inflammatory bowel disease
*   coeliac disease
*   diverticular disease
*   radiation treatment in the pelvic area

【50】**Vomiting can also be caused by:**

【51】*   pregnancy
*   migraine
*   motion sickness
*   inner ear infections, such as labyrinthitis
*   medicines – check the leaflet to see if it's a side effect
*   reflux – where a baby brings feeds back up ("spitting up")
*   other infections, such as a urinary tract infection (UTI)

source_info.title: Recovery     -       Hysterectomy
source_info.text:
【0】Recovery     -       Hysterectomy
Recovery \- Hysterectomy
========================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Why it's necessary
3.  Considerations
4.  How it's performed
5.  Recovery
6.  Complications</u>

【2】**After having a hysterectomy, you may wake up feeling tired and in some pain. This is normal after this type of surgery.**

【3】You'll be given painkillers to help reduce any pain and discomfort.

【4】If you feel sick after the anaesthetic, your nurse can give you medicine to help relieve this.

【5】You may have:

【6】*   dressings placed over your wounds
*   a drip in your arm
*   a catheter – a small tube that drains urine from your bladder into a collection bag
*   a drainage tube in your abdomen (if you have had an abdominal hysterectomy) to take away any blood from beneath your wound – these tubes usually stay in place for 1 to 2 days
*   a gauze pack inserted into your vagina (if you have had a vaginal hysterectomy) to minimise the risk of bleeding – this usually stays in place for 24 hours

【7】You may also be slightly uncomfortable and feel like you need to poo.

【8】The day after your operation, you'll be encouraged to take a short walk.

【9】This helps your blood to flow normally, reducing the risk of complications developing, such as blood clots in your legs (deep vein thrombosis).

【10】A physiotherapist may show you how to do some exercises to help your mobility.

【11】They may also show you some pelvic floor muscle exercises to help with your recovery.

【12】After the catheter has been removed, you should be able to pass urine normally.

【13】Any stitches that need to be removed will be taken out 5 to 7 days after your operation.

【14】Your recovery time
------------------

【15】The length of time it'll take before you're well enough to leave hospital depends on your age and your general level of health.

【16】If you have had a vaginal or laparoscopic hysterectomy, you may be able to leave between 1 and 4 days later. 

【17】If you have had an abdominal hysterectomy, it'll usually be up to 5 days before you're discharged.

【18】You may be asked to see your GP who will check how well you're recovering.

【19】It can take about 6 to 8 weeks to fully recover after having an abdominal hysterectomy.

【20】Recovery times are often shorter after a vaginal or laparoscopy hysterectomy.

【21】During this time, you should rest as much as possible and not lift anything heavy, such as bags of shopping.

【22】Your abdominal muscles and the surrounding tissues need time to heal.

【23】If you live by yourself, you may be able to get help from your local NHS authority while you're recovering from your operation.

【24】Hospital staff should be able to advise you further about this.

【25】Side effects
------------

【26】After having a hysterectomy, you may have some temporary side effects.

【27】### Bowel and bladder disturbances

【28】After your operation, there may be some changes in your bowel and bladder functions when going to the toilet.

【29】Some women develop urinary tract infections or constipation. Both can easily be treated.

【30】It's recommended that you drink plenty of fluids and increase the fruit and fibre in your diet to help with your bowel and bladder movements.

【31】For the first few bowel movements after a hysterectomy, you may need laxatives to help you avoid straining.

【32】Some people find it more comfortable to hold their abdomen to provide support while passing a stool.

【33】### Vaginal discharge

【34】After a hysterectomy, you'll experience some vaginal bleeding and discharge.

【35】This will be less discharge than during a period, but it may last up to 6 weeks.

【36】Visit your GP if you experience heavy vaginal bleeding, start passing blood clots or have a strong-smelling discharge.

【37】### Menopausal symptoms

【38】If your ovaries are removed, you'll usually experience severe menopausal symptoms after your operation.

【39】These may include:

【40】*   hot flushes
*   anxiety
*   weepiness
*   sweating

【41】You may have hormone replacement therapy (HRT) after your operation.

【42】This can be given in the form of an implant, injections or tablets.

【43】### Emotional effects

【44】You may feel a sense of loss and sadness after having a hysterectomy.

【45】These feelings are particularly common in women with advanced cancer, who have no other treatment option.

【46】Some women who have not yet experienced the menopause may feel a sense of loss because they're no longer able to have children. Others may feel less "womanly" than before.

【47】In some cases, having a hysterectomy can be a trigger for depression.

【48】See your GP if you have feelings of depression that will not go away, as they can advise you about the available treatment options.

【49】Talking to other women who have had a hysterectomy may help by providing emotional support and reassurance.

【50】Your GP or the hospital staff may be able to recommend a local support group.

【51】Getting back to normal
----------------------

【52】### Returning to work

【53】How long it will take for you to return to work depends on how you feel and what sort of work you do.

【54】If your job does not involve manual work or heavy lifting, it may be possible to return after 6 to 8 weeks. Your doctor will advise you when you can return to work.

【55】### Driving

【56】Do not drive until you're comfortable wearing a seatbelt and can safely perform an emergency stop.

【57】This can be anything from 2 to 6 weeks after your operation.

【58】You may want to check with your GP that you're fit to drive before you start.

【59】Some car insurance companies require a certificate from a GP stating that you're fit to drive. Check this with your car insurance company.

【60】### Exercise and lifting

【61】After a hysterectomy, the hospital where you were treated should give you information and advice about suitable forms of exercise while you recover.

【62】Walking is always recommended, and you can swim after your wounds have healed.

【63】Do not try to do too much as you'll probably feel more tired than usual.

【64】Do not lift any heavy objects during your recovery period.

【65】If you have to lift light objects, make sure your knees are bent and your back is straight.

【66】### Sex

【67】After a hysterectomy, it's generally recommended that you do not have sex until your scars have healed and any vaginal discharge has stopped, which usually takes at least 4 to 6 weeks.

【68】As long as you're comfortable and relaxed, it's safe to have sex after that. 

【69】You may experience some vaginal dryness, particularly if you have had your ovaries removed and you're not taking HRT.

【70】Many women also experience an initial loss of sexual desire (libido) after the operation, but this usually returns once they have fully recovered.

【71】### Contraception

【72】You no longer need to use contraception to prevent pregnancy after having a hysterectomy.

【73】But you'll still need to use condoms to protect yourself against sexually transmitted infections (STIs).
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 11 October 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 11 October 2025</u>

source_info.title: Retinal migraine
source_info.text:
【0】Retinal migraine
================

【1】**Retinal migraines are a type of migraine that affect the eyes. They can cause temporary vision loss in 1 eye and other eye symptoms.**

【2】Retinal migraines are less common than other types of migraine.

【3】Check if it's a retinal migraine
--------------------------------

【4】Retinal migraines usually affect 1 eye.

【5】They often come on suddenly and symptoms include:

【6】*   vision loss – this usually lasts around 10 to 20 minutes but can sometimes last up to 1 hour
*   a blind spot in your vision
*   a headache – you may get this at the same time as the eye symptoms or shortly afterwards
*   other eye symptoms, such as blurred vision and seeing flashing lights, zigzag patterns or coloured spots or lines
*   feeling sick or being sick

【7】Sometimes you can get the eye symptoms without having a headache.

【8】Urgent advice: Ask for an urgent GP appointment or get help from NHS 111 if:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

【9】*   you have vision problems, such as a blind spot in your vision, for the first time

【10】You can call 111 or get help from 111 online.

【11】Non-urgent advice: See a GP if:
-------------------------------

【12】You have retinal migraines and:

【13】*   they're getting worse
*   you're getting them more often
*   there's a change to your usual symptoms

【14】Immediate action required: Call 999 if:
---------------------------------------

【15】*   you have a headache that came on suddenly and is extremely painful
*   you suddenly have problems speaking or remembering things
*   you have sudden vision loss, blurred vision or double vision
*   you suddenly feel dizzy, drowsy or confused
*   you have a seizure or fit
*   you have a high temperature with a stiff neck, pain when looking at bright lights, pale and blotchy skin or a rash that does not fade when you roll a glass over it
*   you have sudden weakness in your arms or legs on 1 side of your body, or 1 side of your face

【16】These are signs of more serious conditions and you need to get immediate medical help.

【17】Treatments for retinal migraine
-------------------------------

【18】Treatment for retinal migraines is not usually needed if you do not have them very often.

【19】If you have them frequently, a GP may suggest:

【20】*   trying to avoid things that cause your migraines, such as cutting down on caffeine or alcohol
*   painkillers like paracetamol or ibuprofen
*   medicines to stop you feeling sick or being sick
*   medicines to help prevent migraines, such as topiramate or amitriptyline
*   a few weeks of acupuncture

【21】If these treatments do not help control your migraines, you may be referred to a specialist called a neurologist for more tests and treatment.

【22】Causes of retinal migraine
--------------------------

【23】Retinal migraines are thought to happen when the blood vessels in your eye suddenly narrow, restricting the blood flow.

【24】Things that can cause them include:

【25】*   stress
*   caffeine and alcohol
*   dehydration
*   smoking
*   high blood pressure
*   bending over
*   low blood sugar
*   some types of hormonal contraception

【26】Keeping a record of when you get migraines in a diary can help you work out what might be causing them.

【27】Things you can do if you get retinal migraines
----------------------------------------------

【28】There are things you can do if you get retinal migraines. A GP may suggest trying them before recommending other treatments.

【29】### Do

【30】*   try sleeping or lying down in a dark room during a migraine

【31】*   drink plenty of water to avoid dehydration

【32】*   have a healthy diet and eat meals at regular times

【33】*   exercise regularly and get plenty of sleep

【34】*   try to keep to a healthy weight

【35】*   try to manage your stress levels

【36】*   avoid things you know can trigger migraines like caffeine and alcohol

【37】删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 19 January 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 19 January 2026</u>

source_info.title: Symptoms     -       Vaginal cancer
source_info.text:
【0】Symptoms     -       Vaginal cancer
Symptoms \- Vaginal cancer
==========================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Tests and next steps
5.  Treatment
6.  Help and support</u>

【2】Main symptoms of vaginal cancer
-------------------------------

【3】The main symptoms of vaginal cancer are usually:

【4】*   a lump in the vagina
*   ulcers and other skin changes in or around the vagina

【5】Other symptoms of vaginal cancer include:

【6】*   bleeding from the vagina after the menopause
*   bleeding after sex or pain during sex
*   smelly or bloodstained vaginal discharge
*   bleeding between periods
*   an itch in your vagina that will not go away
*   pain when you pee, or needing to pee a lot

【7】Vaginal cancer is rare, especially in women under 40.

【8】Non-urgent advice: See a GP if:
-------------------------------

【9】*   you have any symptoms of vaginal cancer

【10】Important
---------

【11】These symptoms are very common and can be caused by many different conditions.

【12】Having them does not definitely mean you have vaginal cancer. But it's important to get them checked by a GP.

【13】This is because if they're caused by cancer, finding it early makes it more treatable.

【14】What happens at your GP appointment
-----------------------------------

【15】The GP or practice nurse may ask to examine you.

【16】You can ask for a female doctor or nurse when you book your appointment.

【17】You'll be asked to undress, behind a screen, from the waist down. You'll be given a sheet to put over you.

【18】Then the GP or nurse may:

【19】*   look at the outside of your vagina (vulva)
*   feel inside your vagina with 2 fingers while pressing on your tummy (they will be wearing gloves)

【20】It should not be painful, but you might find it uncomfortable. Talk to the GP or nurse if you're feeling uncomfortable.

【21】You can have a friend, family member or another member of staff in the room with you during the examination if you want.

【22】You can ask to stop the examination at any time.

【23】Referral to a specialist
------------------------

【24】The GP may refer you for more tests or to see a specialist in hospital if they think you have a condition that needs to be investigated.

【25】This may be an urgent referral, usually within 2 weeks, if you have certain symptoms. This does not definitely mean you have cancer.
删除6：<u>Information:

【26】Find out more
-------------

【27】*   Cancer Research UK: seeing a GP about vaginal cancer symptoms
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 07 November 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 07 November 2026</u>
</u>

source_info.title: Alcohol-related liver disease
source_info.text:
【0】Diagnosis \- Alcohol-related liver disease
==========================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Complications</u>

【2】**Alcohol-related liver disease (ARLD) is often first suspected when tests for other medical conditions show a damaged liver.**

【3】This is because the condition causes few obvious symptoms in the early stages.

【4】If a doctor suspects ARLD, they'll usually arrange a blood test to check how well your liver is working. They may also ask about your alcohol consumption.

【5】It's important to be totally honest about how much and how often you drink alcohol. This is to avoid further unnecessary testing, which could lead to a delay in the treatment you need.

【6】Blood tests
-----------

【7】Blood tests used to assess the liver are known as liver function tests.

【8】But liver function tests can be normal at many stages of liver disease.

【9】Blood tests can also detect if you have low levels of certain substances, such as a protein called serum albumin, which is made by the liver.

【10】A low level of serum albumin suggests your liver is not functioning properly.

【11】A blood test may also look for signs of abnormal blood clotting, which can indicate significant liver damage.
删除7：<u>Find more information on liver blood tests on the Lab Tests Online website</u>

【12】Further testing
---------------

【13】If your symptoms or liver function test suggest an advanced form of ARLD (either alcoholic hepatitis or cirrhosis), you may need further tests.

【14】### Imaging tests

【15】Scans may be needed to produce detailed images of your liver.

【16】This may include:

【17】*   an ultrasound scan
*   a CT scan
*   an MRI scan

【18】Some scans may also measure the stiffness of the liver, which is a good indication of whether your liver is scarred.

【19】### Liver biopsy

【20】During a liver biopsy, a fine needle is inserted into your body (usually between your ribs).

【21】A small sample of liver cells is taken and sent to a laboratory to be examined under a microscope.

【22】The biopsy is usually carried out under local anaesthetic, either as a day case or with an overnight stay in hospital.

【23】Your liver tissue will be examined to determine the degree of scarring in the liver and the cause of the damage.

【24】### Endoscopy

【25】An endoscope is a long, thin, flexible tube with a light and a video camera at one end. 

【26】During an endoscopy, the instrument is passed down your oesophagus (the long tube that carries food from the throat to the stomach) and into your stomach.

【27】Pictures of your oesophagus and stomach are transmitted to an external screen. The doctor will be looking for swollen veins (varices), which are a sign of cirrhosis.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 20 September 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 20 September 2025</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Causes</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Treatment</u>

source_info.title: Tadalafil
source_info.text:
【0】How and when to take tadalafil \- Brand names: Cialis, Adcirca
==============================================================

【1】It's important to take this medicine as advised by a doctor or pharmacist.

【2】If you have a private prescription for tadalafil, read the information that comes with your medicine carefully. The strength and dosage instructions can vary.

【3】Dosage and strength
-------------------

【4】Tadalafil comes as 2.5mg, 5mg, 10mg and 20mg tablets.

【5】### Dose for erectile dysfunction

【6】The usual dose of tadalafil for erectile dysfunction is 10mg when you need it. Do not take more than 1 tablet a day.

【7】Your doctor may increase or decrease your dose, depending on how well it works and how often you take it.

【8】The effects may last longer than 24 hours, so you're not recommended to take the 10mg or 20mg tablets every day.

【9】For the tablet to work properly, you'll need to be sexually excited.

【10】### Dose for benign prostate enlargement

【11】Tadalafil for an enlarged prostate comes as 2.5mg or 5mg tablets. The usual dose is 5mg, taken once a day.

【12】If you're being treated for both benign prostate enlargement and erectile dysfunction, the dose is 5mg.

【13】### Dose for pulmonary hypertension

【14】Tadalafil for pulmonary hypertension comes as 20mg tablets.

【15】The usual dose is 40mg – two 20mg tablets, taken once a day.

【16】If you have kidney or liver problems your doctor might decrease the starting dose to 10mg or 20mg.

【17】How to take it
--------------

【18】Swallow your tablets whole with a drink of water or juice (but not grapefruit juice).

【19】For erectile dysfunction, take 1 tablet at least 30 minutes before you want to have sex.

【20】If you are taking tadalafil for prostate enlargement, you can take your tablet in the morning or evening, but it's best to take it at the same time each day.

【21】Tadalafil tablets for pulmonary hypertension are large and may be difficult to swallow.

【22】If you forget to take it
------------------------

【23】If you have:

【24】*   **benign prostate enlargement** – take it as soon as you remember and then continue as usual
*   **pulmonary hypertension** – take it within 8 hours if you can. If you remember after 8 hours, skip the missed dose and take the next dose at the usual time

【25】Never take 2 doses at the same time. Never take an extra dose to make up for a forgotten one.

【26】If you often forget doses, it may help to set an alarm to remind you. You could also ask a pharmacist for advice on other ways to help you remember to take your medicine.

【27】If you take too much
--------------------

【28】Taking too much tadalafil can cause side effects, including:

【29】*   headache
*   dizziness
*   indigestion
*   stuffy nose
*   changes to your vision (such as blurred vision)

【30】### Urgent advice: Contact 111 for advice now if:

【31】*   you take more than your prescribed dose of tadalafil

【32】Go to 111.nhs.uk or call 111

【33】If you need to go to A&E, do not drive yourself. Get someone else to drive you or call for an ambulance.

【34】Take the tadalafil packet, or the leaflet inside it, plus any remaining medicine with you.
删除11：<u>More in Tadalafil
-----------------

source_info.title: Indapamide
source_info.text:
【0】Who can and cannot take indapamide
==================================

【1】Who can take indapamide
-----------------------

【2】Most adults aged 18 and over can take indapamide.

【3】Who may not be able to take indapamide
--------------------------------------

【4】Indapamide is not suitable for some people. To make sure it's safe for you, tell your doctor if you:

【5】*   have ever had an allergic reaction to indapamide or any other medicine
*   are trying to get pregnant, are pregnant or breastfeeding
*   have liver or kidney disease
*   have low levels potassium or sodium, or high levels of calcium in your blood
*   have gout
*   have diabetes
*   have an inflammatory condition called systemic lupus erythematosus
*   have heart rhythm problems (such as arrhythmia)
*   have underactive adrenal glands (Addison's disease)
*   have a rare disease called porphyria
删除11：<u>More in Indapamide
------------------

【6】*   About indapamide
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking indapamide with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions

source_info.title: Blood poisoning, see Sepsis
source_info.text:
【0】Blood poisoning, see Sepsis
Symptoms \- Sepsis
==================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Symptoms
2.  Who can get it
3.  Treatment and recovery</u>

【2】Check if it's sepsis
--------------------

【3】Sepsis is life threatening. It can be hard to spot.

【4】There are lots of possible symptoms. They can be like symptoms of other conditions, including flu or a chest infection.

【5】If you think you or someone you look after has symptoms of sepsis, call 999 or go to A&E. Trust your instincts.

【6】### Immediate action required: Call 999 or go to A&E if:

【7】A baby or young child has any of these symptoms of sepsis:

【8】*   blue, grey, pale or blotchy skin, lips or tongue – on brown or black skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of the hands or soles of the feet
*   a rash that does not fade when you roll a glass over it, the same as meningitis
*   difficulty breathing (you may notice grunting noises or their stomach sucking under their ribcage), breathlessness or breathing very fast
*   a weak, high-pitched cry that's not like their normal cry
*   not responding like they normally do, or not interested in feeding or normal activities
*   being sleepier than normal or difficult to wake

【9】They may not have all these symptoms.

【10】Find your nearest A&E

【11】### Immediate action required: Call 999 or go to A&E if:

【12】An adult or older child has any of these symptoms of sepsis:

【13】*   acting confused, slurred speech or not making sense
*   blue, grey, pale or blotchy skin, lips or tongue – on brown or black skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of the hands or soles of the feet
*   a rash that does not fade when you roll a glass over it, the same as meningitis
*   difficulty breathing, breathlessness or breathing very fast

【14】They may not have all these symptoms.

【15】Find your nearest A&E

【16】### Urgent advice: Call 111 now if:

【17】You, your child or someone you look after:

【18】*   feels very unwell or like there's something seriously wrong
*   has not had a pee all day (for adults and older children) or in the last 12 hours (for babies and young children)
*   keeps vomiting and cannot keep any food or milk down (for babies and young children)
*   has swelling or pain around a cut or wound
*   has a very high or low temperature, feels hot or cold to the touch, or is shivering

【19】Do not worry if you're not sure if it's sepsis – it's still best to call 111.

【20】They can tell you what to do, arrange a phone call from a nurse or doctor, or call you an ambulance.

【21】### Sepsis can be especially hard to spot in:

【22】*   babies and young children
*   people with dementia
*   people with a learning disability
*   people who have difficulty communicating

【23】Information:

【24】Further information on sepsis for people with a learning disability and their carers:

【25】*   NHS England: easy read information about sepsis for people with a learning disability
*   YouTube: NHS Sherwood Forest Hospitals video about sepsis for people with a learning disability
*   YouTube: NHS Sherwood Forest Hospitals video about sepsis for families and carers of people with a learning disability

【26】What is sepsis?
---------------

【27】Sepsis is a life-threatening reaction to an infection.

【28】It happens when your immune system overreacts to an infection and starts to damage your body's own tissues and organs.

【29】You cannot catch sepsis from another person.

【30】Sepsis is sometimes called septicaemia or blood poisoning.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 05 September 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 05 September 2025</u>
删除1：<u>*   Next : Who can get it</u>

source_info.title: Mometasone inhalers
source_info.text:
【0】Using mometasone inhalers with other medicines and herbal supplements \- Brand name: Asmanex
============================================================================================

【1】Cautions with other medicines
-----------------------------

【2】Mometasone inhalers can be used with most other medicines. But some medicines may affect your inhaler and increase the chance of having side effects.

【3】Check with a pharmacist or your doctor if you're taking:

【4】*   medicines to treat HIV, such as ritonavir or cobicistat
*   antifungal medicines such as itraconazole
*   other medicines that contain steroids such as eczema creams, steroid tablets, steroid injections, nasal sprays, eye drops or nose drops

【5】Mixing mometasone with herbal remedies and supplements
------------------------------------------------------

【6】There's not enough information to say that complementary medicines, herbal remedies and supplements are safe to take with mometasone inhalers. They're not tested in the same way as pharmacy and prescription medicines. They're generally not tested for the effect they have on other medicines.

【7】Important: Medicine safety
--------------------------

【8】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal remedies, vitamins or supplements.
删除11：<u>More in Mometasone inhalers
---------------------------

【9】*   About mometasone inhalers
*   Who can and cannot use them
*   How and when to use them
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Using them with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 6 September 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 6 September 2026</u>

source_info.title: Donepezil
source_info.text:
【0】Common questions about donepezil \- Brand names: Aricept, Aricept Evess
=======================================================================

【1】How does donepezil work?

【2】Donepezil works by slowing the breakdown of a chemical called acetylcholine in the brain. Higher levels of acetylcholine improves communication between nerve cells in the brain. Acetylcholine sends messages between nerve cells and the brain.

【3】Donepezil does not cure dementia. However, by increasing the amount of acetylcholine in your brain, it can help with symptoms like:

【4】*   forgetting recent conversations and where you put things
*   forgetting how to do things, like making a cup of tea
*   thinking slowly, for example taking longer to reply to what someone says
*   finding it more difficult to understand complicated things, like managing money
*   feeling anxious
*   not wanting to do things

【5】It does not seem to help with symptoms like being agitated or aggressive.

【6】Information:

【7】### Recommended reading
删除7：<u>Find out more about how medicines like donepezil work on the Alzheimer's Society website</u>

【8】How long does it take to work?

【9】It usually takes at least a month for donepezil to start to work, but it can take longer for some people.

【10】You may notice it starts to help with:

【11】*   remembering things like conversations and where you put things
*   being able to do everyday activities, like making a cup of tea
*   concentrating on things for longer
*   feeling less anxious
*   feeling more motivated to do things

【12】Donepezil does not help everyone in the same way. Some people find it helps with their symptoms a lot. For others, it might not help at all.

【13】Keep taking your donepezil every day, unless your doctor tells you to stop.

【14】You'll get a follow-up appointment so your doctor can check how well the medicine is working. They'll also check whether you have any side effects.

【15】If you're bothered by side effects, tell your doctor. They may be able to recommend a different medicine.

【16】Are there any long-term side effects?

【17】There's no evidence that donepezil will harm you if you take it for a long time.

【18】You'll have regular check-ups to see whether you're getting any side effects.

【19】Your doctor will only continue to prescribe this medicine for as long as it's helping.

【20】Can I drive or ride a bike?

【21】Some people feel sleepy or dizzy when taking donepezil. If this happens to you, do not drive or ride a bike until you feel OK again.

【22】If you've been diagnosed with dementia, you're are legally required to inform the DVLA and your car insurance company promptly.

【23】This does not necessarily mean you have to stop driving immediately. Some people with dementia prefer to give up driving because they find it stressful, but others continue driving for some time as long as it's safe for them to do so.

【24】The DVLA will ask for medical reports and possibly a special driving assessment to decide whether you can continue driving.
删除5：<u>Information:
删除7：<u>Find out more about driving and dementia from the Alzheimer's Society</u></u>

【25】Can I drink alcohol while taking donepezil?

【26】It's usually best to not to drink alcohol, or to cut back on your drinking, when taking donepezil. It can stop your medicine from working as well as it should. It can also make you more likely to have side effects.

【27】Drinking alcohol can also make the symptoms of dementia worse. It can make you more forgetful or confused.

【28】Is there any food or drink that I need to avoid?

【29】Apart from reducing your alcohol intake, you can eat and drink normally while taking donepezil.
删除11：<u>More in Donepezil
-----------------

【30】*   About donepezil
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking it with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 15 March 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 15 March 2026</u>

source_info.title: Acute pancreatitis
source_info.text:
【0】Complications \- Acute pancreatitis
===================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Complications
7.  Prevention</u>

【2】**Most people with acute pancreatitis recover without experiencing any further problems. But those with severe acute pancreatitis can develop serious complications.**

【3】Pseudocysts
-----------

【4】Sometimes, sacs of fluid, called pseudocysts, can develop on the surface of the pancreas in people with acute pancreatitis.

【5】These can cause bloating, indigestion and dull tummy pain. They often disappear on their own but can sometimes get infected and may need to be drained.

【6】Pancreatic necrosis and infection
---------------------------------

【7】Sometimes people with severe acute pancreatitis can develop a complication where the pancreas loses its blood supply. This can cause some of the tissue of the pancreas to die (necrosis).

【8】When this happens, the pancreas can become infected, which can spread into the blood (sepsis) and cause organ failure.

【9】People with necrosis and an infection may need injections of antibiotics and surgery to remove the dead tissue.

【10】This is a very serious complication that needs treating, and it can be fatal.

【11】Chronic pancreatitis
--------------------

【12】If you keep getting acute pancreatitis, it may eventually permanently damage your pancreas.

【13】This is called chronic pancreatitis and is a long-term condition that can seriously affect your quality of life.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 24 May 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 24 May 2025</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Treatment</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Prevention</u>

source_info.title: AAA screening, see Abdominal aortic aneurysm screening
source_info.text:
【0】AAA screening, see Abdominal aortic aneurysm screening
FAQs \- Abdominal aortic aneurysm screening
===========================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  FAQs</u>

【2】Is AAA screening offered outside England?
-----------------------------------------

【3】AAA screening programmes have been set up in Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales.

【4】通用删除3(英):<u>For more information, see:</u>

【5】*   Northern Ireland: NI Direct AAA screening
*   Scotland: NHS Inform AAA screening
*   Wales: NHS Wales AAA Screening Programme

【6】What happens if I'm a man over 65 and have not been screened?
-------------------------------------------------------------

【7】If you're a man over 65 and you have not been screened before, you can contact your local screening service to ask for a scan without going through a GP.

【8】Can women and men under 65 be screened?
---------------------------------------

【9】AAA screening is not routinely offered to women and men under 65 because most burst AAAs happen in men over 65. Men are 6 times more likely to have an AAA than women.

【10】There's not enough evidence to suggest that routinely screening women and younger men would deliver major benefits.

【11】But if you think you might be at an increased risk of getting an AAA because a close family member has had one. Talk to a GP about the possibility of having a scan to check for an AAA.

【12】If the GP feels you might benefit from having a scan, it will usually be done when you're 5 years younger than the age at which your relative was when they were found to have an AAA.

【13】If you have a family history of AAA, you should take the usual health precautions of not smoking, eating healthily and exercising regularly.
删除7：<u>Read more about how to reduce your risk of getting an AAA</u>

【14】Can I drive if I have an AAA?
-----------------------------

【15】You may need to tell the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) if you have an AAA. You may need to stop driving if it's large.

【16】The DVLA says:

【17】*   car and motorcycle drivers must tell the DVLA if their AAA measures more than 6cm and stop driving if it reaches 6.5cm
*   bus, coach and lorry drivers must tell the DVLA if they have an AAA of any size and stop driving if it reaches 5.5cm

【18】You can usually drive again once your AAA has been treated. The GOV删除7：<u>UK website has more about how to tell the DVLA about an AAA.</u>

【19】Ask a GP if you're not sure whether you need to inform the DVLA about your AAA, or temporarily stop driving.

【20】Having an AAA should not affect your car insurance premium.

【21】Can I fly if I have an AAA?
---------------------------

【22】It's safe to travel by plane if you have an AAA. They're no more likely to burst at a high altitude than on the ground.

【23】The Association of British Insurers (ABI) has been advised of this and it's not aware of any airlines that refuse people with an AAA.

【24】Can I get travel insurance if I have an AAA?
--------------------------------------------

【25】The ABI is unaware of any travel insurance policies that specifically exclude AAAs as part of their standard wording.

【26】They suggest that anyone with an AAA should declare it during the application process (or when it's diagnosed, if you already have a travel insurance policy).

【27】If you declare an AAA, you may be asked if you:

【28】*   have had surgery (and if so, when you had it)
*   are on a waiting list for surgery
*   have any other related health conditions

【29】You may be charged an additional premium or have the condition excluded from your cover.

【30】When looking for cover, a broker can help. The British Insurance Brokers Association (BIBA) operates a find a broker service that can help – they can be contacted on 0370 950 1790.

【31】Could I find out about other health problems as a result of AAA screening?
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

【32】No. During the screening scan the technician only looks at your aorta to check if you have an AAA. They do not check for any other health conditions.

【33】If you have any concerns about your health, speak to a GP.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 12 January 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 12 January 2024</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Abdominal aortic aneurysm screening</u>

Scotland: NHS Inform AAA screening
