source_info.title: Incontinence (urinary), see Urinary incontinence
source_info.text:
【0】Incontinence (urinary), see Urinary incontinence
Incontinence products \- Urinary incontinence
=============================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Non-surgical treatment
6.  Surgery and procedures
7.  Incontinence products
8.  10 ways to stop leaks</u>

【2】**Incontinence pads and other products and devices can make life easier for you if you're waiting for a diagnosis or for a treatment to work.**

【3】A wide range of products and devices are available for urinary incontinence.

【4】They include:

【5】*   pads and pants
*   bed and chair protection
*   catheters and penile sheaths
*   skincare and hygiene products
*   specially adapted clothing and swimwear

【6】Pads and pull-up pants
----------------------

【7】The most popular incontinence products are absorbent pads that are worn inside underwear to soak up urine.

【8】Pads and pull-up pants use the same technology as babies' nappies and have a "hydrophobic" layer which draws urine away from the surface of the product, so your skin stays dry.

【9】If you have mild to moderate incontinence you can buy thin, discreet pads or pull-up pants for men and women from many supermarkets and pharmacies.

【10】For people with severe leaks, continence clinics and district nurses can supply incontinence pads on the NHS, but these tend to be big and bulky.

【11】Using tampons for stress incontinence
-------------------------------------

【12】Placing a tampon in your vagina puts pressure on the neck of your bladder to stop leaks on exertion. However, do not regularly use super-size tampons to prevent sudden leaks if you have stress incontinence.

【13】The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) does not recommend using tampons for the routine management of urinary incontinence in women.

【14】However, tampons can be used occasionally, when necessary, to prevent leaks. For example, during exercise.

【15】Appliances and bedding
----------------------

【16】Other useful incontinence products for more severe leaks include urinals (devices that collect urine), or sheaths and drainage systems (if you have a penis).

【17】A variety of incontinence bedding is also available, such as washable bed pads that sit on top of the mattress and soak up any overnight leaks. The pads stay dry to the touch and they can be useful for trips away from home.

【18】Can I get incontinence products on the NHS?
-------------------------------------------

【19】You may be able to get incontinence products on the NHS depending on your local integrated care board (ICB). Ask your GP for details of your local continence service. To qualify for NHS products you may need to be assessed by a healthcare professional.

【20】Where to buy incontinence products
----------------------------------

【21】The charity Bladder & Bowel UK gives independent advice on products that can help manage bladder and bowel problems.

【22】通用删除3(英):<u>For more information on products and how to order them, call its helpline on 0161 214 4591 or visit the Bladder & Bowel UK website.</u>

【23】The Continence Product Advisor gives independent and evidence-based advice on how to choose and use suitable incontinence products.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 15 June 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 15 June 2026</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Surgery and procedures</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : 10 ways to stop leaks</u>

source_info.title: TIA, see Transient ischaemic attack (TIA)
source_info.text:
【0】TIA, see Transient ischaemic attack (TIA)
Diagnosis \- Transient ischaemic attack (TIA)
=============================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Symptoms
3.  Causes
4.  Diagnosis
5.  Treatment
6.  Prevention</u>

【2】**It's important to be assessed by a healthcare professional as soon as possible if you think you've had a transient ischaemic attack (TIA).**

【3】After an initial assessment, you will be referred to a specialist for further tests to help determine the cause of the TIA. You should be referred to see a specialist within 24 hours of the start of your symptoms.

【4】Initial assessment
------------------

【5】TIAs are often over very quickly, so you may not have any symptoms by the time you see a doctor.

【6】If they suspect you've had a TIA, you'll be given aspirin to take straight away to prevent a stroke, unless there’s a medical reason why you cannot take aspirin. You'll also be referred to a specialist for further tests.

【7】Specialist assessment
---------------------

【8】You'll usually be seen by a doctor who specialises in conditions that affect the brain and spine (neurologist), or a consultant who specialises in strokes. This may be in a specialist stroke or TIA clinic, or an acute stroke unit.

【9】You'll be asked about the symptoms you experienced during the TIA and how long they lasted. This will help to rule out other conditions that may have caused your symptoms.

【10】Even if you no longer have symptoms, you may still need a neurological examination. This involves simple tasks designed to check your strength, sensation and co-ordination skills.

【11】Tests
-----

【12】Several tests may be done to confirm a TIA and look for problems that may have caused it. Some of these tests include:

【13】### Blood pressure tests

【14】Your blood pressure will be checked, because high blood pressure (hypertension) can lead to TIAs.

【15】### Blood tests

【16】You might need blood tests to check whether you have high cholesterol or diabetes.

【17】### Electrocardiogram (ECG)

【18】An electrocardiogram (ECG) measures your heart's electrical activity using a number of electrodes (small, sticky patches) attached to your skin.

【19】An ECG can detect abnormal heart rhythms, which may be a sign of conditions such as where your heart beats irregularly (atrial fibrillation), which can increase your risk of TIAs.

【20】### Carotid ultrasound

【21】A carotid ultrasound scan can show if there is narrowing or any blockages in the neck arteries leading to your brain.

【22】A small probe (transducer) sends high-frequency sound waves into your body. When these sound waves bounce back, they can be used to create an image of the inside of your body.

【23】### Brain scans

【24】Brain scans are not always necessary if you've had a TIA. They're usually only done if it's not clear which part of your brain was affected.

【25】An MRI scan is most often used. This type of scan uses a strong magnetic field and radio waves to create an image of your brain.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 28 June 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 28 June 2026</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : Causes</u>删除1：<u>*   Next : Treatment</u>

source_info.title: Tendonitis
source_info.text:
【0】Tendonitis
==========

【1】**Tendonitis is when a tendon swells (becomes inflamed) after an injury. It can cause joint pain and stiffness, and affect how a tendon moves. You can treat a mild tendon injury yourself and it should feel better within 2 to 3 weeks.**

【2】How to treat tendonitis yourself
--------------------------------

【3】Follow these steps for 2 to 3 days to help manage pain and support the tendon.

【4】*   Rest: try to avoid moving the tendon for 2 to 3 days.
*   Ice: put an ice pack (or try a bag of frozen peas) wrapped in a tea towel on the tendon for up to 20 minutes every 2 to 3 hours.
*   Support: wrap an elastic bandage around the area, use a tube bandage, or use a soft brace. You can buy these from pharmacies. It should be snug, not tight.

【5】It's important to take a bandage or brace off before going to bed.

【6】When you're able to move the injured area without pain stopping you, try to keep moving it so the joint does not become stiff.

【7】To help prevent further injury or pain, try to avoid:

【8】*   heavy lifting, strong gripping or twisting actions that make the symptoms worse
*   playing any sport until the tendon has recovered

【9】### A pharmacist may be able to help with tendonitis

【10】A pharmacist can recommend the best painkiller for you. Paracetamol and ibuprofen can help to ease pain.

【11】They may also recommend an ibuprofen gel to rub on your skin.

【12】Find a pharmacy

【13】Symptoms of tendonitis
----------------------

【14】There are tendons all over your body. They connect your muscles to bones in your joints, for example, in your knees, elbows and shoulders.

【15】The main symptoms of tendonitis are:

【16】*   pain in a tendon that gets worse when you move
*   difficulty moving the joint
*   feeling a grating or crackling sensation when you move the tendon
*   swelling, sometimes with heat or redness

【17】If the pain is sudden and severe, and happened during an accident or activity, you may have torn (ruptured) a tendon.

【18】You might have heard a popping or snapping sound when the pain started.

【19】### Urgent advice: Get help from NHS 111 if:

【20】*   you have injured a joint and your symptoms do not improve within a few weeks
*   you're in a lot of pain
*   you think you have ruptured a tendon

【21】You can call 111 or get help from 111 online.

【22】You could also go to your nearest urgent treatment centre.

【23】Treatment for tendonitis
------------------------

【24】If you need treatment for tendonitis a GP may prescribe a stronger painkiller or suggest you use an ibuprofen gel on your skin to ease the pain.

【25】If the pain is severe, lasts a long time, or your movement is limited, you may be referred for physiotherapy. You can also see a physiotherapist privately.

【26】If physiotherapy does not help, you may be referred to a doctor who specialises in muscles and bones (orthopaedic specialist) or a local musculoskeletal clinic.

【27】Some people with severe tendonitis may be offered:

【28】*   steroid injections, which may provide short-term pain relief
*   surgery to remove damaged tissue or repair a ruptured tendon

【29】Find a physiotherapist

【30】Information:

【31】### Self-refer for treatment

【32】If you have tendonitis, you might be able to refer yourself directly to services for help with your condition without seeing a GP.

【33】To find out if there are any services in your area:

【34】*   ask the reception staff at your GP surgery
*   check your GP surgery's website
*   contact your integrated care board (ICB) – find your local ICB
*   search online for NHS treatment for tendonitis near you

【35】Preventing tendon problems
--------------------------

【36】Tendonitis is usually caused by sudden, sharp movements or repetitive exercise, such as running, jumping or throwing.

【37】It can also be caused by repetitive movements, or having poor posture or technique while at work or when playing a sport. This is known as repetitive strain injury (RSI).

【38】You cannot always prevent tendonitis. But there are things you can do to help reduce the chance of a tendon injury.

【39】### Do

【40】*   warm up before exercising and gently stretch afterwards

【41】*   wear supportive shoes or insoles for exercise

【42】*   take regular breaks from repetitive exercises

【43】### Don’t

【44】*   do not overexercise tired muscles

【45】*   do not start a new sport without some training or practice

【46】*   do not do the same repetitive exercises

【47】删除3：<u>Video: What is tendonitis?
--------------------------

【48】This animation explains what tendonitis is and what causes it.
删除1：<u>Media last reviewed: 1 April 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Media review due: 1 April 2024</u>
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 09 June 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 09 June 2026</u></u>

source_info.title: MRI scan
source_info.text:
【0】Who can have one \- MRI scan
============================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  How it's performed
3.  Who can have one</u>

【2】**Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is very safe and most people are able to have the procedure.**

【3】But in some instances an MRI scan may not be recommended.

【4】When your doctor refers you for an MRI scan, tell them if:

【5】*   you think you have any metal in or on your body
*   you're pregnant or breastfeeding
*   you've ever had an allergic reaction to a contrast agent
*   you have kidney problems

【6】The strong magnets used during the scan can affect any metal implants or fragments in your body.

【7】There's no evidence that MRI scans are a risk for pregnant women, but whether you'll be offered one depends on why you need it.

【8】A doctor can discuss with you whether an MRI scan or contrast agent (dye) is suitable for you. If you do have an MRI scan, the radiographers will make sure it's as safe as possible for you and your baby.

【9】Metal implants or fragments
---------------------------

【10】Having something metallic in your body doesn't necessarily mean you can't have an MRI scan, but it's important for medical staff carrying out the scan to be aware of it.

【11】They can decide on a case-by-case basis if there are any risks, or if further measures need to be taken to ensure the scan is as safe as possible.

【12】For example, it may be possible to make a pacemaker or defibrillator MRI-safe, or to monitor your heart rhythm during the procedure.

【13】You may need to have an X-ray if you're unsure about any metal fragments in your body.

【14】Examples of metal implants or fragments include:

【15】*   **a** **pacemaker** – a small electrical device used to control an irregular heartbeat
*   **an** **implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD)** – a similar device to a pacemaker that uses electrical shocks to regulate heartbeats
*   **metal plates, wires, screws or rods** – used during surgery for bone fractures
*   **a nerve stimulator** – an electrical implant used to treat long-term nerve pain
*   **a cochlear implant** – a device similar to a hearing aid that's surgically implanted inside the ear
*   **a drug pump implant** – used to treat long-term pain by delivering painkilling medication directly to an area of the body, such as the lower back
*   **brain aneurysm clips** – small metal clips used to seal blood vessels in the brain that would otherwise be at risk of rupturing (bursting)
*   **stents, filters and vascular coils** – small metal devices that are surgically implanted in blood vessels
*   **metallic fragments** in or near your eyes or blood vessels (common in people who do welding or metalwork for a living)
*   **prosthetic (artificial) metal heart valves**
*   **penile implants** – used to treat erectile dysfunction (impotence)
*   **eye implants** – such as small metal clips used to hold the retina in place
*   **an** **intrauterine device (IUD)** or coil – a contraceptive device made of plastic and copper that fits inside the womb
*   **artificial joints** – such as those used for a hip replacement or knee replacement
*   **dental fillings and bridges**
*   **tubal ligation clips** – used in female sterilisation
*   **surgical clips or staples** – used to close wounds after an operation
*   **tattoos or permanent make-up**
*   **objects such as bullets or shrapnel**
*   **breast expanders** – used after a mastectomy
*   **insulin pumps** **and** **glucose monitors** – electronic devices used by some people with diabetes

【16】Tattoos
-------

【17】Some tattoo ink contains traces of metal, but most tattoos are safe in an MRI scanner.

【18】Tell the radiographer immediately if you feel any discomfort or heat in your tattoo during the scan.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 26 July 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 26 July 2025</u>
删除1：<u>*   Previous : How it's performed</u>

source_info.title: Clobetasone
source_info.text:
【0】Using clobetasone with other medicines and herbal supplements \- Brand names: Eumovate, Clobavate
=================================================================================================

【1】Cautions with other medicines
-----------------------------

【2】It's very unlikely that other medicines will affect the way clobetasone works. This applies to prescription medicines as well as the ones you buy from a pharmacy or shop.

【3】However, tell your pharmacist or doctor if you're taking:

【4】*   ritonavir (for HIV infection)
*   itraconazole (for a fungal infection)

【5】These medicines can increase the chances of side effects in the rest of your body.

【6】Mixing clobetasone with herbal remedies and supplements
-------------------------------------------------------

【7】There's not enough information to say whether complementary medicines, herbal remedies and supplements are safe to take with clobetasone. They're not tested in the same way as pharmacy and prescription medicines. They're generally not tested for the effect they have on other medicines.

【8】Important: Medicine safety
--------------------------

【9】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal remedies, vitamins or supplements.
删除11：<u>More in Clobetasone
-------------------

【10】*   About clobetasone
*   Who can and cannot use it
*   How and when to use it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Using it with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 6 October 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 6 October 2025</u>

source_info.title: Chorionic villus sampling
source_info.text:
【0】Results \- Chorionic villus sampling
====================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Why it's offered
3.  What happens
4.  Results
5.  Complications</u>

【2】**After chorionic villus sampling (CVS) has been carried out, the sample of cells will be sent to a laboratory to be tested.**

【3】The number of chromosomes (bundles of genes) in the cells can be counted, and the structure of the chromosomes can be checked.

【4】If CVS is being carried out to test for a specific genetic condition, the cells in the sample can also be tested for this.

【5】Getting the results
-------------------

【6】The first results of the test should be available in about 3 days. This is known as the rapid CVS result.

【7】A more detailed set of CVS results will be available within 2 weeks.

【8】If the rapid CVS result and a previous ultrasound scan both indicate your baby has a condition, your doctor will discuss your options with you straightaway.

【9】If your previous ultrasound did not find anything unexpected, it’s recommended you wait until the more detailed set of CVS results before making a decision about ending your pregnancy.

【10】If the results of these tests suggest that it is highly likely your baby will have a genetic condition, a specialist doctor (obstetrician) or midwife will explain what the screening results mean and talk to you about your options.

【11】There's no cure for most of the conditions found by CVS, so you'll need to consider your options carefully.

【12】You may decide to continue with your pregnancy while gathering information about the condition so you're fully prepared.

【13】You can usually choose whether to get the results over the phone or during a face-to-face meeting at the hospital or at home.

【14】You'll also receive written confirmation of the results.

【15】How reliable are the results?
-----------------------------

【16】CVS is estimated to give a definitive result in 99 out of every 100 women having the test.

【17】But it cannot test for every condition and it's not always possible to get a conclusive result.

【18】In a very small number of cases, the results of CVS cannot establish with certainty if your baby will have the condition the test is looking for.

【19】This might be because the sample of cells removed was too small.

【20】Or there's a possibility there's a change in the structure of the chromosomes in the placenta and not in the baby.

【21】If this happens, it may be necessary to have amniocentesis, an alternative test where a sample of amniotic fluid is taken from the womb.

【22】This is done a few weeks later to confirm a diagnosis.

【23】What the results mean
---------------------

【24】Many women who have CVS will have a "normal" result. This means that none of the conditions that were tested for were found in the baby.

【25】But as the test only checks for conditions caused by certain genes, it cannot exclude any conditions not tested for.

【26】If a test result is "positive", in 99 out of 100 positive results the baby will have the condition tested for.

【27】In this instance, the implications will be fully discussed with you and you'll need to decide how to proceed.

【28】What happens if a condition is likely
-------------------------------------

【29】If your test results shows it is highly likely that your baby will be born with a condition, you can speak to a number of specialists about what this means.

【30】These could include a midwife, a doctor who specialises in children's health (consultant paediatrician), a geneticist and a genetic counsellor.

【31】They'll be able to give you detailed information about the condition, including the possible symptoms your child may have, the treatment and support they might need, and whether their life expectancy will be affected, to help you decide what to do.

【32】A baby born with 1 of these conditions will always have the condition, so you'll need to consider your options carefully.

【33】Your options are to:

【34】*   continue with your pregnancy – it can help to find out as much as you can about the condition your baby may have
*   end your pregnancy (have a termination) 

【35】This can be a very difficult decision, but you do not have to make it on your own.

【36】As well as discussing it with specialist healthcare professionals, it can help to talk things over with your partner and speak to close friends and family.

【37】You can also get support and more information from charities like:

【38】*   Antenatal Results and Choices (ARC)
*   Down's Syndrome Association
*   Sickle Cell Society
*   SOFT UK (Support Organisation for Trisomy 13 and 18)

source_info.title: Overview     -       Periods
source_info.text:
【0】Overview     -       Periods
Overview \- Periods
===================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  Starting your periods
3.  Period problems</u>

【2】**A period is the part of the menstrual cycle when a woman bleeds from her vagina for a few days.**

【3】For most women this happens every 28 days or so, but it's common for periods to be more or less frequent than this, ranging from every 23 days to every 35 days.

【4】Your period can last between 2 and 7 days, but it will usually last for about 5 days. The bleeding tends to be heaviest in the first 2 days.

【5】When your period is at its heaviest, the blood will be red. On lighter days, it may be pink or brown.

【6】You'll lose about 20 to 90ml (about 1 to 5 tablespoons) of blood during your period, although some women bleed more heavily than this.
删除7：<u>Read more about heavy periods, period pain, irregular periods and stopped or missed periods.</u>

【7】When do periods start?
----------------------

【8】Periods usually begin at around the age of 12, although some girls will start them earlier or later.

【9】A delay in starting periods isn't usually a cause for concern. Most girls will be having regular periods by age 16 to 18.
删除7：<u>Read more about early or delayed puberty.</u>

【10】Sanitary products
-----------------

【11】Sanitary products soak up or collect the blood released during your period. The main types of sanitary products are:

【12】*   sanitary pads
*   tampons
*   menstrual cups

【13】### Sanitary pads

【14】Sanitary pads are strips of padding that have a sticky side you attach to your underwear to hold them in place. One side of the pad is made of an absorbent material that soaks up the blood.

【15】Pads come in many sizes, so you can choose one to suit how heavy or light your period is.

【16】You can also get reusable washable pads.

【17】Pantyliners are a smaller and thinner type of sanitary pad that can be used on days when your period is very light.

【18】### Tampons

【19】Tampons are small tubes of cotton wool that you insert into your vagina to soak up the blood before it comes out of your body.

【20】There are 2 types of tampon – ones that come with an applicator and others without an applicator that you insert with your fingers. In both cases, there's a string at one end of the tampon, which you pull to remove it.

【21】Tampons come with instructions that explain how to use them. If the tampon is inserted correctly, you should not be able to feel it inside you. If you can feel it or it hurts, it might not be in properly.

【22】It is not possible for a tampon to get lost inside you. Your vagina holds it firmly in place and it expands inside you as it soaks up the blood.

【23】通用删除3(英):<u>For more information, read:</u>

【24】*   Can a tampon get lost inside me?
*   What if I forget to remove my tampon?

【25】### Menstrual cups

【26】Menstrual cups are an alternative to sanitary pads and tampons. The cup is made from silicone and you put it inside your vagina.

【27】Menstrual cups collect the blood rather than absorb it. Unlike tampons and most sanitary pads, which are thrown away after they've been used, you can wash menstrual cups and use them again.

【28】### Period underwear

【29】Period underwear are pants made from absorbent fabric. They soak up blood in the same way as sanitary pads, and have a layer to prevent leaks. They're designed to be washed and reused.

【30】PMS (premenstrual syndrome)
---------------------------

【31】Changes in your body's hormone levels before your period can cause physical and emotional changes.

【32】This is known as PMS (premenstrual syndrome) or PMT (premenstrual tension).

【33】There are many possible symptoms of PMS, but typical symptoms include:

【34】*   feeling bloated
*   breast tenderness
*   mood swings
*   feeling irritable
*   spotty skin
*   low sex drive (loss of libido)

【35】These symptoms usually improve when your period starts and disappear a few days afterwards. Not all women who have periods get PMS.

【36】Getting pregnant
----------------

【37】Working out when you can get pregnant – your fertile time – can be difficult. It's around the time you ovulate, which is about 12 to 16 days before the start of your next period.

【38】But sperm can survive inside a woman's body for up to 7 days before ovulation occurs. This means your fertile time extends back earlier in your cycle.

【39】You can calculate when your period will start and your peak ovulation times using an online period calendar.

【40】You cannot get pregnant if you do not ovulate. Some hormonal methods of contraception, such as the combined contraceptive pill, contraceptive patch and contraceptive injection, work by preventing ovulation.
删除7：<u>Read more about periods and fertility in the menstrual cycle, infertility, contraception and trying to get pregnant.</u>

【41】Changes in your periods
-----------------------

【42】Your periods can change – for example, they may last longer or get lighter. This does not necessarily mean there's a problem, but it does need to be investigated.

【43】You can see your GP, or visit your nearest women's clinic or contraceptive clinic.

【44】Bleeding between periods, bleeding after having sex, or bleeding after the menopause needs to be checked by a doctor.

【45】It might be caused by an infection, abnormalities in the neck of the womb (the cervix) or, in rare cases, it could be cancer.

【46】You could be pregnant if you miss a period and you've had sex. See your GP if you've taken a pregnancy test and the result is negative (you're not pregnant) and you've missed 3 consecutive periods.

【47】They will investigate the cause and recommend any necessary treatment.
删除7：<u>Read more about stopped or missed periods.</u>

【48】When do periods stop?
---------------------

【49】Your periods will continue until you reach the menopause, which usually happens when you are in your mid-40s to mid-50s. In the UK the average age of menopause is 51.

【50】Your periods will not usually stop suddenly when you go through the menopause. They may start to become less frequent over a few months or years before stopping altogether.
删除3：<u>Video: Menstrual cycle
----------------------

【51】This animation explains in detail how the menstrual cycle works.
删除1：<u>Media last reviewed: 21 October 2023  </u>删除1：<u>Media review due: 21 October 2026</u>

【52】</u>删除4：<u>Help us improve our website
---------------------------

【53】Can you answer a few questions about your visit today?

【54】Click here to take our survey

source_info.title: Amoxicillin
source_info.text:
【0】整页删除
Amoxicillin \- Brand name: Respillin
====================================
删除10：<u>On this page
------------

【1】1.  About amoxicillin
2.  Key facts
3.  Who can and cannot take amoxicillin
4.  How and when to take amoxicillin
5.  Side effects
6.  How to cope with side effects of amoxicillin
7.  Pregnancy and breastfeeding
8.  Cautions with other medicines
9.  Common questions about amoxicillin</u>

【2】1\. About amoxicillin
---------------------

【3】Amoxicillin is a penicillin antibiotic. It is used to treat bacterial infections, such as chest infections (including pneumonia) and dental abscesses. It can also be used together with other antibiotics and medicines to treat stomach ulcers.

【4】It's often prescribed for children, to treat ear infections and chest infections.

【5】Amoxicillin is only available on prescription. It comes as capsules or as a liquid that you swallow. It's also given by injection, but this is usually only done in hospital.

【6】2\. Key facts
-------------

【7】*   For most infections, you'll start to feel better in a few days.
*   The most common side effects of amoxicillin are feeling sick (nausea) and diarrhoea.
*   Liquid amoxicillin can stain your teeth. This does not last and is removed by brushing.
*   You can drink alcohol while taking amoxicillin.
*   Sometimes, taking amoxicillin can cause thrush.

【8】3\. Who can and cannot take amoxicillin
---------------------------------------

【9】Amoxicillin can be taken by most adults and children.
删除7：<u>Find out more about giving amoxicillin to children on the Medicines for Children website.</u>

【10】Amoxicillin is not suitable for everyone. To make sure amoxicillin is safe for you, tell your doctor if you:

【11】*   have ever had an allergic reaction to amoxicillin or penicillin or any other medicine
*   have liver or kidney problems
*   have recently had, or are due to have, any vaccinations

【12】4\. How and when to take amoxicillin
------------------------------------

【13】### Dosage

【14】The usual dose of amoxicillin capsules is 250mg to 500mg, taken 3 times a day. The dose may be lower for children.

【15】Amoxicillin liquid is available in 125mg and 250mg doses.

【16】#### Important

【17】Carry on taking this medicine until you've completed the course, even if you feel better. If you stop your treatment early, the infection could come back.

【18】### How to take it

【19】Try to space the doses evenly throughout the day. If you take it 3 times a day, this could be first thing in the morning, mid-afternoon and at bedtime.

【20】You can take amoxicillin before or after food.

【21】Swallow amoxicillin capsules whole with a drink of water. Do not chew or break them.

【22】Amoxicillin is available as a liquid for children and people who find it difficult to swallow capsules.

【23】If you or your child are taking liquid amoxicillin, it will usually be made up for you by your pharmacist. The medicine will come with a plastic syringe or spoon to help you measure out the right dose. If you do not have one, ask your pharmacist for one. Do not use a kitchen teaspoon as it will not measure the right amount.

【24】### If you forget to take it

【25】If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's nearly time for your next dose. In this case, just leave out the missed dose and take your next dose at the usual time.

【26】Never take 2 doses at the same time. Never take an extra dose to make up for a forgotten one.

【27】If you forget doses often, it may help to set an alarm to remind you. You could also ask your pharmacist for advice on other ways to remember your medicines.

【28】### If you take too much

【29】Taking an extra dose of amoxicillin is unlikely to harm you or your child, but speak to your pharmacist or doctor if you're worried.

【30】### Urgent advice: Contact 111 for advice now if:

【31】You have taken more than your prescribed dose of amoxicillin and have symptoms including:

【32】*   stomach pain or you're being sick
*   blood in your pee
*   difficulty peeing or producing less pee than usual

【33】Go to 111.nhs.uk or call 111

【34】5\. Side effects
----------------

【35】Like all medicines, amoxicillin can cause side effects, although not everyone gets them.

【36】### Common side effects

【37】These common side effects happen in around 1 in 10 people. Keep taking the medicine, but talk to your doctor or pharmacist if these side effects bother you or do not go away:

【38】*   feeling sick (nausea)
*   diarrhoea

【39】### Serious side effects

【40】Serious side effects are rare and happen in less than 1 in 1,000 people.

【41】Call a doctor or call 111 now if you get:

【42】*   diarrhoea (possibly with stomach cramps) that contains blood or mucus or severe diarrhoea that lasts for more than 4 days
*   pale poo and dark pee, and the whites of your eyes or your skin turn yellow (although this may be less obvious on brown or black skin) – these can be signs of liver or gallbladder problems
*   bruising or changes in your skin colour
*   joint or muscle pain that comes on after 2 days of taking the medicine
*   a skin rash with circular red patches (this may be less obvious on brown or black skin)

【43】Some of these serious side effects can happen up to 2 months after finishing the amoxicillin.

【44】#### Serious allergic reaction

【45】Around 1 in 15 people have an allergic reaction to amoxicillin.

【46】In most cases, the allergic reaction is mild and can take the form of a skin rash.

【47】Mild skin rashes can usually be treated by taking antihistamines.

【48】In rare cases, amoxicillin can cause a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).

【49】##### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【50】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【51】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【52】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【53】These are not all the side effects of amoxicillin. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicines packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【54】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>

【55】6\. How to cope with side effects of amoxicillin
------------------------------------------------

【56】**What to do about:**

【57】*   **feeling sick** – stick to simple meals and do not eat rich or spicy food. It might help to take your amoxicillin after a meal or snack.
*   **diarrhoea** – drink plenty of fluids, such as water or squash, to avoid dehydration. Signs of dehydration include peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee. Do not take any other medicines to treat diarrhoea without speaking to a pharmacist or doctor. If you take contraception and you have severe diarrhoea for more than 24 hours, your contraceptive pills may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【58】7\. Pregnancy and breastfeeding
-------------------------------

【59】### Amoxicillin and pregnancy

【60】It is safe to take amoxicillin during pregnancy.

【61】### Amoxicillin and breastfeeding

【62】It is OK to take amoxicillin while breastfeeding. Information shows that only tiny amounts of amoxicillin get into breast milk. Such levels would not be expected to cause side effects in your baby.

【63】Talk to your doctor, pharmacist, health visitor or midwife if:

【64】*   your baby is not feeding as well as usual
*   they have sickness or diarrhoea
*   your baby has oral thrush, or a skin rash
*   you have any other concerns about your baby

【65】通用删除3(英):<u>For more information about how amoxicillin can affect you and your baby during pregnancy, visit the Best Use of Medicines in Pregnancy (BUMPS) website.</u>

【66】8\. Cautions with other medicines
---------------------------------

【67】There are some medicines that do not mix well with amoxicillin.

【68】Tell your doctor if you're taking any of these medicines before you start taking amoxicillin:

【69】*   methotrexate, used to treat arthritis and psoriasis
*   warfarin, a medicine to prevent blood clots
*   gout medicines called probenecid or allopurinol
*   other antibiotics

【70】Tell your doctor if you've recently had, or are due to have, an oral typhoid vaccine. Amoxicillin can make it less effective.

【71】### Mixing amoxicillin with herbal remedies and supplements

【72】There is little information about taking herbal remedies and supplements alongside amoxicillin.

【73】### Important: Medicine safety

【74】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal medicines, vitamins or supplements.

【75】9\. Common questions about amoxicillin
--------------------------------------

【76】How does amoxicillin work?

【77】Amoxicillin is a penicillin antibiotic. It works by killing the bacteria that cause the infection.

【78】When will I feel better?

【79】For most infections, you should feel better within a few days.

【80】It's very important that you keep taking amoxicillin until your course is finished. Do this even if you feel better. It will help stop the infection coming back.

【81】What if I do not get better?

【82】Tell your doctor if you do not start feeling better after taking amoxicillin for 3 days. Also tell them if, at any time, you start to feel worse.

【83】Will it give me thrush?

【84】Some people get a fungal infection called thrush after taking a course of antibiotics like amoxicillin. If you think you have thrush, speak to your pharmacist or ask your doctor for advice.

【85】How does amoxicillin compare with other antibiotics?

【86】Amoxicillin and other penicillins, like phenoxymethylpenicillin, are antibiotics that are widely used to treat a variety of infections, including skin, dental, throat and chest infections.

【87】Not all antibiotics are suitable for every infection. Your doctor will choose an antibiotic that's suitable for the type of infection you have. Speak to your pharmacist or doctor if you have any questions.

【88】Will it affect my contraception?

【89】Amoxicillin does not stop contraceptive pills working, including the combined pill or emergency contraception.

【90】However, if amoxicillin makes you sick (vomit) or have severe diarrhoea for more than 24 hours, your contraceptive pills may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【91】Find about more about what to do if you're on the pill and you're being sick or have diarrhoea.

【92】Will it affect my fertility?

【93】There's no evidence to suggest that taking amoxicillin reduces fertility in either men or women.

【94】Does it stain teeth?

【95】If you or your child take amoxicillin as a liquid medicine, it can stain your teeth. This does not last and should go after brushing your teeth well.

【96】Amoxicillin capsules do not stain teeth.

【97】Can I drive or ride a bike?

【98】Yes. Amoxicillin should not affect you being able to drive or cycle.

【99】Is there any food or drink I need to avoid?

【100】You can eat and drink normally while taking amoxicillin.

【101】Can I drink alcohol with it?

【102】Yes, you can drink alcohol with amoxicillin.
删除11：<u>Related conditions
------------------

【103】*   Chest infection
*   Dental abscess
*   Ear infections
*   Stomach ulcer
</u>删除11：<u>Useful resources
----------------

【104】*   HealthUnlocked: amoxicillin forum
*   British Lung Foundation: charity
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 12 November 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 12 November 2024</u>

*   bruising or changes in your skin colour
*   joint or muscle pain that comes on after 2 days of taking the medicine
*   a skin rash with circular red patches (this may be less obvious on brown or black skin)

【43】Some of these serious side effects can happen up to 2 months after finishing the amoxicillin.

【44】#### Serious allergic reaction

【45】Around 1 in 15 people have an allergic reaction to amoxicillin.

【46】In most cases, the allergic reaction is mild and can take the form of a skin rash.

【47】Mild skin rashes can usually be treated by taking antihistamines.

【48】In rare cases, amoxicillin can cause a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).

【49】##### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【50】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【51】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【52】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【53】These are not all the side effects of amoxicillin. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicines packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【54】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>

【55】6\. How to cope with side effects of amoxicillin
------------------------------------------------

【56】**What to do about:**

【57】*   **feeling sick** – stick to simple meals and do not eat rich or spicy food. It might help to take your amoxicillin after a meal or snack.
*   **diarrhoea** – drink plenty of fluids, such as water or squash, to avoid dehydration. Signs of dehydration include peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee. Do not take any other medicines to treat diarrhoea without speaking to a pharmacist or doctor. If you take contraception and you have severe diarrhoea for more than 24 hours, your contraceptive pills may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【58】7\. Pregnancy and breastfeeding
-------------------------------

【59】### Amoxicillin and pregnancy

【60】It is safe to take amoxicillin during pregnancy.

【61】### Amoxicillin and breastfeeding

【62】It is OK to take amoxicillin while breastfeeding. Information shows that only tiny amounts of amoxicillin get into breast milk. Such levels would not be expected to cause side effects in your baby.

【63】Talk to your doctor, pharmacist, health visitor or midwife if:

【64】*   your baby is not feeding as well as usual
*   they have sickness or diarrhoea
*   your baby has oral thrush, or a skin rash
*   you have any other concerns about your baby

【65】通用删除3(英):<u>For more information about how amoxicillin can affect you and your baby during pregnancy, visit the Best Use of Medicines in Pregnancy (BUMPS) website.</u>

【66】8\. Cautions with other medicines
---------------------------------

【67】There are some medicines that do not mix well with amoxicillin.

【68】Tell your doctor if you're taking any of these medicines before you start taking amoxicillin:

【69】*   methotrexate, used to treat arthritis and psoriasis
*   warfarin, a medicine to prevent blood clots
*   gout medicines called probenecid or allopurinol
*   other antibiotics

【70】Tell your doctor if you've recently had, or are due to have, an oral typhoid vaccine. Amoxicillin can make it less effective.

【71】### Mixing amoxicillin with herbal remedies and supplements

【72】There is little information about taking herbal remedies and supplements alongside amoxicillin.

【73】### Important: Medicine safety

【74】Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking any other medicines, including herbal medicines, vitamins or supplements.

【75】9\. Common questions about amoxicillin
--------------------------------------

【76】How does amoxicillin work?

【77】Amoxicillin is a penicillin antibiotic. It works by killing the bacteria that cause the infection.

【78】When will I feel better?

【79】For most infections, you should feel better within a few days.

【80】It's very important that you keep taking amoxicillin until your course is finished. Do this even if you feel better. It will help stop the infection coming back.

【81】What if I do not get better?

【82】Tell your doctor if you do not start feeling better after taking amoxicillin for 3 days. Also tell them if, at any time, you start to feel worse.

【83】Will it give me thrush?

【84】Some people get a fungal infection called thrush after taking a course of antibiotics like amoxicillin. If you think you have thrush, speak to your pharmacist or ask your doctor for advice.

【85】How does amoxicillin compare with other antibiotics?

【86】Amoxicillin and other penicillins, like phenoxymethylpenicillin, are antibiotics that are widely used to treat a variety of infections, including skin, dental, throat and chest infections.

【87】Not all antibiotics are suitable for every infection. Your doctor will choose an antibiotic that's suitable for the type of infection you have. Speak to your pharmacist or doctor if you have any questions.

【88】Will it affect my contraception?

【89】Amoxicillin does not stop contraceptive pills working, including the combined pill or emergency contraception.

【90】However, if amoxicillin makes you sick (vomit) or have severe diarrhoea for more than 24 hours, your contraceptive pills may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet to find out what to do.

【91】Find about more about what to do if you're on the pill and you're being sick or have diarrhoea.

【92】Will it affect my fertility?

【93】There's no evidence to suggest that taking amoxicillin reduces fertility in either men or women.

【94】Does it stain teeth?

【95】If you or your child take amoxicillin as a liquid medicine, it can stain your teeth. This does not last and should go after brushing your teeth well.

【96】Amoxicillin capsules do not stain teeth.

【97】Can I drive or ride a bike?

【98】Yes. Amoxicillin should not affect you being able to drive or cycle.

【99】Is there any food or drink I need to avoid?

【100】You can eat and drink normally while taking amoxicillin.

【101】Can I drink alcohol with it?

【102】Yes, you can drink alcohol with amoxicillin.
删除11：<u>Related conditions
------------------

【103】*   Chest infection
*   Dental abscess
*   Ear infections
*   Stomach ulcer
</u>删除11：<u>Useful resources
----------------

【104】*   HealthUnlocked: amoxicillin forum
*   British Lung Foundation: charity

source_info.title: Angioplasty, see Coronary angioplasty and stent insertion
source_info.text:
【0】Angioplasty, see Coronary angioplasty and stent insertion
Overview \- Coronary angioplasty and stent insertion
====================================================
删除10：<u>Contents
--------

【1】1.  Overview
2.  How it's performed
3.  Recovery
4.  Risks
5.  Alternatives</u>

【2】**A coronary angioplasty is a procedure used to widen blocked or narrowed coronary arteries (the main blood vessels supplying the heart).**

【3】The term "angioplasty" means using a balloon to stretch open a narrowed or blocked artery. However, most modern angioplasty procedures also involve inserting a short wire mesh tube, called a stent, into the artery during the procedure. The stent is left in place permanently to allow blood to flow more freely.

【4】Coronary angioplasty is sometimes known as percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA). The combination of coronary angioplasty with stenting is usually referred to as percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

【5】When a coronary angioplasty is used
-----------------------------------

【6】Like all organs in the body, the heart needs a constant supply of blood. This is supplied by the coronary arteries.

【7】In some people, these arteries can become narrowed and hardened (known as atherosclerosis), which can cause coronary heart disease.

【8】If the flow of blood to the heart becomes restricted, it can lead to chest pain known as angina, which is usually triggered by physical activity or stress.

【9】While angina can often be treated with medication, a coronary angioplasty may be required to restore the blood supply to the heart in severe cases where medication is ineffective.

【10】Coronary angioplasties are also often used as an emergency treatment after a heart attack.

【11】What are the benefits of a coronary angioplasty?
------------------------------------------------

【12】In most cases, the blood flow through the coronary arteries improves after an angioplasty. Many people find their symptoms get significantly better and they're able to do more than they could before the procedure.

【13】If you've had a heart attack, an angioplasty can increase your chances of surviving more than clot-busting medication (thrombolysis). The procedure can also reduce your chances of having another heart attack in the future.

【14】How a coronary angioplasty is performed
---------------------------------------

【15】A coronary angioplasty is performed using local anaesthetic, which means you'll be awake while the procedure is carried out.

【16】A thin, flexible tube called a catheter will be inserted into one of your arteries through an incision in your groin, wrist or arm. This is guided to the affected coronary artery using an X-ray video.

【17】When the catheter is in place, a thin wire is guided down the length of the affected coronary artery, delivering a small balloon to the affected section of artery. This is then inflated to widen the artery, squashing fatty deposits against the artery wall so blood can flow through it more freely when the deflated balloon is removed.

【18】If a stent is being used, this will be around the balloon before it's inserted. The stent will expand when the balloon is inflated and remains in place when the balloon is deflated and removed.

【19】A coronary angioplasty usually takes between 30 minutes and 2 hours. If you're being treated for angina, you'll normally be able to go home later the same day or the day after you have the procedure. You'll need to avoid heavy lifting, strenuous activities and driving for at least a week.

【20】If you've been admitted to hospital following a heart attack, you may need to stay in hospital for several days after the angioplasty procedure before going home.
删除7：<u>Read more about: </u>

【21】*   What happens during a coronary angioplasty
*   Recovering from a coronary angioplasty

【22】How safe is a coronary angioplasty?
-----------------------------------

【23】A coronary angioplasty is 1 of the most common types of treatment for the heart.

【24】As the procedure doesn't involve making major incisions in the body, it's usually carried out safely in most people. Doctors refer to this as a minimally invasive form of treatment.

【25】The risk of serious complications from a coronary angioplasty is generally small, but this depends on factors such as:

【26】*   your age
*   your general health
*   whether you've had a heart attack

【27】Serious problems that can occur as a result of the procedure include:

【28】*   excessive bleeding
*   a heart attack
*   a stroke
删除7：<u>Read more about the possible complications of a coronary angioplasty.</u>

【29】Are there any alternatives?
---------------------------

【30】If many coronary arteries have become blocked and narrowed, or the structure of your arteries is abnormal, a coronary artery bypass graft may be considered.

【31】This is a type of invasive surgery where sections of healthy blood vessel are taken from other parts of the body and attached to the coronary arteries. Blood is diverted through these vessels, so it bypasses the narrowed or clogged parts of the arteries.
删除7：<u>Read more about the alternatives to a coronary angioplasty.</u>
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 04 October 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 04 October 2025</u>
删除1：<u>*   Next : How it's performed</u>

source_info.title: Stretch marks
source_info.text:
【0】Stretch marks
=============

【1】**Stretch marks are very common. They're harmless and often get less visible over time.**

【2】Check if you have stretch marks
-------------------------------

【3】Stretch marks look like lines or streaks across the skin.

【4】Stretch marks can be pink, red, brown, black, silver or purple. They usually start off darker and fade over time.
删除9：<u>Credit:

【5】Michael Heim / Alamy Stock Photo https://www.alamy.com/stock-photo-woman-displaying-stretch-marks-on-her-abdomen-after-pregnancy-caused-90328374.html?pv=1&stamp=2&imageid=8CD2F7A0-4F23-46C7-B795-6746E63CD78D&p=278143&n=0&orientation=0&pn=1&searchtype=0&IsFromSearch=1&srch=foo%3dbar%26st%3d0%26pn%3d1%26ps%3d100%26sortby%3d2%26resultview%3dsortbyPopular%26npgs%3d0%26qt%3dF6XPNA%26qt\_raw%3dF6XPNA%26lic%3d3%26mr%3d0%26pr%3d0%26ot%3d0%26creative%3d%26ag%3d0%26hc%3d0%26pc%3d%26blackwhite%3d%26cutout%3d%26tbar%3d1%26et%3d0x000000000000000000000%26vp%3d0%26loc%3d0%26imgt%3d0%26dtfr%3d%26dtto%3d%26size%3d0xFF%26archive%3d1%26groupid%3d%26pseudoid%3d32846%26a%3d%26cdid%3d%26cdsrt%3d%26name%3d%26qn%3d%26apalib%3d%26apalic%3d%26lightbox%3d%26gname%3d%26gtype%3d%26xstx%3d0%26simid%3d%26saveQry%3d%26editorial%3d1%26nu%3d%26t%3d%26edoptin%3d%26customgeoip%3d%26cap%3d1%26cbstore%3d1%26vd%3d0%26lb%3d%26fi%3d2%26edrf%3d1%26ispremium%3d1%26flip%3d0%26pl%3d</u>

【6】Stretch marks are most common on the tummy, breasts, chest, upper arms, legs, bottom, hips or back.
删除9：<u>Credit:

【7】SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY https://www.sciencephoto.com/media/481108/view</u>

【8】Common causes of stretch marks
------------------------------

【9】Stretch marks are often caused by sudden growth or weight gain.

【10】You may be more likely to get them if you:

【11】*   are pregnant
*   are going through puberty
*   lose or gain weight quickly
*   are female
*   are overweight
*   use some kinds of steroid creams or tablets
*   have a family member with stretch marks

【12】Rarely, stretch marks can be due to a condition called Cushing's syndrome.
删除5：<u>Information:
删除7：<u>Find out more about stretch marks in pregnancy</u></u>

【13】What to do about stretch marks
------------------------------

【14】Stretch marks usually fade over time but may not disappear completely.

【15】Many creams and lotions claim to prevent, reduce or remove stretch marks. But there's very little evidence these work.

【16】There are some treatments that may help make stretch marks look better, but they will not get rid of them.

【17】They include:

【18】*   retinoid (often called tretinoin) creams or hyaluronic acid – these may help if used on new stretch marks, but you should not use retinoid creams if you're pregnant as they may harm your baby
*   light or laser treatments
*   microdermabrasion, which removes a thin layer of skin

【19】You would need to pay for these treatments as they're not available on the NHS.

【20】Information:

【21】It's not always possible to prevent stretch marks. The best way to reduce your chance of getting them is by maintaining a healthy weight.

【22】Non-urgent advice: See a GP if:
-------------------------------

【23】You have large stretch marks and:

【24】*   more fat on your chest and tummy, but slim arms and legs
*   a build-up of fat on the back of your neck and shoulders
*   a red, puffy, rounded face

【25】These could be symptoms of Cushing's syndrome.
删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 07 December 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 07 December 2024</u>

source_info.title: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
source_info.text:
【0】Dosage - Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
========================================================

【1】**When prescribing selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), your doctor will usually select the lowest possible dose thought necessary to improve your symptoms.**

【2】This approach is intended to reduce the risk of side effects. If the prescribed dose proves ineffective, it can be gradually increased.

【3】SSRIs are usually taken in tablet form. Depending on the type of SSRI prescribed and the severity of your depression, you'll usually have to take 1 to 3 tablets, once a day.

【4】It will usually take 2 to 4 weeks before you begin to notice the effects of SSRIs. You'll have regular meetings with your doctor when you first start taking SSRIs and you should let them know if you haven't noticed any improvement after 4 to 6 weeks. They may recommend increasing your dose or trying an alternative antidepressant.

【5】It's usually recommended that a course of SSRIs continues for at least 6 months after you feel better, to prevent your condition coming back when you stop. However, if you've experienced previous episodes of depression, a 2-year course may be recommended. Some people with recurring problems are advised to carry on taking medicine indefinitely.

【6】Missed or extra doses
---------------------

【7】It's important not to miss any of your doses, because this could make your treatment less effective.

【8】If you do miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's almost time to take your next dose, in which case you should just skip the missed dose. Don't take a double dose to make up for the one you missed.

【9】If you take more tablets than prescribed, contact your GP as soon as possible for advice. If this isn't possible, contact your local out of hours service, or call NHS 111.

【10】Taking a double dose is unlikely to be harmful, but you should only do so if advised by a medical professional.

【11】Stopping SSRIs
--------------

【12】You shouldn't suddenly stop taking SSRIs, even if you feel better. Stopping suddenly can lead to withdrawal symptoms such as:

【13】*   stomach ache
*   flu-like symptoms 
*   anxiety
*   dizziness
*   sensations in the body that feel like electric shocks
*   seizures (fits)

【14】If your GP or mental health specialist decides to stop your course of SSRIs, they'll reduce the dose gradually over a few weeks.
删除11：<u>More in Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
-------------------------------------------------------

【15】*   Overview - Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
*   Cautions - Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
*   Dosage - Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
*   Side effects - Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 8 December 2021  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 8 December 2024</u>

source_info.title: Hydroxychloroquine
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of hydroxychloroquine \- Brand name: Quinoric
==========================================================

【1】Like all medicines, hydroxychloroquine can cause side effects, although not everyone gets them.

【2】Side effects are more likely when you first start taking it or when your dose is increased. You'll usually feel better after a week or two.

【3】Common side effects
-------------------

【4】These common side effects of hydroxychloroquine happen in more than 1 in 100 people. There are things you can do to help cope with them:

【5】Stomach pain

【6】Try to rest and relax. It can help to eat and drink slowly and have smaller and more frequent meals. Putting a heat pad or covered hot water bottle on your stomach may also help.

【7】If you are in a lot of pain, speak to your pharmacist or doctor.

【8】Feeling or being sick (nausea or vomiting)

【9】Stick to simple meals and do not eat rich or spicy food. Take your hydroxychloroquine with food. If you're being sick, try small frequent sips of water to avoid dehydration. Signs of dehydration include peeing less than usual or having dark, strong-smelling pee.

【10】If you take contraceptive pills and you're being sick, your contraception may not protect you from pregnancy. Check the pill packet for advice.

【11】Skin rashes and itchy skin

【12】Try not to scratch your skin as this will make it worse. Hold something cool on your skin, like a damp towel. Have cool or warm baths or showers, but do not spend a long time in the bath or shower. Use an unperfumed moisturiser regularly.

【13】You can ask your pharmacist to recommend products to help with itchy skin, such as creams, lotions or antihistamines.

【14】Loss of appetite

【15】Eat when you would usually expect to be hungry. If it helps, eat smaller meals more often than usual. Have nutritious snacks that are high in calories and protein, such as dried fruit and nuts.

【16】Headache

【17】Make sure you rest and drink plenty of fluids. Do not drink too much alcohol. Ask your pharmacist to recommend a painkiller.

【18】Talk to your doctor if headaches last longer than a week or are severe.

【19】Speak to a doctor or pharmacist if the advice on how to cope does not help and a side effect is still bothering you or does not go away.

【20】Serious side effects
--------------------

【21】Some people have a serious side effect from hydroxychloroquine.

【22】Tell your doctor or call 111 straight away if you get:

【23】*   any eye problems, including changes in the colour of your eye or problems with your eyesight such as blurred vision, sensitivity to light or changes to the way you see colour
*   muscle weakness, cramps, stiffness or spasms, or changes in how your skin feels such as tingling
*   frequent infections with a high temperature, sore throat or mouth ulcers
*   bruising that happens more easily than usual
*   signs of low blood sugar (hypoglycaemia), such as sweating or feeling dizzy, shaky or anxious
*   skin reactions such as a large area of scaly skin, pus-filled spots together with a high temperature, or your skin becoming more red than usual and being more sensitive to the sun (this may be less obvious on brown or black skin)
*   irrational thoughts, feeling anxious, seeing things that are not real (hallucinations), feeling confused or feeling depressed, including thoughts of self harm even if you have never had similar problems before

【24】### Serious allergic reaction

【25】In rare cases, hydroxychloroquine may cause a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).

【26】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【27】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【28】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【29】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【30】Long-term side effects
----------------------

【31】If you take hydroxychloroquine for a long time, your doctor will monitor you to check for any long-term side effects.

【32】For example you may have regular full blood counts (tests to check the types and numbers of cells in your blood) and eye examinations.

【33】Your doctor will occasionally check your muscles and tendons to make sure they are working properly.

【34】Other side effects
------------------

【35】These are not all the side effects of hydroxychloroquine. For a full list see the leaflet inside your medicine packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【36】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Hydroxychloroquine
--------------------------

【37】*   About hydroxychloroquine
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking hydroxychloroquine with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 8 June 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 8 June 2025</u>

source_info.title: Zopiclone
source_info.text:
【0】Side effects of zopiclone
=========================

【1】Like all medicines, zopiclone can cause side effects, but not everyone gets them.

【2】Common side effects
-------------------

【3】These common side effects of zopiclone happen in more than 1 in 100 people. There are things you can do to help cope with them:

【4】A bitter or metallic taste in your mouth or a dry mouth

【5】Try taking sips of water and keep some water by your bed at night. Using a mouthwash before bedtime may also help.

【6】Ask your pharmacist to recommend one that's good for a dry mouth, as some can make a dry mouth worse.

【7】Feeling sleepy or tired the next day

【8】Do not drive, cycle or use tools or machinery if you're feeling this way. Do not drink any alcohol as it will make you feel more tired.

【9】Speak to a doctor or pharmacist if the advice on how to cope does not help and a side effect is still bothering you or does not go away.

【10】Serious side effects
--------------------

【11】It happens rarely, but some people have serious side effects when taking zopiclone.

【12】Call your doctor or call 111 as soon as possible if you:

【13】*   get a poor memory (amnesia)
*   see or hear things that are not real (hallucinations)
*   fall over, especially if you're over 65 years of age
*   think things that are not true (delusions)
*   feel low or sad (have depression)

【14】### Serious allergic reaction

【15】In rare cases, it's possible to have a serious allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) to zopiclone.

【16】#### Immediate action required: Call 999 now if:

【17】*   your lips, mouth, throat or tongue suddenly become swollen
*   you're breathing very fast or struggling to breathe (you may become very wheezy or feel like you're choking or gasping for air)
*   your throat feels tight or you're struggling to swallow
*   your skin, tongue or lips turn blue, grey or pale (if you have black or brown skin, this may be easier to see on the palms of your hands or soles of your feet)
*   you suddenly become very confused, drowsy or dizzy
*   someone faints and cannot be woken up
*   a child is limp, floppy or not responding like they normally do (their head may fall to the side, backwards or forwards, or they may find it difficult to lift their head or focus on your face)

【18】You or the person who's unwell may also have a rash that's swollen, raised, itchy, blistered or peeling.

【19】These can be signs of a serious allergic reaction and may need immediate treatment in hospital.

【20】Other side effects
------------------

【21】These are not all the side effects of zopiclone. For a full list, see the leaflet inside your medicines packet.
删除5：<u>Information:

【22】You can report any suspected side effect using the Yellow Card safety scheme.
删除12：<u>Visit Yellow Card for further information.</u></u>
删除11：<u>More in Zopiclone
-----------------

【23】*   About zopiclone
*   Who can and cannot take it
*   How and when to take it
*   Side effects
*   Pregnancy, breastfeeding and fertility
*   Taking zopiclone with other medicines and herbal supplements
*   Common questions
</u>删除1：<u>Page last reviewed: 18 February 2022  </u>删除1：<u>Next review due: 18 February 2025</u>

source_info.title: Migraine
source_info.text:
【0】Migraine
========

【1】**A migraine usually feels like a very bad headache with a throbbing pain on 1 side. It's common and there are things you can try to help.**

【2】Check if it's a migraine
------------------------

【3】A migraine tends to be a very bad headache with a throbbing pain on 1 side of the head.

【4】You may get other symptoms just before a migraine, such as:

【5】*   feeling very tired and yawning a lot
*   craving certain foods or feeling thirsty
*   changes in your mood
*   a stiff neck
*   peeing more

【6】You may also get warning signs you're about to have a migraine (called an aura), such as:

【7】*   problems with your sight, such as seeing zigzag lines or flashing lights
*   numbness or a tingling that feels like pins and needles
*   feeling dizzy
*   difficulty speaking

【8】Aura symptoms should not last for longer than an hour.

【9】There are different types of migraine with different symptoms.

【10】Types of migraine

| Symptoms | Migraine type |
| --- | --- |
| SymptomsNo warning signs  | Migraine typeMigraine without aura  |
| SymptomsWarning signs like seeing zigzag lines, numbness or tingling, feeling dizzy or difficulty speaking just before the migraine starts  | Migraine typeMigraine with aura  |
| SymptomsSymptoms like flashing lights, but no headache  | Migraine typeMigraine aura without headache (silent migraine)  |

【12】Migraines usually last between 2 hours and 3 days, with some symptoms (such as feeling very tired) starting up to 2 days before the head pain starts and finishing after the headache stops.

【13】Some people have migraines several times a week, while others do not have them very often.

【14】Most people find their migraines slowly get better as they get older.

【15】Non-urgent advice: See a GP if:
-------------------------------

【16】*   your migraines are severe or getting worse, or lasting longer than usual
*   you have migraines more than once a week
*   you're finding it difficult to control your migraines

【17】What we mean by severe pain

【18】Severe pain:

【19】*   always there and so bad it's hard to think or talk
*   you cannot sleep
*   it's very hard to move, get out of bed, go to the bathroom, wash or dress

【20】Moderate pain:

【21】*   always there
*   makes it hard to concentrate or sleep
*   you can manage to get up, wash or dress

【22】Mild pain:

【23】*   comes and goes
*   is annoying but does not stop you doing daily activities

【24】Urgent advice: Ask for an urgent GP appointment or get help from NHS 111 if:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

【25】You have a migraine and:

【26】*   it's lasted longer than 72 hours
*   aura symptoms last longer than an hour at a time
*   you're pregnant or just had a baby

【27】You can call 111 or get help from 111 online.

【28】Immediate action required: Call 999 if you or your child:
---------------------------------------------------------

【29】*   have a headache that came on suddenly and is extremely painful
*   have problems speaking or remembering things
*   lose your vision or have blurred or double vision
*   feel drowsy or confused
*   have a seizure or fit
*   have a very high temperature and symptoms of meningitis
*   cannot move or have weakness in the arms or legs on 1 side of your body, or 1 side of your face

【30】Treatment for migraines
-----------------------

【31】Migraine treatments include:

【32】*   painkillers such as ibuprofen and paracetamol
*   medicines called triptans
*   medicines that stop you feeling sick or being sick

【33】You may have to try a combination of medicines before you find something that works.

【34】A GP may also recommend making changes to your lifestyle to help manage your migraines, such as eating at regular times and drinking less caffeine.

【35】If your migraines are severe, you might be offered other things to help, such as learning relaxation techniques and acupuncture.

【36】If these treatments do not manage your migraines or they're getting worse, you may be referred to a specialist for further tests and treatment.

【37】### Important

【38】Try not to take high doses of painkillers too often as this could make it harder to treat your migraines.

【39】Causes of migraines
-------------------

【40】It's not known what causes migraines.

【41】You're more likely to get them if you have a close family member who gets them.

【42】Some people find certain triggers can cause migraines, such as:

【43】*   starting their period
*   anxiety and depression
*   stress and tiredness
*   not eating regularly or skipping meals
*   too much caffeine
*   not getting enough exercise

【44】It can help to keep a migraine diary to help you work out what might trigger your migraines.

【45】Things you can do to ease or reduce migraines
---------------------------------------------

【46】There are things you can do yourself to manage your migraines, with help and advice from a GP.

【47】### Do

【48】*   try sleeping or lying down in a darkened room during a migraine

【49】*   try to avoid things you know trigger your migraines, such as certain foods

【50】*   stay well hydrated and limit how much caffeine and alcohol you drink

【51】*   try to keep to a healthy weight

【52】*   eat meals at regular times

【53】*   get regular exercise

【54】*   get plenty of sleep

【55】*   try to manage your stress

【56】删除6：<u>Information:

【57】Find out more
-------------

【58】*   The Migraine Trust: about migraine

【59】</u>
### Migraine

【60】Migraines affect 6 million people in the UK. Identifying and avoiding the things that trigger migraines is an important part of managing them, says Dr Dawn Harper.
